original: somasya mā tavasaṃ vakṣyagne vahniṃ cakartha vidathe yajadhyai
analyzed: somasya mā tavasam vakṣi agne vahnim cakartha vidathe yajadhyai
translated: O Agni, thou hast made Soma's strength to be carried, and the bearer, in the assembly, to be worshipped

original: devānachā dīdyad yuñje adriṃ śamāye agne tanvaṃjuṣasva
analyzed: devān achā dīdyat yuñje adrim śamāye agne tanvam juṣasva
translated: Thou hast yoked the shining stone to carry the gods. O Agni, be thou pleased with our bodies

original: prāñcaṃ yajñaṃ cakṛma vardhatāṃ gīḥ samidbhiragniṃ namasā duvasyan
analyzed: prāñcam yajñam cakṛma vardhatām gīḥ samidbhiḥ agnim namasā duvasyan
translated: We have made the sacrifice to go forward. Let the praise be increased. Honour Agni with fuel and reverence

original: divaḥ śaśāsurvidathā kavīnāṃ gṛtsāya cit tavase gātumīṣuḥ
analyzed: divaḥ śaśāsuḥ vidathā kavīnām gṛtsāya cit tavase gātum īṣuḥ
translated: The sages have ordered the ordinances from heaven. Even for the strong Gritsa they have desired a way

original: mayo dadhe medhiraḥ pūtadakṣo divaḥ subandhurjanuṣā pṛthivyāḥ
analyzed: mayaḥ dadhe medhiraḥ pūta dakṣaḥ divaḥ su bandhuḥ januṣā pṛthivyāḥ
translated: The wise one, of pure power, has laid up splendour, a good friend of heaven by birth, of earth

original: avindannu darśatamapsvantardevāso agnimapasi svasṝṇām
analyzed: avindan u darśatam apsu antar devāsaḥ agnim apasi svasṝṇām
translated: The gods have found the most visible Agni in the waters, the brother of his own sisters

original: avardhayan subhagaṃ sapta yahvīḥ śvetaṃ jajñānamaruṣammahitvā🔽śiśuṃ na jātamabhyāruraśvā devāso agniṃjaniman vapuṣyan
analyzed: avardhayan subhagam sapta yahvīḥ śvetam jajñānam aruṣam mahitvā  śiśum na jātam abhyāruḥ aśvāḥ devāsaḥ agniṃjaniman vapuṣyan
translated: They have increased the prosperous one, the seven young ones, the white one, mighty in majesty, at birth🔽The horses have mounted the newly-born child, the gods, making Agni beautiful in his birth

original: śukrebhiraṅgai raja ātatanvān kratuṃ punānaḥ kavibhiḥ pavitraiḥ🔽śocirvasānaḥ paryāyurapāṃ śriyo mimīte bṛhatīranūnāḥ
analyzed: śukrebhiḥ aṅgaiḥ rajaḥ ātatanvān kratum punānaḥ kavibhiḥ pavitraiḥ  śociḥ vasānaḥ paryāyuḥ apām śriyaḥ mimīte bṛhatīḥ anūnāḥ
translated: With his bright limbs he has stretched out in the realm, purifying his will with the purifying sages🔽Wearing his flame, passing through the waters, he measures out his great, unimpaired glories

original: vavrājā sīmanadatīradabdhā divo yahvīravasānā anagnāḥ
analyzed: vavrāja sīmanadatīḥ adabdhāḥ divaḥ yahvīḥ avasānāḥ anagnāḥ
translated: The young, undecaying, rushing ones of heaven have gone forth, uttering their laws, naked, unburnt

original: sanā atra yuvatayaḥ sayonīrekaṃ garbhaṃ dadhire sapta vāṇīḥ
analyzed: sanāḥ atra yuvatayaḥ sayonīḥ ekam garbham dadhire sapta vāṇīḥ
translated: The ancient maidens, of the same womb, have conceived one embryo, the seven tongues.

original: stīrṇā asya saṃhato viśvarūpā ghṛtasya yonau sravathe madhūnām
analyzed: stīrṇāḥ asya saṃhataḥ viśva rūpāḥ ghṛtasya yonau sravathe madhūnām
translated: His are the strewn, the gathered, the all-formed, in the womb of ghee flow the juices of honey.

original: asthuratra dhenavaḥ pinvamānā mahī dasmasya mātarā samīcī
analyzed: asthuḥ atra dhenavaḥ pinvamānāḥ mahī dasmasya mātarā samīcī
translated: Here have come the swelling cows, the two mighty mothers of the wondrous one, in unison.

original: babhrāṇaḥ sūno sahaso vyadyaud dādhānaḥ śukrā rabhasā vapūṃṣi
analyzed: babhrāṇaḥ sūno sahasaḥ vyadyaut dādhānaḥ śukrā rabhasā vapūṃṣi
translated: The son of strength hath shone forth, spreading his bright and swift forms, placing them.

original: ścotanti dhārā madhuno ghṛtasya vṛṣā yatra vāvṛdhe kāvyena
analyzed: ścotanti dhārāḥ madhunaḥ ghṛtasya vṛṣā yatra vāvṛdhe kāvyena
translated: The streams of honey and ghee flow there, where the bull hath grown by his wisdom.

original: pituścidūdharjanuṣā viveda vyasya dhārā asṛjad vi dhenāḥ
analyzed: viveda vi asya dhārāḥ asṛjat vi dhenāḥ
translated: He hath known even his father's breast by his youth, he hath sent forth his streams, his thoughts, in separation.

original: guhā carantaṃ sakhibhiḥ śivebhirdivo yahvībhirnaguhā babhūva
analyzed: guhā carantam sakhibhiḥ śivebhiḥ divaḥ yahvībhiḥ naguhā babhūva
translated: He who moveth in the secret place with his auspicious friends, hath not been hidden by the young ones of the sky.

original: pituśca garbhaṃ janituśca babhre pūrvīreko adhayat pīpyānāḥ
analyzed: pituḥ ca garbham janituḥ ca babhre pūrvīḥ ekaḥ adhayat pīpyānāḥ
translated: He hath taken to himself the many swelling ones, the embryo of the father and the mother, the one.

original: vṛṣṇe sapatnī śucaye sabandhū ubhe asmai manuṣyeni pāhi🔽urau mahānanibādhe vavardhāpo agniṃ yaśasaḥ saṃ hi pūrvīḥ
analyzed: vṛṣṇe sapatnī śucaye sabandhū ubhe asmai manuṣyeni pāhi  urau mahān anibādhe vavardha apaḥ agnim yaśasaḥ sam hi pūrvīḥ
translated: Protect him from the two human wives, the Vr̥ishni and the Sapatni, the pure and the related.🔽In the wide, uncovered place he hath grown great, the many glorious waters have generated Agni.

original: ṛtasya yonāvaśayad damūnā jāmīnāmagnirapasisvasṝṇām
analyzed: ṛtasya yonau aśayat damūnāḥ jāmīnām agniḥ apasi svasṝṇām
translated: He, the guest, hath lain in the womb of holy order, Agni among the sisters, the Jâmis.

original: akro na babhriḥ samithe mahīnāṃ didṛkṣeyaḥ sūnave bhāṛjīkaḥ
analyzed: akraḥ na babhriḥ samithe mahīnām didṛkṣeyaḥ sūnave bhāṛjīkaḥ
translated: The unassailable, the brown one, in the gathering of the great, he who is to be looked for, the bountiful one, to the son

original: udusriyā janitā yo jajānāpāṃ garbho nṛtamo yahvo agniḥ
analyzed: udusriyāḥ janitā yaḥ jajāna apām garbhaḥ nṛtamaḥ yahvaḥ agniḥ
translated: The one who begot the cows, who was born, the embryo of the waters, the youthful Agni, the best of men

original: apāṃ garbhaṃ darśatamoṣadhīnāṃ vanā jajāna subhagā virūpam
analyzed: apām garbham darśatam oṣadhīnām vanā jajāna subhagā virūpam
translated: The embryo of the waters, the most visible of the plants, the forest gave birth to the well-favored, the strange one

original: devāsaścin manasā saṃ hi jagmuḥ paniṣṭhaṃ jātaṃ tavasaṃ duvasyan🔽bṛhanta id bhānavo bhāṛjīkamagniṃ sacanta vidyuto na śukrāḥ
analyzed: devāsaḥ cit manasā sam hi jagmuḥ paniṣṭham jātam tavasam duvasyan  bṛhantaḥ id bhānavaḥ bhāṛjīkam agnim sacanta vidyutaḥ na śukrāḥ
translated: Even the gods with their mind have gone together to the most excellent one, to the mighty one, to serve the born one🔽The great indeed are the radiant lights that attend on Agni, the bright ones like lightning bolts

original: guheva vṛddhaṃ sadasi sve antarapāra ūrve amṛtanduhānāḥ
analyzed: guhā iva vṛddham sadasi sve antara pāre ūrve amṛtan duhānāḥ
translated: Like a secret one, the grown one in his own abode, the immortal one, the udder, the streams

original: īḷe ca tvā yajamāno havirbhirīḷe sakhitvaṃ sumatiṃ nikāmaḥ
analyzed: īḍe ca tvā yajamānaḥ havirbhiḥ īḍe sakhi tvam sumatim nikāmaḥ
translated: I praise you, O sacrificer, with oblations, I praise the friendship, the good will, the desire

original: devairavo mimīhi saṃ jaritre rakṣā ca no damyebhiranīkaiḥ
analyzed: devaiḥ avaḥ mimīhi sam jaritre rakṣā ca naḥ damyebhiḥ anīkaiḥ
translated: Measure with the gods the cry for the singer, and protect us with your domestic forms

original: upakṣetārastava supraṇīte 'gne viśvāni dhanyā dadhānāḥ
analyzed: upakṣetāraḥ tava su praṇīte gne viśvāni dhanyā dadhānāḥ
translated: The leaders of your well-guided chariot, O Agni, bearing all treasures,

original: suretasā śravasā tuñjamānā abhi ṣyāma pṛtanāyūnradevān
analyzed: su retasā śravasā tuñjamānāḥ abhi syāma pṛtanāyūn radevān
translated: With good seed, striving with glory, we will conquer the godless hosts in battle

original: ā devānāmabhavaḥ keturagne mandro viśvāni kāvyāni vidvān
analyzed: ā devānām abhavaḥ ketuḥ agne mandraḥ viśvāni kāvyāni vidvān
translated: You have become the light of the gods, O Agni, the delightful one, knowing all the sacred truths

original: prati martānavāsayo damūnā anu devān rathiro yāsisādhan
analyzed: prati martān avāsayaḥ damūnāḥ anu devān rathiraḥ yāsisādhan
translated: You dwell among mortals, the friendly one, O chariot-borne one, you go to the gods, accomplishing (their wishes)

original: ni duroṇe amṛto martyānāṃ rājā sasāda vidathāni sādhan
analyzed: ni duroṇe amṛtaḥ martyānām rājā sasāda vidathāni sādhan
translated: The immortal one, the king of mortals, has sat down in the house, accomplishing the rites.

original: ghṛtapratīka urviyā vyadyaudagnirviśvāni kāvyāni vidvān🔽ā no gahi sakhyebhiḥ śivebhirmahān mahībhirūtibhiḥ saraṇyan
analyzed: ghṛta pratīkaḥ urviyā vyadyaut agniḥ viśvāni kāvyāni vidvān  ā naḥ gahi sakhyebhiḥ śivebhiḥ mahān mahībhiḥ ūtibhiḥ saraṇyan
translated: Agni, the all-knowing one, has shone forth with his face of ghee, extending in all directions.🔽Come to us with your auspicious friendships, the great one, moving to us with your mighty aids.

original: asme rayiṃ bahulaṃ santarutraṃ suvācaṃ bhāgaṃ yaśasaṃ kṛdhī naḥ
analyzed: asme rayim bahulam santarutram su vācam bhāgam yaśasam kṛdhī naḥ
translated: Make for us wealth abundant, with good protection, well-spoken, a glorious portion.

original: etā te agne janimā sanāni pra pūrvyāya nūtanāni vocam🔽mahānti vṛṣṇe savanā kṛtemā janmañjanman nihito jātavedāḥ
analyzed: etā te agne janimā sanāni pra pūrvyāya nūtanāni vocam  mahānti vṛṣṇe savanā kṛtā imā janman janman nihitaḥ jātavedāḥ
translated: These, O Agni, are your ancient births; I proclaim to you the new ones, O you of the first.🔽Great are the oblations for the powerful one; in every birth, O all-knower, you are placed.

original: janmañjanman nihito jātavedā viśvāmitrebhiridhyate ajasraḥ
analyzed: janman janman nihitaḥ jātavedāḥ viśvāmitrebhiḥ idhyate ajasraḥ
translated: In every birth, O all-knower, you are placed; you are kindled by the Vishvamitra priests, O imperishable one.

original: tasya vayaṃ sumatau yajñiyasyāpi bhadre saumanase syāma🔽imaṃ yajñaṃ sahasāvan tvaṃ no devatrā dhehi sukrato rarāṇaḥ
analyzed: tasya vayam sumatau yajñiyasya api bhadre saumanase syāma  imam yajñam sahasāvan tvam naḥ devatrā dhehi su krato rarāṇaḥ
translated: May we be in the favor of that adorable one, in his good will and gracious love.🔽O you who conquer in a moment, O god, place this sacrifice for us in the world of the gods, O you who are very wise, O you who delight in the sacrifice.

original: pra yaṃsi hotarbṛhatīriṣo no 'gne mahi dravinamā yajasva
analyzed: pra yaṃsi hotar bṛhatīḥ iṣaḥ naḥ gne mahi dravinamāḥ yajasva
translated: O Hotar, O Agni, bestow upon us abundant food, great riches, and sacrifice.

original: iḷāmagne purudaṃsaṃ saniṃ goḥ śaśvattamaṃ havamānāyasādha
analyzed: iḷām agne purudaṃsam sanim goḥ śaśvattamam havamānāyasādha
translated: O Agni, make for him who invokes you the most enduring portion of food, the most desirable prize of cattle.

original: syān naḥ sūnustanayo vijāvāgne sā te sumatirbhutvasme
analyzed: syāt naḥ sūnuḥ tanayaḥ vijāvā agne sā te sumatiḥ bhutvā sme
translated: May he be our son, our offspring, full of vigor; may that be your good will towards us, O Agni.

original: vaiśvānarāya dhiṣaṇām ṛtāvṛdhe ghṛtaṃ na pūtamagnayejanāmasi
analyzed: vaiśvānarāya dhiṣaṇām ṛtāvṛdhe ghṛtam na pūtam agnayā janāmasi
translated: To Vaisvānara, the upholder, who increases holy order, we offer purified ghee to Agni.

original: dvitā hotāraṃ manuṣaśca vāghato dhiyā rathaṃna kuliśaḥ sam ṛṇvati
analyzed: dvitā hotāram manuṣaḥ ca vāghataḥ dhiyā rathaṃna kuliśaḥ sam ṛṇvati
translated: The two-fold priest, the invoker of men, with thought, like an axe, puts together the chariot.

original: sa rocayajjanuṣā rodasī ubhe sa mātrorabhavat putra īḍyaḥ
analyzed: sa rocayat januṣā rodasī ubhe sa mātroḥ abhavat putraḥ īḍyaḥ
translated: He illumines with his birth both the heaven and the earth. He, the son, is to be praised by his two mothers.

original: havyavāḷ agnirajaraścanohito dūḷabho viśāmatithirvibhāvasuḥ
analyzed: havyavāṭ agniḥ ajaraḥ canohitaḥ dūḍabhaḥ viśām atithiḥ vibhāvasuḥ
translated: Agni, the bearer of oblations, the undecaying, the well-disposed, the swift, the guest of the people, the possessor of wealth,

original: kratvā dakṣasya taruṣo vidharmaṇi devāso agniṃ janayanta cittibhiḥ🔽rurucānaṃ bhānunā jyotiṣā mahāmatyaṃ na vājaṃ saniṣyannupa bruve
analyzed: kratvā dakṣasya taruṣaḥ vidharmaṇi devāsaḥ agnim janayanta cittibhiḥ  rurucānam bhānunā jyotiṣā mahā matyam na vājam saniṣyan upa bruve
translated: By the wisdom of Daksha, the creator of the world, the gods generated Agni with their thoughts.

original: ā mandrasya saniṣyanto vareṇyaṃ vṛṇīmahe ahrayaṃ vājamṛgmiyam🔽rātiṃ bhṛgūṇāmuśijaṃ kavikratumagniṃ rājantaṃ divyena śociṣā
analyzed: ā mandrasya saniṣyantaḥ vareṇyam vṛṇīmahe ahrayam vājamṛgmiyam  rātim bhṛgūṇām uśijam kavi kratum agnim rājantam divyena śociṣā
translated: I approach the shining one, with light and great splendor, desiring to win the prize.🔽Desiring the pleasant one, we choose the excellent one, the prize to be won, the far-reaching one.🔽The generous one of the Bhrigus, the wise one, Agni, the shining one, with heavenly splendor,

original: agniṃ sumnāya dadhire puro janā vājaśravasamiha vṛktabarhiṣaḥ
analyzed: agnim sumnāya dadhire puras janāḥ vāja śravasam iha vṛkta barhiṣaḥ
translated: The people have made Agni their leader for happiness, here, those who strew the sacrificial grass well.

original: yatasrucaḥ surucaṃ viśvadevyaṃ rudraṃ yajñānāṃsādhadiṣṭimapasām
analyzed: yata srucaḥ su rucam viśvadevyam rudram
translated: The ones with uplifted ladles, the radiant one, possessing all the gods, Rudra, the fulfiller of wishes among the Apas,

original: pāvakaśoce tava hi kṣayaṃ pari hotaryajñeṣu vṛktabarhiṣo naraḥ
analyzed: pāvaka śoce tava hi kṣayam pari hotar yajñeṣu vṛkta barhiṣaḥ naraḥ
translated: O Agni, whose radiance is pure, men with well-strewn sacrificial grass come to thy abode, O Hotar,

original: agne duva ichamānāsa āpyamupāsate draviṇaṃ dhehi tebhyaḥ
analyzed: agne duvaḥ ichamānāsaḥ āpyam upāsate draviṇam dhehi tebhyaḥ
translated: O Agni, they who long for worship attend on thee who art to be approached: bestow wealth on them.

original: ā rodasī apṛṇadā svarmahajjātaṃ yadenamapaso adhārayan
analyzed: ā rodasī apṛṇata svar mahat jātam yat enam apasaḥ adhārayan
translated: Thou hast filled the two world-halves with light and glory, when the skilful ones established thee when born.

original: so adhvarāya pari ṇīyate kaviratyo na vājasātayecanohitaḥ
analyzed: saḥ adhvarāya pari ṇīyate kaviḥ ratyaḥ na vājasātaye cana uhitaḥ
translated: He is led forth to the sacrifice, the sage, like a horse to the winning of strength, well-disposed.

original: namasyata havyadātiṃ svadhvaraṃ duvasyata damyaṃ jātavedasam🔽rathīrṛtasya bṛhato vicarṣaṇiragnirdevānāmabhavat purohitaḥ
analyzed: namasyata havya dātim su adhvaram duvasyata damyam jātavedasam  rathīḥ ṛtasya bṛhataḥ vicarṣaṇiḥ agniḥ devānām abhavat purohitaḥ
translated: Worship the bearer of oblations, the pure one, serve the domestic one, the all-knower.🔽The charioteer of great truth, the very active Agni has become the priest of the gods.

original: tisro yahvasya samidhaḥ parijmano 'gnerapunannuśijo amṛtyavaḥ
analyzed: tisraḥ yahvasya samidhaḥ parijmanaḥ gneḥ apunan uśijaḥ amṛtyavaḥ
translated: The three living coals of the mighty one who moves around, of Agni, the skilful ones have kindled to immortality.

original: tāsāmekāmadadhurmartye bhujamu lokamu dve upa jāmimīyatuḥ
analyzed: tāsām ekām adadhuḥ martye bhujamu lokamu dve upa jāmimīyatuḥ
translated: Of these they have placed one in the mortal world, two have gone to the world of the kinsman.

original: viśāṃ kaviṃ viśpatiṃ mānuṣīriṣaḥ saṃ sīmakṛṇvan svadhitiṃ na tejase
analyzed: viśām kavim viśpatim mānuṣīḥ iṣaḥ sam sīmakṛṇvan svadhitim na tejase
translated: The men have made the sage, the lord of the people, the lord of the people, the axe for the trees, for glory.

original: sa udvato nivato yāti veviṣat sa garbhameṣu bhuvaneṣu dīdharat
analyzed: saḥ udvataḥ nivataḥ yāti veviṣat sa garbham eṣu bhuvaneṣu dīdharat
translated: He goes from the full to the empty, from the full to the empty, he has placed the germ in the worlds.

original: sa jinvate jaṭhareṣu prajajñivān vṛṣā citreṣu nānadan na siṃhaḥ
analyzed: sa jinvate jaṭhareṣu prajajñivān vṛṣā citreṣu nānadan na siṃhaḥ
translated: He, the living one, is active in the wombs, the bull roars in the variegated ones, like a lion.

original: vaiśvānaraḥ pṛthupājā amartyo vasu ratnā dayamāno vi dāśuṣe
analyzed: vaiśvānaraḥ pṛthu pājāḥ amartyaḥ vasu ratnā dayamānaḥ vi dāśuṣe
translated: Vaisvānara, of wide sway, immortal, bestowing wealth and treasures on the worshipper.

original: vaiśvānaraḥ pratnathā nākamāruhad divas pṛṣṭhaṃ bhandamānaḥ sumanmabhiḥ
analyzed: vaiśvānaraḥ pratnathā nākam āruhat divaḥ pṛṣṭham bhandamānaḥ su manmabhiḥ
translated: Vaiśvānara, in ancient manner, hath mounted the vault, rejoicing, with the well-disposed, the back of heaven.

original: sa pūrvavajjanayañ jantave dhanaṃ samānamajmaṃ paryeti jāgṛviḥ
analyzed: sa pūrva vat janayam jantave dhanam samānam ajmam paryeti jāgṛviḥ
translated: He, begetting wealth anew for man to live upon, goes round the self-same path, the watchful One.

original: ṛtāvānaṃ yajñiyaṃ vipramukthyamā yaṃ dadhe mātariśvā divi kṣayam🔽taṃ citrayāmaṃ harikeśamīmahe sudītimagniṃ suvitāya navyase
analyzed: ṛtāvānam yajñiyam vipram ukthyam ā yam dadhe mātariśvā divi kṣayam  tam citra yāmam hari keśam īmahe su dītim agnim suvitāya navyase
translated: Him who is righteous, meet for sacrifice, the sage whom Mātariśvan hath set in the sky as a home,🔽We implore that wondrous One, whose hair is gold, well-shining Agni, for new prosperity.

original: śuciṃ na yāmanniṣiraṃ svardṛśaṃ ketuṃ divo rocanasthāmuṣarbudham
analyzed: śucim na yāman niṣiram svar dṛśam ketum divaḥ rocana sthām uṣarbudham
translated: Pure, swift to move, beholding the light, the ensign of the sky, standing in the region of the luminous realm, rising at dawn,

original: agniṃ mūrdhānaṃ divo apratiṣkutaṃ tamīmahe namasā vājinaṃ bṛhat
analyzed: agnim mūrdhānam divaḥ apratiṣkutam tam īmahe namasā vājinam bṛhat
translated: We implore that Agni, the head of the sky, the invincible, the strong, with reverence.

original: mandraṃ hotāraṃ śucimadvayāvinaṃ damūnasamukthyaṃ viśvacarṣaṇim
analyzed: mandram hotāram śucim advayāvinam damūnasam ukthyam viśvacarṣaṇim
translated: The cheerful, pure, infallible Hotar, the guest in the house, the worthy of lauds, the all-impelling,

original: rathaṃ na citraṃ vapuṣāya darśataṃ manurhitaṃ sadamid rāya īmahe
analyzed: ratham na citram vapuṣāya darśatam manuḥ hitam sadam id rāyaḥ īmahe
translated: We ever implore for wealth the wondrous One, beautiful to behold, like a chariot, ever beneficial.

original: vaiśvānarāya pṛthupājase vipo ratnā vidhanta dharuṇeṣu gātave
analyzed: vaiśvānarāya pṛthu pājase vipaḥ ratnā vidhanta dharuṇeṣu gātave
translated: To Vaiśvānara, of wide sway, the wise one, they offer jewels to be borne on the backs (of the priests).

original: agnirhi devānamṛto duvasyatyathā dharmāṇi sanatā na dūduṣat
analyzed: agniḥ hi devān amṛtaḥ duvasyati athā dharmāṇi sanatā na dūduṣat
translated: For Agni, the immortal, serves the gods, and then he does not violate the eternal laws.

original: antardūto rodasī dasma īyate hotā niṣatto manuṣaḥ purohitaḥ
analyzed: antar dūtaḥ rodasī dasmaḥ īyate hotā niṣattaḥ manuṣaḥ purohitaḥ
translated: The wondrous one moves as the inner messenger between the two worlds, the Hotar, set down, the priest of men.

original: kṣayaṃ bṛhantaṃ pari bhūṣati dyubhirdevebhiragniriṣito dhiyāvasuḥ
analyzed: kṣayam bṛhantam pari bhūṣati dyubhiḥ devebhiḥ agniḥ iṣitaḥ dhiyāvasuḥ
translated: He adorns the great abode with his lights, Agni, sent forth by the gods, rich in devotion.

original: ketuṃ yajñānāṃ vidathasya sā dhanaṃ viprāso agniṃ mahayanta cittibhiḥ🔽apāṃsi yasminnadhi sandadhurgirastasmin sumnāni yajamāna ā cake
analyzed: ketum yajñānām vidathasya sā dhanam viprāsaḥ agnim mahayanta cittibhiḥ  apāṃsi yasmin adhi sandadhuḥ giraḥ tasmin sumnāni yajamānaḥ ā cake
translated: The sages magnify Agni with their thoughts, the banner of sacrifices, the wealth of the assembly.🔽In him let the sacrificer seek his welfare, in whom they have placed their songs.

original: pitā yajñānāmasuro vipaścitāṃ vimānamagnirvayunaṃ ca vāghatām
analyzed: pitā yajñānām asuraḥ vipaścitām vimānam agniḥ vayunam ca vāghatām
translated: The father of sacrifices, the Asura of the wise, the measure of Agni, and the rule of the priests.

original: ā viveśa rodasī bhūrivarpasā purupriyo bhandate dhāmabhiḥ kaviḥ
analyzed: ā viveśa rodasī bhūri varpasā puru priyaḥ bhandate dhāmabhiḥ kaviḥ
translated: The sage, beloved of many, shines with his own glory, entering the two worlds with great power.

original: candramagniṃ candrarathaṃ harivrataṃ vaiśvānaramapsuṣadaṃ svarvidam
analyzed: candram agnim candra ratham hari vratam vaiśvānaram apsuṣadam svar vidam
translated: Agni, the moon, of a lunar chariot, of a tawny vow, Vaiśvānara, sitting in the waters, finding the heaven,

original: vigāhaṃ tūrṇiṃ taviṣībhirāvṛtaṃ bhūrṇiṃ devāsa iha suśriyaṃ dadhuḥ
analyzed: vigāham tūrṇim taviṣībhiḥ āvṛtam bhūrṇim devāsaḥ iha su śriyam dadhuḥ
translated: The swift one, the rapid one, surrounded with powers, the tawny one, the gods have placed here, of good glory.

original: agnirdevebhirmanuṣaśca jantubhistanvāno yajñaṃ purupeśasaṃ dhiyā
analyzed: agniḥ devebhiḥ manuṣaḥ ca jantubhiḥ tanvānaḥ yajñam puru peśasam dhiyā
translated: Agni, with the gods and with men, with living beings, extending the sacrifice, the manly one, with devotion,

original: rathīrantarīyate sādhadiṣṭibhirjīro damūnā abhiśasticātanaḥ
analyzed: rathīḥ antarīyate sādhat iṣṭibhiḥ jīraḥ damūnāḥ abhiśasti cātanaḥ
translated: The charioteer is placed in between, with well-directed paths, the young one, the house-friend, the repeller of imprecations.

original: agne jarasva svapatya āyunyūrjā pinvasva samiṣo didīhi naḥ
analyzed: agne jarasva su apatye āyuni ūrjā pinvasva samiṣaḥ didīhi naḥ
translated: O Agni, live long with your own offspring; swell with strength; shine upon us with food.

original: vayāṃsi jinva bṛhataśca jāgṛva uśig devānāmasi sukraturvipām
analyzed: vayāṃsi jinva bṛhataḥ ca jāgṛvaḥ uśij devānām asi su kratuḥ vipām
translated: Animate the birds, and watch over the great one, thou art the swift and wise priest of the gods, O Agni

original: viśpatiṃ yahvamatithiṃ naraḥ sadā yantāraṃ dhīnāmuśijaṃ ca vāghatām
analyzed: viśpatim yahvam atithim naraḥ sadā yantāram dhīnām uśijam ca vāghatām
translated: The lord of the people, the young guest whom men always honour, the leader of thoughts, and the active priest of the sacrificial food

original: adhvarāṇāṃ cetanaṃ jātavedasaṃ pra śaṃsanti namasā jūtibhirvṛdhe
analyzed: adhvarāṇām cetanam jātavedasam pra śaṃsanti namasā jūtibhiḥ vṛdhe
translated: They praise with reverence and with their praises the all-knowing Jâtavedas, the leader of sacrifices, for increase

original: vibhāvā devaḥ suraṇaḥ pari kṣitīragnirbabhūva śavasāsumadrathaḥ
analyzed: vibhāvā devaḥ su raṇaḥ pari kṣitīḥ agniḥ babhūva śavasā asumat rathaḥ
translated: The shining god, the purifier, Agni, has become the chariot of the people, swift with power

original: tasya vratāni bhūripoṣiṇo vayamupa bhūṣemadama ā suvṛktibhiḥ
analyzed: tasya vratāni bhūri poṣiṇaḥ vayam upa bhūṣema dame ā suvṛktibhiḥ
translated: May we serve his ordinances, which are rich in nourishment, with this our hymn, O self-existent one

original: vaiśvānara tava dhāmānyā cake yebhiḥ svarvidabhavo vicakṣaṇa
analyzed: vaiśvānara tava dhāmāni ā cake yebhiḥ svar vid abhavaḥ vicakṣaṇa
translated: O Vaiśvānara, I desire thy abodes, by which thou hast become all-seeing, O thou who findest the light

original: jāta āpṛṇo bhuvanāni rodasī agne tā visvā paribhūrasi tmanā
analyzed: jātaḥ āpṛṇaḥ bhuvanāni rodasī agne tā visvā paribhūḥ asi tmanā
translated: Born, thou hast filled the worlds, the two world-halves, O Agni, thou art of thine own nature all these things

original: vaiśvānarasya daṃsanābhyo bṛhadariṇādekaḥ svapasyayā kaviḥ
analyzed: vaiśvānarasya daṃsanābhyaḥ bṛhat ariṇāt ekaḥ su apasyayā kaviḥ
translated: The one wise one, with his own insight, has uttered the great praises of Vaiśvānara

original: ubhā pitarā mahayannajāyatāgnirdyāvāpṛthivī bhūriretasā
analyzed: ubhā pitarā mahayan ajāyata agniḥ dyāvāpṛthivī bhūri retasā
translated: Magnifying both his parents, he is born, Agni, with the two world-halves, Dyaus and Pṛthivī, rich in seed

original: samitsamit sumanā bodhyasme śucāśucā sumatiṃ rāsi vasvaḥ
analyzed: samidh samidh sumanāḥ bodhi asme śucā a śucā sumatim rāsi vasvaḥ
translated: Be friendly, friendly, be well-disposed towards us; bestow on us a portion of good things

original: ā deva devān yajathāya vakṣi sakhā sakhīn sumanā yakṣyagne
analyzed: ā deva devān yajathāya vakṣi sakhā sakhīn sumanāḥ yakṣi agne
translated: O god, thou shalt go to the gods to be worshipped; as a friend, O Agni, be well-disposed to thy friends, to be worshipped

original: yaṃ devāsastrirahannāyajante divedive varuṇo mitro agniḥ🔽semaṃ yajñaṃ madhumantaṃ kṛdhī nastanūnapād ghṛtayoniṃ vidhantam
analyzed: yam devāsaḥ tris ahan na ayajante dive dive varuṇaḥ mitraḥ agniḥ  sā imam yajñam madhumantam kṛdhī naḥ tanūnapād ghṛta yonim vidhantam
translated: Whom the gods worship day by day for three days, Varuṇa, Mitra, and Agni,🔽Make this sacrifice of ours rich in honey, O Tvaṣṭar, the womb of ghee, the preparer.

original: pra dīdhitirviśvavārā jigāti hotāramiḷaḥ prathamaṃ yajadhyai
analyzed: pra dīdhitiḥ viśva vārā jigāti hotāram iḷaḥ prathamam yajadhyai
translated: The light goes forth, sought by all, to worship first the priest, the nimble one.

original: achā namobhirvṛṣabhaṃ vandadhyai sa devān yakṣadiṣito yajīyān
analyzed: achā namobhiḥ vṛṣabham vandadhyai sa devān yakṣa diṣitaḥ yajīyān
translated: With homage we would honour the bull, he, urged, most holy, shall worship the gods.

original: ūrdhvo vāṃ gāturadhvare akāryūrdhvā śocīṃṣi prasthitā rajāṃsi
analyzed: ūrdhvaḥ vām gātuḥ adhvare akāri ūrdhvā śocīṃṣi prasthitā rajāṃsi
translated: Your upward-going chariot has been set in motion at the sacrifice, your upward flames have started into the regions.

original: divo vā nābhā nyasādi hotā stṛṇīmahi devavyacā vi barhiḥ
analyzed: divaḥ vā nābhā nyasādi hotā stṛṇīmahi deva vyacāḥ vi barhiḥ
translated: The priest has sat down on the navel of the sky. We will spread out the sacred grass, O divine expanse.

original: sapta hotrāṇi manasā vṛṇānā invanto viśvaṃ prati yannṛtena
analyzed: sapta hotrāṇi manasā vṛṇānāḥ invantaḥ viśvam prati yat nṛtena
translated: Choosing with their minds the seven priestly offices, urging all things on with truth,

original: nṛpeśaso vidatheṣu pra jātā abhīmaṃ yajñaṃ vi caranta pūrvīḥ
analyzed: nṛ peśasaḥ vidatheṣu pra jātāḥ abhi imam yajñam vi caranta pūrvīḥ
translated: The princes, born in the assemblies, shall move in this sacrifice in a great company.

original: ā bhandamāne uṣasā upāke uta smayete tanvā virūpe
analyzed: ā bhandamāne uṣasau upāke uta smayete tanvā virūpe
translated: The two, shining, in the dawn, near each other, and also smiling, with different forms,

original: yathā no mitro varuṇo jujoṣadindro marutvānuta vā mahobhiḥ
analyzed: yathā naḥ mitraḥ varuṇaḥ jujoṣat indraḥ marutvān uta vā mahobhiḥ
translated: So that Mitra, Varuṇa may be well-disposed to us, and Indra with the Maruts, or with great powers.

original: daivyā hotārā prathamā ny ṛñje sapta pṛkṣāsaḥ svadhayāmadanti
analyzed: daivyā hotārā prathamā ni ṛñje sapta pṛkṣāsaḥ svadhayā amadanti
translated: I honour first the two divine Hotars. The seven creatures rejoice in their own nature.

original: ṛtaṃ śaṃsanta ṛtamit ta āhuranu vrataṃ vratapā dīdhyānāḥ
analyzed: ṛtam śaṃsantaḥ ṛtam id te āhuḥ anu vratam vrata pāḥ dīdhyānāḥ
translated: They proclaim the truth, they say this is the truth, the guardians of the vow, reflecting on the vow,

original: ā bhāratī bhāratībhiḥ sajoṣā iḷā devairmanuṣyebhiragniḥ
analyzed: ā bhāratī bhāratībhiḥ sajoṣāḥ iḷā devaiḥ manuṣyebhiḥ agniḥ
translated: May Bhāratī in accord with the Bhāratīs, Ilā with the gods, Agni with men,

original: sarasvatī sārasvatebhirarvāk tisro devīrbarhiredaṃ sadantu
analyzed: sarasvatī sārasvatebhiḥ arvāk tisraḥ devīḥ barhiḥ ā idam sadantu
translated: Sarasvatī with the Sārasvatas, may the three goddesses sit on this strew.

original: tan nasturīpamadha poṣayitnu deva tvaṣṭarvi rarāṇaḥ syasva
analyzed: tat naḥ turīpam adha poṣayitnu deva tvaṣṭar vi rarāṇaḥ syasva
translated: O Tvaṣṭar, the god, being pleased, grant us that most bountiful one who nourishes,

original: yato vīraḥ karmaṇyaḥ sudakṣo yuktagrāvā jāyate devakāmaḥ
analyzed: yatas vīraḥ karmaṇyaḥ su dakṣaḥ yukta grāvā jāyate deva kāmaḥ
translated: From whom a hero, skilled in work, with well-formed arms, desirous of the gods, is born, with a yoke in his hand.

original: vanaspate 'va sṛjopa devānagnirhaviḥ śamitā sūdayāti
analyzed: vanaspate vaḥ sṛja upa devān agniḥ haviḥ śamitā sūdayāti
translated: O lord of the forest, release (the tree) for the gods. Agni, the purifier, prepares the oblation.

original: sedu hotā satyataro yajāti yathā devānāṃ janimāni veda
analyzed: sa idu hotā satyataraḥ yajāti yathā devānām janimāni veda
translated: The priest, more truthful, sits, worshipping, as he knows the generations of the gods.

original: ā yāhyagne samidhāno arvāṃ indreṇa devaiḥ sarathaṃ turebhiḥ
analyzed: ā yāhi agne samidhānaḥ arvān indreṇa devaiḥ sa ratham turebhiḥ
translated: Come hither, O Agni, kindled, with the swift, with Indra, with the gods, with the swift ones,

original: barhirna āstāmaditiḥ suputrā svāhā devā amṛtāmādayantām
analyzed: barhiḥ naḥ āstām aditiḥ su putrā svāhā devāḥ amṛtā amādayantām
translated: Let Aditi, with good sons, sit on the strew. Let the gods, the immortal ones, be delighted.

original: pratyagniruṣasaścekitāno 'bodhi vipraḥ padavīḥ kavīnām🔽pṛthupājā devayadbhiḥ samiddho 'pa dvārā tamaso vahnirāvaḥ
analyzed: prati agniḥ uṣasaḥ cekitānaḥ bodhi vipraḥ padavīḥ kavīnām  pṛthu pājāḥ devayadbhiḥ samiddhaḥ pa dvārā tamasaḥ vahniḥ āvaḥ
translated: Agni, the watchful one, has awakened, the sage, the paths of the wise ones.🔽Wide-stepping, kindled by those who worship, Agni has opened the doors of darkness.

original: pred vagnirvāvṛdhe stomebhirgīrbhi stotṝṇāṃ namasya ukthaiḥ
analyzed: pra id vagniḥ vāvṛdhe stomebhiḥ gīrbhiḥ stotṝṇām namasyaḥ ukthaiḥ
translated: Let Agni grow great through the praises, through the hymns, through the adorations of the singers, through the eulogies.

original: pūrvīrṛtasya sandṛśaścakānaḥ saṃ dūto adyauduṣaso viroke🔽adhāyyagnirmānuṣīṣu vikṣvapāṃ garbho mitra ṛtena sādhan
analyzed: pūrvīḥ ṛtasya sandṛśaḥ cakānaḥ sam dūtaḥ adyaut uṣasaḥ viroke  adhāyi agniḥ mānuṣīṣu vikṣu apām garbhaḥ mitraḥ ṛtena sādhan
translated: Seeking the earliest dawns of truth, the envoy hath shone forth in the light of the morning🔽Agni is set up in all human dwellings, the friend, the germ of waters, accomplishing (his work) by law.

original: ā haryato yajataḥ sānvasthādabhūdu vipro havyomatīnām
analyzed: ā haryataḥ yajataḥ sa anvasthāt abhūt u vipraḥ havyomatīnām
translated: The tawny one, the worshipper, hath sat down with the people; the priest hath become of those who offer oblations.

original: mitro agnirbhavati yat samiddho mitro hotā varuṇo jātavedāḥ🔽mitro adhvaryuriṣiro damūnā mitraḥ sindhūnāmuta parvatānām
analyzed: mitraḥ agniḥ bhavati yat samiddhaḥ mitraḥ hotā varuṇaḥ jātavedāḥ  mitraḥ adhvaryuḥ iṣiraḥ damūnāḥ mitraḥ sindhūnām uta parvatānām
translated: Agni is a friend when he is kindled; Mitra, the all-knower, is the Hotar; Varuṇa (is the Hotar).🔽Agni is a friend, the swift priest, the hospitable one; Mitra is of the rivers and of the mountains.

original: pāti priyaṃ ripo agraṃ padaṃ veḥ pāti yajvaścarañaṃsūryasya
analyzed: pāti priyam ripaḥ agram padam veḥ pāti yajvaḥ carañam sūryasya
translated: He guards the dear foremost place of the bird; he guards the sacrificer who moves in the light of the sun.

original: pāti nābhā saptaśīrṣāṇamagniḥ pāti devānāmupamādam ṛṣvaḥ
analyzed: pāti nābhā sapta śīrṣāṇam agniḥ pāti devānām upamādam ṛṣvaḥ
translated: Agni guards the navel, the seven-headed one; the lofty one guards the abode of the gods.

original: ṛbhuścakra īḍyaṃ cāru nāma viśvāni devo vayunāni vidvān🔽sasasya carma ghṛtavat padaṃ vestadidagnī rakṣatyaprayuchan
analyzed: ṛbhuḥ cakre īḍyam cāru nāma viśvāni devaḥ vayunāni vidvān  sasasya carma ghṛtavat padam veḥ tat id agniḥ rakṣati aprayuchan
translated: The R̥ibhu hath made the adorable and beautiful name; the god, knowing all the ordinances,🔽The skin of the bird, the place full of ghee, he guards; that Agni, never failing, guards.

original: ā yonimagnirghṛtavantamasthāt pṛthupragāṇamuśantamuśānaḥ
analyzed: ā yonim agniḥ ghṛtavantam asthāt pṛthu pragāṇam uśantam uśānaḥ
translated: Agni hath sat down on his ghee-filled seat, the wide-going one, the eager one, the eager one.

original: dīdyānaḥ śucirṛṣvaḥ pāvakaḥ punaḥpunarmātarā navyasī kaḥ
analyzed: dīdyānaḥ śuciḥ ṛṣvaḥ pāvakaḥ punar punar mātarā navyasī kaḥ
translated: The shining, pure, lofty, purifying one, again and again, the new mother, the great one.

original: sadyo jāta oṣadhībhirvavakṣe yadī vardhanti prasvo ghṛtena
analyzed: sadyas jātaḥ oṣadhībhiḥ vavakṣe yadī vardhanti prasvaḥ ghṛtena
translated: As soon as born he hath grown with the plants; when they increase him with ghee in the morning.

original: āpa iva pravatā śumbhamānā uruśyadagniḥ pitrorupasthe🔽udu ṣṭutaḥ samidhā yahvo adyaud varṣman divo adhi nābhā pṛthivyāḥ
analyzed: āpaḥ iva pravatā śumbhamānāḥ uruśyat agniḥ pitroḥ upasthe  udu stutaḥ samidhā yahvaḥ adyaut varṣman divaḥ adhi nābhā pṛthivyāḥ
translated: Like waters in a channel, being cleansed, Agni, the wide-ruler, in the lap of his parents🔽Has risen, praised with the kindling-stick, the youthful one, on the back of the sky, in the middle of the earth

original: mitro agnirīḍyo mātariśvā dūto vakṣad yajathāya devān
analyzed: mitraḥ agniḥ īḍyaḥ mātariśvā dūtaḥ vakṣat yajathāya devān
translated: Mitra, Agni, to be worshipped, Mātariśvan, as messenger, shall go to the gods to be worshipped

original: udastambhīt samidhā nākam ṛṣvo 'gnirbhavannuttamo rocanānām
analyzed: udastambhīt samidhā nākam ṛṣvaḥ gniḥ bhavan uttamaḥ rocanānām
translated: He has raised up the lofty vault with the kindling-stick, Agni becoming the highest of the luminous ones

original: yadī bhṛgubhyaḥ pari mātariśvā guhā santaṃ havyavāhaṃ samīdhe
analyzed: yadī bhṛgubhyaḥ pari mātariśvā guhā santam havyavāham samīdhe
translated: When Mātariśvan, from the Bhṛgus, has kindled the bearer of oblations dwelling in the cave

original: iḷāmagne / / /
analyzed: iḍām agne
translated: O Agni, with the ladle...

original: pra kāravo mananā vacyamānā devadrīcīṃ nayata devayantaḥ
analyzed: pra kāravaḥ mananā vacyamānāḥ devadrīcīm nayata devayantaḥ
translated: The singers, being praised, are carrying you forward, longing for the gods, to the god-directed (place)

original: dakṣiṇāvāḍ vājinī prācyeti havirbharantyagnaye ghṛtācī
analyzed: dakṣiṇāvāṭ vājinī prācyā iti haviḥ bharanti agnaye ghṛtācī
translated: The sacrificial fee, the strong one, goes forward, bringing the oblation to Agni, the ladle full of ghee

original: ā rodasī apṛṇā jāyamāna uta pra rikthā adha nu prayajyo
analyzed: ā rodasī apṛṇāḥ jāyamānaḥ uta pra rikthāḥ adha nu prayajyo
translated: You have filled the two worlds, being born; and your treasures, O worthy of sacrifice, are spread out

original: divaścidagne mahinā pṛthivyā vacyantāṃ te vahnayaḥ saptajihvāḥ
analyzed: divaḥ cit agne mahinā pṛthivyāḥ vacyantām te vahnayaḥ sapta jihvāḥ
translated: Even above the great heaven and earth, O Agni, let your flames, seven-tongued, be lifted up

original: dyauśca tvā pṛthivī yajñiyāso ni hotāraṃ sādayante damāya
analyzed: dyauḥ ca tvā pṛthivī yajñiyāsaḥ ni hotāram sādayante damāya
translated: Heaven and earth, worthy of sacrifice, settle you as the priest to be worshipped, O Agni

original: yadī viśo mānuṣīrdevayantīḥ prayasvatīrīḷate śukramarciḥ
analyzed: yadi viśaḥ mānuṣīḥ devayantīḥ prayasvatīḥ īḍate śukram arciḥ
translated: When the human tribes, longing for the gods, rich in oblations, move about, the bright flame

original: mahān sadhasthe dhruva ā niṣatto 'ntardyāvā māhine haryamāṇaḥ
analyzed: mahān sadhasthe dhruvaḥ ā niṣattaḥ ntar dyāvā māhine haryamāṇaḥ
translated: Great, firmly seated in the lofty place, shining within the two Mâhânavîs,

original: āskre sapatnī ajare amṛkte sabardughe urugāyasyadhenū
analyzed: āskre sapatnī ajare amṛkte sabardughe uru gāyasya dhenū
translated: In the plough, O thou that art not to be deceived, the two inexhaustible, all-milking, wide-pasturing cows of the far-ruling one.

original: vratā te agne mahato mahāni tava kratvā rodasī ā tatantha
analyzed: vratā te agne mahataḥ mahāni tava kratvā rodasī ā tatantha
translated: Thy great, O Agni, are the great ordinances: by thy wisdom thou hast spread out the two world-halves.

original: tvaṃ dūto abhavo jāyamānastvaṃ netā vṛṣabha carṣaṇīnām
analyzed: tvam dūtaḥ abhavaḥ jāyamānaḥ tvam netā vṛṣabha carṣaṇīnām
translated: Thou hast become the envoy at birth: thou, O bull, art the leader of men.

original: ṛtasya vā keśinā yogyābhirghṛtasnuvā rohitā dhuri dhiṣva
analyzed: ṛtasya vā keśinā yogyābhiḥ ghṛtasnuvā rohitā dhuri dhiṣva
translated: With the reins of truth, with the yoking-halters, with the milk of ghee, yoke the two red oxen to the pole.

original: athā vaha devān deva viśvān svadhvarā kṛṇuhi jātavedaḥ
analyzed: athā vaha devān deva viśvān su adhvarā kṛṇuhi jātavedaḥ
translated: Then bring the gods, O God, all the gods: make the rites of worship good, O all-knowing one.

original: divaścidā te rucayante rokā uṣo vibhātīranu bhāsi pūrvīḥ
analyzed: divaḥ cit ā te rucayante rokāḥ uṣaḥ vibhātīḥ anu bhāsi pūrvīḥ
translated: Even the lights of heaven rejoice in thee: thou shinest with many a light, O Ushas.

original: apo yadagna uśadhag vaneṣu hoturmandrasya panayanta devāḥ
analyzed: apaḥ yat agne uśadhak vaneṣu hotuḥ mandrasya panayanta devāḥ
translated: When, O Agni, the eager one in the woods, the gods make ready the offerings of the cheerful priest.

original: urau vā ye antarikṣe madanti divo vā ye rocane santi devāḥ🔽ūmā vā ye suhavāso yajatrā āyemire rathyo agne aśvāḥ
analyzed: urau vā ye antarikṣe madanti divaḥ vā ye rocane santi devāḥ  ūmāḥ vā ye su havāsaḥ yajatrāḥ āyemire rathyaḥ agne aśvāḥ
translated: Those who rejoice in the broad expanse of the atmosphere, or those who are in the light of heaven, the gods.🔽Or those who are easy to invoke, who are to be worshipped, who are yoked to the chariot, the horses, O Agni.

original: aibhiragne sarathaṃ yāhyarvāṃ nānārathaṃ vā vibhavo hyaśvāḥ
analyzed: ā ebhiḥ agne sa ratham yāhi arvām nānā ratham vā vibhavaḥ hi aśvāḥ
translated: With these, O Agni, come hither in thy chariot, or in a chariot of many forms: for the horses are of various forms.

original: patnīvatastriṃśataṃ trīṃśca devānanuṣvadhamā vaha mādayasva
analyzed: patnīvataḥ triṃśatam trīn ca devān anuṣu adhamā vaha mādayasva
translated: With the wives, with the thirty-three gods, bring them to the oblation: make them glad.

original: sa hotā yasya rodasī cidurvī yajñaṃyajñamabhi vṛdhe gṛṇītaḥ
analyzed: sa hotā yasya rodasī cit urvī yajñam yajñam abhi vṛdhe gṛṇītaḥ
translated: He is the priest whom the two vast worlds praise at every sacrifice for his increase

original: prācī adhvareva tasthatuḥ sumeke ṛtāvarī ṛtajātasya satye
analyzed: prācī adhvarā iva tasthatuḥ sumeke ṛtāvarī ṛta jātasya satye
translated: The two well-formed ones, following the truth of the one born by truth, stand in the east like two sacrifices

original: iḷāmagne / / /
analyzed: iḍām agne
translated: O Agni, I praise...

original: pra ya āruḥ śitipṛṣṭhasya dhāserā mātarā viviśuḥ sapta / vāṇīḥ
analyzed: pra ye āruḥ śiti pṛṣṭhasya dhāsā irā mātarā viviśuḥ sapta vāṇīḥ
translated: He who has mounted the back of the tawny one, the seven voices have entered his two mothers

original: parikṣitā pitarā saṃ carete pra sarsrāte dīrghamāyuḥ prayakṣe
analyzed: parikṣitā pitarā sam carete pra sarsrāte dīrgham āyuḥ prayakṣe
translated: The two all-encompassing parents move together, they extend the long life, they make it visible

original: divakṣaso dhenavo vṛṣṇo aśvā devīrā tasthau madhumad vahantīḥ
analyzed: divakṣasaḥ dhenavaḥ vṛṣṇaḥ aśvāḥ devīḥ ā tasthau madhumat vahantīḥ
translated: The heavenly cows of the tawny horse, the divine ones stand bringing sweet things

original: ṛtasya tvā sadasi kṣemayantaṃ paryekā carati vartaniṃ gauḥ🔽ā sīmarohat suyamā bhavantīḥ patiścikitvān rayivid rayīṇām
analyzed: ṛtasya tvā sadasi kṣemayantam paryekā carati vartanim gauḥ  ā sīm arohat su yamāḥ bhavantīḥ patiḥ cikitvān rayi vid rayīṇām
translated: The cow moves around the path of you who are settled in the seat of truth🔽He has mounted the easy-to-ride ones, the husband who knows, the finder of wealth among the riches

original: pra nīlapṛṣṭho atasasya dhāsestā avāsayat purudhapratīkaḥ
analyzed: pra nīla pṛṣṭhaḥ atasasya dhāseḥ tāḥ avāsayat purudhā pratīkaḥ
translated: The one with the dark back has settled them in the back of the tawny one, the one with many forms

original: mahi tvāṣṭramūrjayantīrajuryaṃ stabhūyamānaṃ vahato vahanti
analyzed: mahi tvāṣṭram ūrjayantīḥ ajuryam stabhūyamānam vahataḥ vahanti
translated: They carry the great, powerful, unaging ones that are being supported

original: vyaṅgebhirdidyutānaḥ sadhastha ekāmiva rodasī ā viveśa
analyzed: vyaṅgebhiḥ didyutānaḥ sadhasthe ekām iva rodasī ā viveśa
translated: The one who shines with the unmoving ones has entered the one abode as if it were one, the two worlds

original: jānanti vṛṣṇo aruṣasya śevamuta bradhnasya śāsane raṇanti
analyzed: jānanti vṛṣṇaḥ aruṣasya śevam uta bradhnasya śāsane raṇanti
translated: They know the grace of the tawny red one, and they rejoice in the rule of the wide one

original: divorucaḥ suruco rocamānā iḷā yeṣāṃ gaṇyā māhinā gīḥ
analyzed: divorucaḥ su rucaḥ rocamānāḥ iḍā yeṣām gaṇyā māhinā gīḥ
translated: Whose light is divine, very bright, shining, for whom Iḷā is to be reckoned, the song is great

original: uto pitṛbhyāṃ pravidānu ghoṣaṃ maho mahadbhyāmanayanta śūṣam
analyzed: uta u pitṛbhyām pravidā anu ghoṣam mahaḥ mahadbhyām anayanta śūṣam
translated: And from the two parents they have brought the shout, the strength, to the great one, by the two great ones

original: ukṣā ha yatra pari dhānamaktoranu svaṃ dhāma jariturvavakṣa
analyzed: ukṣā ha yatra pari dhānam aktoḥ anu svam dhāma jarituḥ vavakṣa
translated: Where the bull hath gone around the enclosing-sticks of the altar, he hath come to his own abode, to the worshipper's

original: adhvaryubhiḥ pañcabhiḥ sapta viprāḥ priyaṃ rakṣante nihitaṃ padaṃ veḥ
analyzed: adhvaryubhiḥ pañcabhiḥ sapta viprāḥ priyam rakṣante nihitam padam veḥ
translated: The five Adhvaryus, the seven sages guard the dear place laid down of the bird

original: prāñco madantyukṣaṇo ajuryā devā devānāmanu hi vratā guḥ
analyzed: prāñcaḥ madanti ukṣaṇaḥ ajuryāḥ devāḥ devānām anu hi vratā guḥ
translated: The unaging pressers rejoice in the east, for the ways of the gods are established, for the gods are mighty

original: daivyā hotārā prathamā / / /
analyzed: daivyā hotārā prathamā
translated: The two divine Hotars, the first...

original: vṛṣāyante mahe atyāya pūrvīrvṛṣṇe citrāya raśmayaḥ suyāmāḥ
analyzed: vṛṣāyante mahe atyāya pūrvīḥ vṛṣṇe citrāya raśmayaḥ su yāmāḥ
translated: The rays, well-faring, shine forth to the great, to the bull, to the mighty, in various ways

original: deva hotarmandrataraścikitvān maho devān rodasī eha vakṣi
analyzed: deva hotar mandrataraḥ cikitvān mahaḥ devān rodasī ā iha vakṣi
translated: O divine Hotar, more delightful, wise, bring the great gods to the two world-halves, O Agni

original: pṛkṣaprayajo draviṇaḥ suvācaḥ suketava uṣaso revadūṣuḥ
analyzed: pṛkṣa prayajaḥ draviṇaḥ su vācaḥ su ketavaḥ uṣasaḥ revat ūṣuḥ
translated: The bountiful dawns, rich in treasure, well-praising, offering oblations, have good auspices

original: uto cidagne mahinā pṛthivyāḥ kṛtaṃ cidenaḥ saṃ mahe daśasya
analyzed: uta u cit agne mahinā pṛthivyāḥ kṛtam cit enaḥ sam mahe daśasya
translated: Even if, O Agni, thou hast committed a great sin against the earth, thou art still to be honoured

original: iḷāmagne / / /
analyzed: iḍām agne
translated: O Agni, I...

original: añjanti tvāmadhvare devayanto vanaspate madhunā daivyena
analyzed: añjanti tvām adhvare devayantaḥ vanaspate madhunā daivyena
translated: The pious, at the sacrifice, anoint thee, O lord of the forest, with divine honey

original: yadūrdhvastiṣṭhā draviṇeha dhattād yad vā kṣayo māturasyā upasthe
analyzed: yat ūrdhvaḥ tiṣṭhāḥ draviṇā iha dhattāt yat vā kṣayaḥ mātuḥ asyāḥ upasthe
translated: If thou standest above, bestow wealth here, or if thou art in the lap of this mother, in the womb

original: samiddhasya śrayamāṇaḥ purastād brahma vanvāno ajaraṃ suvīram
analyzed: samiddhasya śrayamāṇaḥ purastāt brahma vanvānaḥ ajaram su vīram
translated: Being piled up in front of the well-kindled one, seeking the imperishable Brahman, with good heroes,

original: āre asmadamatiṃ bādhamāna ucchrayasva mahate saubhagāya
analyzed: āre asmad amatim bādhamānaḥ ucchrayasva mahate saubhagāya
translated: Overcoming misfortune for us, rise up for great good fortune.

original: ucchrayasva vanaspate varṣman pṛthivyā adhi
analyzed: ucchrayasva vanaspate varṣman pṛthivyāḥ adhi
translated: Rise up, O tree, to the height above the earth,

original: sumitī mīyamāno varco dhā yajñavāhase
analyzed: su mitī mīyamānaḥ varcaḥ dhāḥ yajña vāhase
translated: Being measured well, bestow splendor for the bearer of the sacrifice.

original: yuvā suvāsāḥ parivīta āgāt sa u śreyān bhavati jāyamānaḥ
analyzed: yuvā su vāsāḥ parivītaḥ āgāt saḥ u śreyān bhavati jāyamānaḥ
translated: The young man, well-dressed, surrounded, has come; he becomes better as he is born.

original: taṃ dhīrāsaḥ kavaya un nayanti svādhyo manasā devayantaḥ
analyzed: tam dhīrāsaḥ kavayaḥ ud nayanti su ādhyaḥ manasā devayantaḥ
translated: The wise ones, the poets, lead him up, devoted to the self, inspired by the god, with the mind.

original: jāto jāyate sudinatve ahnāṃ samarya ā vidathe vardhamānaḥ
analyzed: jātaḥ jāyate su su dina dina tve ahnām samarye ā vidathe vardhamānaḥ
translated: Born, he is born again at the good time of the days, growing in the assembly at the sacrifice.

original: punanti dhīrā apaso manīṣā devayā vipra udiyarti vācam🔽yān vo naro devayanto nimimyurvanaspate svadhitirvā tatakṣa
analyzed: punanti dhīrāḥ apasaḥ manīṣā deva yāḥ vipraḥ udiyarti vācam  yān vaḥ naraḥ devayantaḥ nimimyuḥ vanaspate svadhitiḥ vā tatakṣa
translated: The wise ones purify the thought; the inspired sage sends forth the speech to the god.🔽Those whom the men devoted to the gods have set up, O lord of the forest, or the ax has fashioned,

original: te devāsaḥ svaravastasthivāṃsaḥ prajāvadasme didhiṣantu ratnam
analyzed: te devāsaḥ svaravaḥ tasthivāṃsaḥ prajāvat asme didhiṣantu ratnam
translated: May those gods, the Svaras, dwelling there, grant us riches with offspring.

original: ye vṛkṇāso adhi kṣami nimitāso yatasrucaḥ🔽te no vyantu vāryaṃ devatrā kṣetrasādhasaḥ
analyzed: ye vṛkṇāsaḥ adhi kṣami nimitāsaḥ yata srucaḥ  te naḥ vyantu vāryam devatrā kṣetrasādhasaḥ
translated: Those who are cut up on the ground, set up, with uplifted ladles,🔽May they favor us with choice gifts, the field-makers, in the world of the gods.

original: ādityā rudrā vasavaḥ sunīthā dyāvākṣāmā pṛthivī antarikṣam
analyzed: ādityāḥ rudrāḥ vasavaḥ su nīthāḥ dyāvākṣāmā pṛthivī antarikṣam
translated: The Adityas, Rudras, Vasus, the well-wishers, the heaven and earth, the sky,

original: sajoṣaso yajñamavantu devā ūrdhvaṃ kṛṇvantvadhvarasya ketum
analyzed: sajoṣasaḥ yajñam avantu devāḥ ūrdhvam kṛṇvantu adhvarasya ketum
translated: may the gods of one accord favour the sacrifice, may they raise aloft the ensign of the rite

original: haṃsā iva śreṇiśo yatānāḥ śukrā vasānāḥ svaravo naāguḥ
analyzed: haṃsāḥ iva śreṇiśas yatānāḥ śukrā vasānāḥ svaravaḥ naāguḥ
translated: arranged in rows like swans, clad in bright garments, the Svaras have come to us

original: unnīyamānāḥ kavibhiḥ purastād devā devānāmapi yanti pāthaḥ
analyzed: unnīyamānāḥ kavibhiḥ purastāt devāḥ devānām api yanti pāthaḥ
translated: being lifted up by the sages in front, the gods go to the place of the gods

original: śṛṅgāṇīvecchṛṅgiṇāṃ saṃ dadṛśre caṣālavantaḥ svaravaḥ pṛthivyām
analyzed: śṛṅgāṇi iva id śṛṅgiṇām sam dadṛśre caṣālavantaḥ svaravaḥ pṛthivyām
translated: like the peaks of the peaked ones, the Svaras with their cauldrons are seen on earth

original: vāghadbhirvā vihave śroṣamāṇā asmānavantu pṛtanājyeṣu
analyzed: vāghadbhiḥ vā vihave śroṣamāṇāḥ asmān avantu pṛtanājyeṣu
translated: listening to the call with the priests in the contest, may they favour us in the battles for the sacrificial essence

original: vanaspate śatavalśo vi roha sahasravalśā vi vayaṃ ruhema
analyzed: vanaspate śata valśaḥ vi roha sahasra valśāḥ vi vayam
translated: O tree, grow with a hundred shoots, with us grow with a thousand shoots

original: yaṃ tvāmayaṃ svadhitistejamānaḥ praṇināya mahate saubhagāya
analyzed: yam tvām ayam svadhitiḥ tejamānaḥ praṇināya mahate saubhagāya
translated: this axe, sharpened for great good fortune, has directed you

original: sakhāyastvā vavṛmahe devaṃ martāsa ūtaye
analyzed: sakhāyaḥ tvā vavṛmahe devam martāsaḥ ūtaye
translated: we have chosen you as a friend, O god, for help, O mortal ones

original: apāṃ napātaṃsubhagaṃ sudīditiṃ supratūrtimanehasam
analyzed: apām napātam subhagam su dīditim su pratūrtim anehasam
translated: the son of the waters, the fortunate one, the well-shining one, the one with good protection, the one without guile

original: kāyamāno vanā tvaṃ yan mātṝrajagannapaḥ🔽na tat teagne pramṛṣe nivartanaṃ yad dūre sannihābhavaḥ
analyzed: kāyamānaḥ vanā tvam yat  na tat te agne pramṛṣe nivartanam yat dūre san iha abhavaḥ
translated: when you went to the waters, your mothers, O tree, being measured🔽that turning back of yours, O Agni, I will not forget, that you were far away and then became near

original: ati tṛṣṭaṃ vavakṣithāthaiva sumanā asi
analyzed: ati tṛṣṭam vavakṣitha atha eva su manāḥ asi
translated: you have grown beyond the barren one, then you are well-disposed

original: praprānye yanti paryanya āsate yeṣāṃ sakhye asi śritaḥ
analyzed: pra pra anye yanti pari anye āsate yeṣām sakhye asi śritaḥ
translated: some go away, others sit around, in whose friendship you are settled

original: īyivāṃsamati sridhaḥ śaśvatīrati saścataḥ
analyzed: īyivāṃsam ati sridhaḥ śaśvatīḥ ati saścataḥ
translated: Passing over the barriers, the ever-moving ones, passing over the obstacles,

original: anvīmavindan nicirāso adruho 'psu siṃhamiva śritam
analyzed: anvīmavindan nicirāsaḥ adruhaḥ psu siṃham iva śritam
translated: The watchful ones have found him, the guileless one, hidden like a lion in the waters.

original: sasṛvāṃsamiva tmanāgnimitthā tirohitam
analyzed: sasṛvāṃsam iva tmanā agnim itthā tirohitam
translated: Like one moving of himself, Agni is thus concealed.

original: ainaṃ nayan mātariśvā parāvato devebhyo mathitaṃ pari
analyzed: ā enam nayat mātariśvā parāvataḥ devebhyaḥ mathitam pari
translated: Mātariśvan leads him from afar, churned out for the gods, around.

original: taṃ tvā martā agṛbhṇata devebhyo havyavāhana
analyzed: tam tvā martāḥ agṛbhṇata devebhyaḥ havya vāhana
translated: Mortals have seized you, O bearer of oblations, for the gods.

original: viśvān yadyajñānabhipāsi mānuṣa tava kratvā yaviṣṭhya
analyzed: viśvān yat yajñān abhipāsi mānuṣa tava kratvā yaviṣṭhya
translated: When you pass over all the sacrifices of men, by your wisdom, O youngest one.

original: tad bhadraṃ tava daṃsanā pākāya cicchadayati🔽tvāṃ yadagne paśavaḥ samāsate samiddhamapiśarvare
analyzed: tat bhadram tava daṃsanā pākāya cicchadayati  tvām yat agne paśavaḥ samāsate samiddham apiśarvare
translated: That is good, your glance covers even for cooking.🔽When the cattle, O Agni, sit around you, kindled, even in winter,

original: ā juhotā svadhvaraṃ śīraṃ pāvakaśociṣam
analyzed: ā juhota su adhvaram śīram pāvaka śociṣam
translated: To the oblator, the pure one, the one with pure flaming splendor,

original: āśuṃ dūtamajiraṃ pratnamīḍyaṃ śruṣṭī devaṃ saparyata
analyzed: āśum dūtam ajiram pratnam īḍyam śruṣṭī devam saparyata
translated: The swift messenger, the young one, the ancient one to be praised, listen to the god, serve him.

original: trīṇi śatā trī sahasrāṇyagniṃ triṃśacca devā navacāsaparyan
analyzed: trīṇi śatā trī sahasrāṇi agnim triṃśat ca devāḥ nava ca asaparyan
translated: Three hundred, three thousand, and thirty-nine gods have served Agni.

original: aukṣan ghṛtairastṛṇan barhirasmā ādid dhotāraṃ nyasādayanta
analyzed: aukṣan ghṛtaiḥ astṛṇan barhiḥ asmai ādit hotāram nyasādayanta
translated: They have anointed him with ghee, they have strewn the sacred grass for him, they have made him the Hotar priest, they have seated him.

original: tvāmagne manīṣiṇaḥ samrājaṃ carṣaṇīnām
analyzed: tvām agne manīṣiṇaḥ samrājam carṣaṇīnām
translated: You, O Agni, the wise ones, the king of men,

original: devaṃ martāsa indhate samadhvare
analyzed: devam martāsaḥ indhate samadhvare
translated: The mortals kindle as a god at the sacrifice.

original: tvāṃ yajñeṣv ṛtvijamagne hotāramīḷate
analyzed: tvām yajñeṣu ṛtvijam agne hotāram īḍate
translated: They choose thee as priest at sacrifices, O Agni, as Hotar.

original: gopā ṛtasya dīdihi sve dame
analyzed: gopāḥ ṛtasya dīdihi sve dame
translated: Shine as the guardian of truth in thine own abode.

original: sa ghā yaste dadāśati samidhā jātavedase🔽so agne dhattesuvīryaṃ sa puṣyati
analyzed: sa ghā yaḥ te dadāśati samidhā jātavedase  saḥ agne dhatte su vīryam sa puṣyati
translated: He who offers to thee, O all-knower, with fuel,🔽He, O Agni, obtains great strength, he prospers.

original: sa keturadhvarāṇāmagnirdevebhirā gamat
analyzed: sa ketuḥ adhvarāṇām agniḥ devebhiḥ ā gamat
translated: He is the leader of sacrifices. May Agni come with the gods,

original: añjānaḥ sapta hotṛbhirhaviṣmate
analyzed: añjānaḥ sapta hotṛbhiḥ haviṣmate
translated: Anointed with the seven priests, to him who offers sacrifices.

original: pra hotre pūrvyaṃ vaco 'gnaye bharatā bṛhat🔽vipāṃ jyotīṃṣi bibhrate na vedhase
analyzed: pra hotre pūrvyam vacaḥ gnaye bharatā bṛhat  vipām jyotīṃṣi bibhrate na vedhase
translated: Bring to the Hotar the ancient word, to Agni the Bharata, the great,🔽To the creator who bears the lights of the people.

original: agniṃ vardhantu no giro yato jāyata ukthyaḥ
analyzed: agnim vardhantu naḥ giraḥ yatas jāyate ukthyaḥ
translated: Let our songs magnify Agni, from whom the praiseworthy one is born,

original: mahe vājāyadraviṇāya darśataḥ
analyzed: mahe vājāya draviṇāya darśataḥ
translated: For the great prize, for wealth, for the glorious one.

original: agne yajiṣṭho adhvare devān devayate yaja
analyzed: agne yajiṣṭhaḥ adhvare devān devayate yaja
translated: O Agni, best sacrificer, offer the gods to the worshipper of the gods,

original: hotā mandro virājasyati sridhaḥ🔽sa naḥ pāvaka dīdihi dyumadasme suvīryam
analyzed: hotā mandraḥ virājasyati sridhaḥ  sa naḥ pāvaka dīdihi dyumat asme su vīryam
translated: The delightful Hotar, he overcomes the enemies.🔽O purifying one, shine for us with brilliant strength, for fame, for good heroes.

original: bhavā stotṛbhyoantamaḥ svastaye
analyzed: bhava stotṛbhyaḥ antamaḥ svastaye
translated: Be nearest to the praisers for well-being.

original: taṃ tvā viprā vipanyavo jāgṛvāṃsaḥ samindhate🔽havyavāhamamartyaṃ sahovṛdham
analyzed: tam tvā viprāḥ vipanyavaḥ jāgṛvāṃsaḥ samindhate  havyavāham amartyam sahaḥ vṛdham
translated: The sages, the wise ones, the watchful ones kindle thee,🔽The bearer of oblations, the immortal one, who increases strength.

original: agnirhotā purohito 'dhvarasya vicarṣaṇiḥ
analyzed: agniḥ hotā purohitaḥ dhvarasya vicarṣaṇiḥ
translated: Agni is the Hotar, the priest, the overseer of the sacrifice, the very active one.

original: sa veda yajñamānuṣak
analyzed: sa veda yajñam ānuṣak
translated: He knows the sacrifice well.

original: sa havyavāḷ amartya uśig dūtas canohitaḥ
analyzed: sa havyavāṭ amartya uśij dūtas canohitaḥ
translated: He is the bearer of oblations, the immortal one, the swift messenger, the one who is favorably inclined.

original: agnirdhiyā sam ṛṇvati
analyzed: agniḥ dhiyā sam ṛṇvati
translated: Agni is joined with thought

original: agnirdhiyā sa cetati keturyajñasya pūrvyaḥ
analyzed: agniḥ dhiyā sa cetati ketuḥ yajñasya pūrvyaḥ
translated: Agni with thought discerns, the ancient light of sacrifice

original: arthaṃ hyasya taraṇi
analyzed: artham hi asya taraṇi
translated: For his purpose is swift

original: agniṃ sūnuṃ sanaśrutaṃ sahaso jātavedasam
analyzed: agnim sūnum sana śrutam sahasaḥ jātavedasam
translated: Agni, the son, renowned in assemblies, born of strength, all-knower,

original: vahniṃ devāakṛṇvata
analyzed: vahnim devāḥ akṛṇvata
translated: The priests have made him

original: adābhyaḥ puraetā viśāmagnirmānuṣīṇām
analyzed: adābhyaḥ puraetā viśām agniḥ mānuṣīṇām
translated: Agni, the unassailable leader of the people, of humankind,

original: tūrṇī rathaḥ sadā navaḥ
analyzed: tūrṇiḥ rathaḥ sadā navaḥ
translated: The swift chariot, ever new

original: sāhvān viśvā abhiyujaḥ kraturdevānāmamṛktaḥ
analyzed: sāhvān viśvāḥ abhiyujaḥ kratuḥ devānām amṛktaḥ
translated: The challenger, overcoming all, the unopposed will of the gods,

original: agnistuviśravastamaḥ
analyzed: agniḥ tuvi śravastamaḥ
translated: Agni, most renowned

original: abhi prayāṃsi vāhasā dāśvānaśnoti martyaḥ
analyzed: abhi prayāṃsi vāhasā dāśvān aśnoti martyaḥ
translated: The giver, by his might, wins the offerings of the mortal man

original: kṣayaṃ pāvakaśociṣaḥ
analyzed: kṣayam pāvaka śociṣaḥ
translated: The abode of the one whose radiance is like a flame

original: pari viśvāni sudhitāgneraśyāma manmabhiḥ
analyzed: pari viśvāni sudhitā agneḥ aśyāma manmabhiḥ
translated: May we with our hymns approach all the well-ordered things of Agni,

original: viprāso jātavedasaḥ
analyzed: viprāsaḥ jātavedasaḥ
translated: The sages of the all-knower

original: agne viśvāni vāryā vājeṣu saniṣāmahe
analyzed: agne viśvāni vāryā vājeṣu saniṣāmahe
translated: O Agni, in the contests we seek all the boons

original: tve devāsa erire
analyzed: tve devāsaḥ erire
translated: In you the gods have placed

original: indrāgnī ā gataṃ sutaṃ gīrbhirnabho vareṇyam
analyzed: indra agnī ā gatam sutam gīrbhiḥ nabhaḥ vareṇyam
translated: O Indra and Agni, come to the pressed (juice), to the desirable cloud, with the hymns

original: asya pātaṃ dhiyeṣitā
analyzed: asya pātam dhiyā iṣitā
translated: Drink of this, impelled by the thought

original: indrāgnī jarituḥ sacā yajño jigāti cetanaḥ
analyzed: indra agnī jarituḥ sacā yajñaḥ jigāti cetanaḥ
translated: Indra and Agni, the sacrifice of the praiser goes forth, discerning,

original: ayā pātamimaṃ sutam
analyzed: ayā pātam imam sutam
translated: Drink of this pressed (juice)

original: indramagniṃ kavichadā yajñasya jūtyā vṛṇe
analyzed: indram agnim kavi chadā yajñasya jūtyā vṛṇe
translated: I choose Indra and Agni, the wise ones, by the impulse of the sacrifice

original: tā somasyeha tṛmpatām
analyzed: tā somasya iha tṛmpatām
translated: May they be satisfied here with the Soma

original: tośā vṛtrahaṇā huve sajitvānāparājitā
analyzed: tośa vṛtra haṇā huve sa jitvānā aparājitā
translated: I invoke the two impetuous ones, the Vrtra-killers, the unconquered ones, the victorious ones,

original: indrāgnī vājasātamā🔽pra vāmarcantyukthino nīthāvido jaritāraḥ
analyzed: indra agnī vāja sātamā  pra vām arcanti ukthinaḥ nīthāvidaḥ jaritāraḥ
translated: Indra and Agni, best at winning strength

original: indrāgnī iṣa ā vṛṇe
analyzed: indra agnī iṣaḥ ā vṛṇe
translated: The singers, the knowers of hymns, praise you, O Indra and Agni, I choose strength

original: indrāgnī navatiṃ puro dāsapatnīradhūnutam
analyzed: indra agnī navatim puraḥ dāsa patnīḥ adhūnutam
translated: Indra and Agni, you shook ninety forts of the Dāsa-wife

original: sākamekena karmaṇā
analyzed: sākam ekena karmaṇā
translated: Together with one deed

original: indrāgnī apasas paryupa pra yanti dhītayaḥ
analyzed: indra agnī apasas pari upa pra yanti dhītayaḥ
translated: The thoughts, the purifying ones, go around Indra and Agni

original: ṛtasya pathyā anu🔽indrāgnī taviṣāṇi vāṃ sadhasthāni prayāṃsi ca🔽yuvoraptūryaṃ hitam
analyzed: ṛtasya pathyāḥ anu  indra agnī taviṣāṇi vām sadhasthāni prayāṃsi ca  yuvoraptūryam hitam
translated: Along the paths of truth

original: indrāgnī rocanā divaḥ pari vājeṣu bhūṣathaḥ
analyzed: indra agnī rocanā divaḥ pari vājeṣu bhūṣathaḥ
translated: O Indra and Agni, your powers, your abodes, and your approaches

original: tad vāṃceti pra vīryam🔽pra vo devāyāgnaye barhiṣṭhamarcāsmai
analyzed: tat vāṃcā iti pra vīryam  pra vaḥ devāya agnaye barhiṣṭham arca asmai
translated: Your swiftness is set forth🔽For you, for the god Agni, we offer the highest praise, to him

original: gamad devebhirāsa no yajiṣṭho barhirā sadat
analyzed: gamat devebhiḥ āsa naḥ yajiṣṭhaḥ barhirā sadat
translated: May he come with the gods and sit on our strew, best at sacrifice

original: ṛtāvā yasya rodasī dakṣaṃ sacanta ūtayaḥ
analyzed: ṛtāvā yasya rodasī dakṣam sacante ūtayaḥ
translated: Whose truth-filled ordinances, O Heaven and Earth, attend upon his power

original: haviṣmantastamīḷate taṃ saniṣyanto 'vase
analyzed: haviṣmantaḥ tam īḍate tam saniṣyantaḥ vase
translated: The offerers of oblations honor him, seeking to win him for help

original: sa yantā vipra eṣāṃ sa yajñānāmathā hi ṣaḥ🔽agniṃ taṃ vo duvasyata dātā yo vanitā magham🔽sa naḥ śarmāṇi vītaye 'gniryachatu śantamā
analyzed: sa yantā vipraḥ eṣām sa yajñānām athā hi saḥ  agnim tam vaḥ duvasyata dātā yaḥ vanitā magham  sa naḥ śarmāṇi vītaye gniḥ yacchatu śantamā
translated: He is the leader of these priests, he is the one of sacrifices, for he is🔽Serve that Agni of yours, who gives the prize to the generous one🔽May Agni grant us most auspicious protections

original: yato naḥpruṣṇavad vasu divi kṣitibhyo apsvā
analyzed: yatas naḥ pruṣṇavat vasu divi kṣitibhyaḥ apsvā
translated: From whom may he pour forth wealth for us, in the sky, on the earth, in the waters

original: dīdivāṃsamapūrvyaṃ vasvībhirasya dhītibhiḥ
analyzed: dīdivāṃsam apūrvyam vasvībhiḥ asya dhītibhiḥ
translated: The radiant, incomparable one, with his wealth-bestowing thoughts,

original: ṛkvāṇo agnimindhate hotāraṃ viśpatiṃ viśām
analyzed: ṛkvāṇaḥ agnim indhate hotāram viśpatim viśām
translated: The singers enkindle Agni, the priest, the lord of the people.

original: uta no brahmannaviṣa uktheṣu devahūtamaḥ🔽śaṃ naḥ śocāmarudvṛdho 'gne sahasrasātamaḥ
analyzed: uta naḥ brahman aviṣaḥ uktheṣu deva hūtamaḥ  śam naḥ śocāmarut vṛdhaḥ gne sahasra sātamaḥ
translated: And be thou our Brahman, O never-vanquished one, most invoked by the gods in our praises,🔽Be thou auspicious to us, O Agni, increasing the Maruts, most victorious.

original: nū no rāsva sahasravat tokavat puṣṭimad vasu
analyzed: nu naḥ rāsva sahasravat tokavat puṣṭimat vasu
translated: Now grant us wealth in thousands, with offspring and prosperity,

original: dyumadagne suvīryaṃ varṣiṣthamanupakṣitam
analyzed: dyumat agne su vīryam varṣiṣtham an upakṣitam
translated: Splendid, O Agni, with good heroism, most abundant, not to be surpassed.

original: ā hotā mandro vidathānyasthāt satyo yajvā kavitamaḥ savedhāḥ
analyzed: ā hotā mandraḥ vidathāni asthāt satyaḥ yajvā kavitamaḥ sa vedhāḥ
translated: The delightful Hotar priest has taken his seat in the assemblies, the true worshipper, most wise, of good counsel.

original: vidyudrathaḥ sahasas putro agniḥ śociṣkeśaḥ pṛthivyāṃ pājo aśret🔽ayāmi te namauktiṃ juṣasva ṛtāvastubhyaṃ cetate sahasvaḥ
analyzed: vidyut rathaḥ sahasas putraḥ agniḥ śociṣkeśaḥ pṛthivyām pājaḥ aśret  ayāmi te namauktim juṣasva ṛtāvastubhyam cetate sahasvas
translated: Agni, the son of strength, with lightning for his chariot, has spread his radiance on the earth, his hair.🔽I bring thee the utterance of homage; accept it. For thee, O mighty one, the truth is ever present.

original: vidvānā vakṣi viduṣo ni ṣatsi madhya ā barhirūtaye yajatra
analyzed: vidvānā vakṣi viduṣaḥ ni satsi madhye ā barhiḥ ūtaye yajatra
translated: Knowing, thou goest; knowing, thou sittest down in the midst of the wise, on the sacred grass, for help, O holy one.

original: dravatāṃ ta uṣasā vājayantī agne vātasya pathyābhiracha
analyzed: dravatām te uṣasā vājayantī agne vātasya pathyābhiḥ acha
translated: Thy two (bay horses), O Agni, urging (thee) on, run with the dawn, on the paths of the wind,

original: yat sīmañjanti pūrvyaṃ havirbhirā vandhureva tasthaturduroṇe
analyzed: yat sīmañjanti pūrvyam havirbhiḥ ā vandhuḥ ā iva tasthatuḥ duroṇe
translated: When they anoint the ancient one with oblations, they stand in the house as on a well-constructed chariot.

original: mitraśca tubhyaṃ varuṇaḥ sahasvo 'gne viśve marutaḥ sumnamarcan
analyzed: mitraḥ ca tubhyam varuṇaḥ sahasvas gne viśve marutaḥ sumnam arcan
translated: May Mitra, Varuna, and the mighty Agni, and all the Maruts, O victorious one, honour thy wish.

original: yacchociṣā sahasas putra tiṣṭhā abhi kṣitīḥ prathayan sūryo nṝn🔽vayaṃ te adya rarimā hi kāmamuttānahastā namasopasadya
analyzed: yat śociṣā sahasas putra tiṣṭhāḥ abhi kṣitīḥ prathayan sūryaḥ nṝn  vayam te adya rarimā hi kāmam uttāna hastāḥ namasā upasadya
translated: With thy radiant heat, O Son of Strength, stand thou, spreading the people, as Sûrya spreads the lands.🔽We have to-day fulfilled thy wish, O Agni, with uplifted hands, sitting down with reverence.

original: yajiṣṭhena manasā yakṣi devānasredhatā manmanā vipro agne
analyzed: yajiṣṭhena manasā yakṣi devān a sredhatā manmanā vipraḥ agne
translated: With most propitious mind worship the Gods, O Agni, with thy most propitious thought, O Sage.

original: tvad dhi putra sahaso vi pūrvīrdevasya yantyūtayo vi vājāḥ
analyzed: tvat hi putra sahasaḥ vi pūrvīḥ devasya yanti ūtayaḥ vi vājāḥ
translated: For from thee, O Son of Strength, go forth the many aids of the God, and the powers of the God.

original: tvaṃ dehi sahasriṇaṃ rayiṃ no 'drogheṇa vacasā satyamagne
analyzed: tvam dehi sahasriṇam rayim naḥ drogheṇa vacasā satyam agne
translated: Do thou, O Agni, with a word that faileth not, give us wealth in a thousand portions, O true One.

original: tubhyaṃ dakṣa kavikrato yānīmā deva martāso adhvare akarma
analyzed: tubhyam dakṣa kavi krato yāni imā deva martāsaḥ adhvare akarma
translated: To thee, O Daksha, O thou of wise counsels, to thee, O God, at this our sacrifice, O men,

original: tvaṃ viśvasya surathasya bodhi sarvaṃ tadagne amṛta svadeha
analyzed: tvam viśvasya su rathasya bodhi sarvam tat agne amṛta svada iha
translated: Thou art the impeller of all the chariot-borne: all this, O Agni, is thine, immortal, to enjoy.

original: vi pājasā pṛthunā śośucāno bādhasva dviṣo rakṣaso amīvāḥ🔽suśarmaṇo bṛhataḥ śarmaṇi syāmagnerahaṃ suhavasya praṇītau
analyzed: vi pājasā pṛthunā śośucānaḥ bādhasva dviṣaḥ rakṣasaḥ amīvāḥ  su śarmaṇaḥ bṛhataḥ śarmaṇi syām agneḥ aham su havasya praṇītau
translated: Shining with far-extending splendour, drive away the foes, the Raksases, the evil spirits.🔽In the wide shelter of the bounteous Agni may we be, O thou of easy access, in his protection.

original: tvaṃ no asyā uṣaso vyuṣṭau tvaṃ sūra udite bodhi gopāḥ
analyzed: tvam naḥ asyāḥ uṣasaḥ vyuṣṭau tvam sūre udite bodhi gopāḥ
translated: Be thou our guardian when this dawn is breaking, be thou our guard when Sûrya hath arisen.

original: janmeva nityaṃ tanayaṃ juṣasva stomaṃ me agne tanvā sujāta
analyzed: janma iva nityam tanayam juṣasva stomam me agne tanvā su jāta
translated: Accept, as a son his father's, my constant hymn, my song, O Agni, born of thy own nature.

original: tvaṃ nṛcakṣā vṛṣabhānu pūrvīḥ kṛṣṇāsvagne aruṣo vibhāhi
analyzed: tvam nṛ cakṣāḥ vṛṣabha anu pūrvīḥ kṛṣṇāsu agne aruṣaḥ vibhāhi
translated: Thou, O Agni, who beholdest men, shine forth, O Bull, in many a place, red in the black nights.

original: vaso neṣi ca parṣi cātyaṃhaḥ kṛdhī no rāya uśijo yaviṣṭha
analyzed: vaso neṣi ca parṣi ca ati aṃhaḥ kṛdhī naḥ rāyaḥ uśijaḥ yaviṣṭha
translated: O Vasu, lead and carry us beyond distress, give us wealth, O most youthful one.

original: aṣāḷho agne vṛṣabho didīhi puro viśvāḥ saubhagā saṃjigīvān
analyzed: aṣāḷhaḥ agne vṛṣabhaḥ didīhi puraḥ viśvāḥ saubhaga ā saṃjigīvān
translated: O Agni, shine forth, invincible bull, conquering all good things in front.

original: yajñasya netā prathamasya pāyorjātavedo bṛhataḥ supraṇīte
analyzed: yajñasya netā prathamasya pāyoḥ jātavedaḥ bṛhataḥ su praṇīte
translated: Leader of the first sacrifice, O Jātavedas, of the great well-guided one.

original: achidrā śarma jaritaḥ purūṇi devānachā dīdyānaḥ sumedhāḥ🔽ratho na sasnirabhi vakṣi vājamagne tvaṃ rodasīnaḥ sumeke
analyzed: achidrā śarma jaritar purūṇi devān achā dīdyānaḥ sumedhāḥ  rathaḥ na sasniḥ abhi vakṣi vājam agne tvam rodasī inaḥ sumeke
translated: O wise one, shining, grant the worshipper many flawless protections.🔽Like a swift chariot, carry the strength, O Agni, you who are between the two worlds, well-formed.

original: pra pīpaya vṛṣabha jinva vājānagne tvaṃ rodasī naḥ sudoghe
analyzed: pra pīpaya vṛṣabha jinva vājān agne tvam rodasī naḥ su doghe
translated: Fill (it), O bull, stimulate the strengths, O Agni, you who are between the two worlds, easy to invoke.

original: devebhirdeva surucā rucāno mā no martasya durmatiḥ pari ṣṭhāt
analyzed: devebhiḥ deva su rucā rucānaḥ mā naḥ martasya durmatiḥ pari sthāt
translated: Shining with the gods, O god, with great radiance, may the evil thought of a mortal not overcome us.

original: iḷāmagne / / /
analyzed: iḍām agne
translated: O Agni, this...

original: ayamagniḥ suvīryasyeśe mahaḥ saubhagasya
analyzed: ayam agniḥ su vīryasya īśe mahaḥ saubhagasya
translated: This Agni is the lord of good heroism, of great good fortune,

original: rāya īśe svapatyasya gomata īśe vṛtrahathānām
analyzed: rāyaḥ īśe su apatyasya gomataḥ īśe vṛtra hathānām
translated: of wealth, of self-rule, of cattle, of battles with Vrtra.

original: imaṃ naro marutaḥ saścatā vṛdhaṃ yasmin rāyaḥ śevṛdhāsaḥ
analyzed: imam naraḥ marutaḥ saścata vṛdham yasmin rāyaḥ śevṛdhāsaḥ
translated: O Maruts, men, follow this one who increases, in whom are riches and prosperity,

original: abhi ye santi pṛtanāsu dūḍhyo viśvāhā śatrumādabhuḥ
analyzed: abhi ye santi pṛtanāsu dūḍhyaḥ viśvāhā śatrum ādabhuḥ
translated: who are victorious in battles, who overcome the enemy every day.

original: sa tvaṃ no rāyaḥ śiśīhi mīḍhvo agne suviryasya
analyzed: sa tvam naḥ rāyaḥ śiśīhi mīḍhvaḥ agne suviryasya
translated: O you who are to be invoked, O Agni, sharpen for us that wealth which is full of good heroes.

original: tuvidyumna varṣiṣṭhasya prajāvato 'namīvasya śuṣmiṇaḥ🔽cakriryo viśvā bhuvanābhi sāsahiścakrirdeveṣvā duvaḥ
analyzed: tuvi dyumna varṣiṣṭhasya prajāvataḥ namīvasya śuṣmiṇaḥ  cakriḥ yaḥ viśvā bhuvanā abhi sāsahiḥ cakriḥ deva iṣvā duvaḥ
translated: Of the most illustrious, most populous, diseaseless, and mighty one,🔽Who has conquered all beings, who has conquered the service of the gods,

original: ā deveṣu yatata ā suvīrya ā śaṃsa uta nṛṇām
analyzed: ā deveṣu yatate ā su vīrye ā śaṃse uta nṛṇām
translated: Who has come to the gods, who has come to great strength, who has come to the praise of men,

original: mā no agne 'mataye māvīratāyai rīradhaḥ
analyzed: mā naḥ agne mataye mā a vīra tāyai rīradhaḥ
translated: Do not lead us, O Agni, to forgetfulness, to want of heroes,

original: māgotāyai sahasas putra mā nide 'pa dveṣāṃsyā kṛdhi🔽śagdhi vājasya subhaga prajāvato 'gne bṛhato adhvare
analyzed: mā a go tāyai sahasas putra mā nide pa dveṣāṃsyā kṛdhi  śagdhi vājasya subhaga prajāvataḥ gne bṛhataḥ adhvare
translated: O son of strength, to want of cattle, to hatred; drive away enmities.🔽Be thou, O blessed Agni, at the great sacrifice of him who hath strength and offspring.

original: saṃrāyā bhūyasā sṛja mayobhunā tuvidyumna yaśasvatā
analyzed: saṃrāyā bhūyasā sṛja mayobhunā tuvi dyumna yaśasvatā
translated: Be thou, O thou of great splendour, victorious with the most prosperous, with him who hath most wealth.

original: samidhyamānaḥ prathamānu dharmā samaktubhirajyate viśvavāraḥ
analyzed: samidhyamānaḥ prathamā anu dharmā sam aktubhiḥ ajyate viśva vāraḥ
translated: Kindled, following the first laws, he is anointed with the drops, the bestower of all boons,

original: śociṣkeśo ghṛtanirṇik pāvakaḥ suyajño agniryajathāya devān
analyzed: śociṣkeśaḥ ghṛta nirṇij pāvakaḥ su yajñaḥ agniḥ yajathāya devān
translated: The purifier with hair of flame, anointed with ghee, the well-sacrificed Agni, to worship the gods.

original: yathāyajo hotramagne pṛthivyā yathā divo jātavedaścikitvān
analyzed: yathā ayajaḥ hotram agne pṛthivyāḥ yathā divaḥ jātavedaḥ cikitvān
translated: As thou hast worshipped the priesthood on earth, O Agni, as thou, O all-knower, on heaven,

original: evānena haviṣā yakṣi devān manuṣvad yajñaṃ pra tiremamadya
analyzed: eva anena haviṣā yakṣi devān manuṣvat yajñam pra tira imam adya
translated: So with this oblation worship the gods; today perform this sacrifice as men do.

original: trīṇyāyūṃṣi tava jātavedastisra ājānīruṣasaste agne
analyzed: trīṇi āyūṃṣi tava jātavedaḥ tisraḥ ājānīḥ uṣasaḥ te agne
translated: Three are thy life-powers, O all-knower, three thy dawns of knowledge, O Agni.

original: tābhirdevānāmavo yakṣi vidvānathā bhava yajamānāya śaṃ yoḥ
analyzed: tābhiḥ devānām avaḥ yakṣi vidvān athā bhava yajamānāya śam yoḥ
translated: With them, knowing, worship the favour of the gods, and then be thou a blessing to the sacrificer.

original: agniṃ sudītiṃ sudṛśaṃ gṛṇanto namasyāmastveḍyaṃ jātavedaḥ
analyzed: agnim su dītim sudṛśam gṛṇantaḥ namasyāmaḥ tvā īḍyam jātavedaḥ
translated: Praising Agni, the well-shining, well-seeing one, we pay homage to you, the worthy one, O all-knower

original: tvāṃ dūtamaratiṃ havyavāhaṃ devā akṛṇvannamṛtasya nābhim
analyzed: tvām dūtam aratim havyavāham devāḥ akṛṇvan amṛtasya nābhim
translated: The gods have made you their messenger, their envoy, the carrier of oblations, the navel of immortality

original: yastvad dhotā pūrvo agne yajīyān dvitā ca sattā svadhayā ca śambhuḥ tasyānu dharma pra yajā cikitvo 'tha no dhā adhvaraṃ
analyzed: yaḥ tvat hotā pūrvaḥ agne yajīyān dvitā ca sattā svadhayā ca śambhuḥ tasya anu dharma pra yaja ā cikitvaḥ tha naḥ dhāḥ adhvaram
translated: The one who was your priest before you, O Agni, more worthy of sacrifice, and who exists by his own nature and is auspicious, after his law, offer sacrifice, O wise one, and then bestow our sacrifice

original: bhavā no agne sumanā upetau sakheva sakhye pitareva sādhuḥ
analyzed: bhava naḥ agne sumanāḥ upetau sakhā iva sakhye pitarā iva sādhuḥ
translated: Be gracious to us, O Agni, when we approach you, like a good friend to a friend, like a good father

original: purudruho hi kṣitayo janānāṃ prati pratīcīrdahatādarātīḥ
analyzed: puru druhaḥ hi kṣitayaḥ janānām prati pratīcīḥ dahatāt arātīḥ
translated: For the people have many enemies, O Agni, burn away the evil spirits that come against us

original: tapo śvagne antarānamitrān tapā śaṃsamararuṣaḥ parasya
analyzed: tapa u śvagne antarān amitrān tapa śaṃsamararuṣaḥ parasya
translated: Burn away the enemies within, O Agni, burn away the evil-minded of the foe

original: tapo vaso cikitāno acittān vi te tiṣṭhantāmajarā ayāsaḥ
analyzed: tapaḥ vaso cikitānaḥ acittān vi te tiṣṭhantām ajarāḥ ayāsaḥ
translated: Burn, O Vasu, the thoughtless ones, O all-knowing one, let your undecaying, tireless ones stand forth

original: idhmenāgna ichamāno ghṛtena juhomi havyaṃ tarase balāya
analyzed: idhmena agne icchamānaḥ ghṛtena juhomi havyam tarase balāya
translated: With fuel, O Agni, desiring, I offer oblations with ghee, for strength and power

original: yāvadīśe brahmaṇā vandamāna imāṃ dhiyaṃ śataseyāya devīm
analyzed: yāvat īśe brahmaṇā vandamānaḥ imām dhiyam śata seyāya devīm
translated: As far as you rule, O god, with the Brahman, this divine thought for a hundred victories

original: ucchociṣā sahasas putra stuto bṛhad vayaḥ śaśamāneṣu dhehi
analyzed: ud śociṣā sahasas putra stutaḥ bṛhat vayaḥ śaśamāneṣu dhehi
translated: Be praised, O son of strength, with shining light, bestow great life on those who long for it

original: revadagne viśvāmitreṣu śaṃ yormarmṛjmā te tanvaṃ bhūri kṛtvaḥ
analyzed: revat agne viśvāmitreṣu śam yormar mṛjma te tanvam bhūri kṛtvas
translated: Be gracious, O Agni, to the Vishvamitras, in the sacrifice, we anoint your body, O bountiful one, for great deeds

original: kṛdhi ratnaṃ susanitardhanānāṃ sa ghedagne bhavasi yat samiddhaḥ
analyzed: kṛdhi ratnam su sanitar dhanānām sa gha id agne bhavasi yat samiddhaḥ
translated: Make thou a treasure, O good disposer, of the riches: then, O Agni, thou art what thou art when kindled

original: stoturduroṇe subhagasya revat sṛprā karasnā dadhiṣe vapūṃṣi
analyzed: stotuḥ duroṇe subhagasya revat sṛprā karasnā dadhiṣe vapūṃṣi
translated: In the house of the worshipper, O prosperous one, thou spreadest out thy limbs, O rich one

original: agniṃ hotāraṃ pra vṛṇe miyedhe gṛtsaṃ kaviṃ viśvavidamamūram
analyzed: agnim hotāram pra vṛṇe miyedhe gṛtsam kavim viśva vidam amūram
translated: I choose Agni as Hotar, as Priest at the sacrifice, the wise one, the all-knower, the infallible one

original: sa no yakṣad devatātā yajīyān rāye vājāya vanatemaghāni
analyzed: sa naḥ yakṣat devatātā yajīyān rāye vājāya vanatemaghāni
translated: May he, the most worthy of worship, serve the gods for us. May he win us riches and strength and noble deeds

original: pra te agne haviṣmatīmiyarmyachā sudyumnāṃ rātinīṃ ghṛtācīm
analyzed: pra te agne haviṣmatīm iyarmi achā su dyumnām rātinīm ghṛtācīm
translated: I prepare for thee, O Agni, the oblation-bearing (altar), bright, bountiful, full of ghee

original: pradakṣiṇid devatātimurāṇaḥ saṃ rātibhirvasubhiryajñamaśret
analyzed: pradakṣiṇit devatā atimurāṇaḥ sam rātibhiḥ vasubhiḥ yajñam aśret
translated: Surrounding the divine assembly, he has come to the sacrifice with his gifts and treasures

original: sa tejīyasā manasā tvota uta śikṣa svapatyasya śikṣoḥ🔽agne rāyo nṛtamasya prabhūtau bhūyāma te suṣṭutayaśca vasvaḥ
analyzed: sa tejīyasā manasā tvotaḥ uta śikṣa su apatyasya śikṣoḥ  agne rāyaḥ nṛtamasya prabhūtau bhūyāma te suṣṭutayaḥ ca vasvaḥ
translated: With thy most powerful mind do thou, O Agni, help and instruct us, O self-existent one, O instructer🔽In the bestowal of wealth, O Agni, best of men, may we be among those who praise thee well

original: bhūrīṇi hi tve dadhire anīkāgne devasya yajyavo janāsaḥ
analyzed: bhūrīṇi hi tve dadhire anīkā agne devasya yajyavaḥ janāsaḥ
translated: For many forms have the people set in thee, O Agni, O god, who are to be worshipped

original: sa ā vaha devatātiṃ yaviṣṭha śardho yadadya divyaṃyajāsi
analyzed: saḥ ā vaha devatātim yaviṣṭha śardhaḥ yat adya divyam yajāsi
translated: Bring thou, O youngest god, the divine assembly, since thou art to-day to worship the heavenly host

original: yat tvā hotāramanajan miyedhe niṣādayanto yajathāya devāḥ
analyzed: yat tvā hotāram anajat miyedhe niṣādayantaḥ yajathāya devāḥ
translated: When they have chosen thee as Hotar at the sacrifice, O Agni, the gods, placing thee, for the sake of worship

original: sa tvaṃ no agne 'viteha bodhyadhi śravāṃsi dhehi nastanūṣu
