analyzed: sa tvam naḥ agne vitā iha bodhi adhi śravāṃsi dhehi naḥ tanūṣu
translated: So do thou, O Agni, be our protector here, and bestow upon our bodies high fame.

original: agnimuṣasamaśvinā dadhikrāṃ vyuṣṭiṣu havate vahnirukthaiḥ
analyzed: agnim uṣasam aśvinā dadhikrām vyuṣṭiṣu havate vahniḥ ukthaiḥ
translated: At dawn he invokes Agni, at the break of day the Asvins, Dadhikrâvan with praises.

original: sujyotiṣo naḥ śṛṇvantu devāḥ sajoṣaso adhvaraṃ vāvaśānāḥ
analyzed: su jyotiṣaḥ naḥ śṛṇvantu devāḥ sajoṣasaḥ adhvaram vāvaśānāḥ
translated: May the Gods, of fair light, accordant, hearken to our invocation, and come to the sacrifice.

original: agne trī te vājinā trī ṣadhasthā tisraste jihvā ṛtajāta pūrvīḥ
analyzed: agne trī te vājinā trī sadhasthā tisraḥ te jihvāḥ ṛta jāta pūrvīḥ
translated: O Agni, three are thy powers, three stations, three thy tongues, O thou of holy birth, O thou of many forms.

original: tisra u te tanvo devavātāstābhirnaḥ pāhi giro aprayuchan
analyzed: tisraḥ u te tanvaḥ deva vātāḥ tābhiḥ naḥ pāhi giraḥ aprayuchan
translated: Three are thy bodies, O God-attended One: with these protect our songs, O thou that art not to be deceived.

original: agne bhūrīṇi tava jātavedo deva svadhāvo 'mṛtasya nāma
analyzed: agne bhūrīṇi tava jātavedaḥ deva svadhāvas mṛtasya nāma
translated: O Agni, many are thy names, O thou of holy law, O God, O thou of natural power, O thou of immortal life.

original: yāśca māyā māyināṃ viśvaminva tve pūrvīḥ sandadhuḥpṛṣṭabandho
analyzed: yāḥ ca māyāḥ māyinām viśvaminva tve pūrvīḥ sandadhuḥ pṛṣṭa bandho
translated: And the many illusions of the magicians, O thou that spreadest everywhere, are fastened on thee, O thou that art bound to the back.

original: agnirnetā bhaga iva kṣitīnāṃ daivīnāṃ deva ṛtupā ṛtāvā
analyzed: agniḥ netā bhagaḥ iva kṣitīnām daivīnām devaḥ ṛtu pāḥ ṛtāvā
translated: Agni is the leader, like Bhaga, of the people, O God, the guardian of the seasons, thou that art true to thine own nature.

original: sa vṛtrahā sanayo viśvavedāḥ parṣad viśvāti duritā gṛṇantam
analyzed: sa vṛtra hā sanayaḥ viśva vedāḥ parṣat viśvā ati duritā gṛṇantam
translated: He is the Vrtra-slayer, the impeller, all-knowing, he shall lead the singer past all calamities.

original: dadahikrāmagnimuṣasaṃ ca devīṃ bṛhaspatiṃ savitāraṃ cadevam
analyzed: dadahikrām agnim uṣasam ca devīm bṛhaspatim savitāram ca devam
translated: I have invoked Dadhikrâvan, Agni, and the Goddess Dawn, and the God Brhaspati, and Savitar.

original: aśvinā mitrāvaruṇā bhagaṃ ca vasūn rudrānādityāniha huve
analyzed: aśvinā mitrāvaruṇā bhagam ca vasūn rudrān ādityān iha huve
translated: I invoke here the Asvins, Mitra, Varuna, Bhaga, the Vasus, Rudras, and Âdityas.

original: imaṃ no yajñamamṛteṣu dhehīmā havyā jātavedo juṣasva
analyzed: imam naḥ yajñam amṛteṣu dhehi imā havyā jātavedaḥ juṣasva
translated: Place this our sacrifice among the immortal Gods: accept these offerings, O thou of universal knowledge.

original: stokānāmagne medaso ghṛtasya hotaḥ prāśāna prathamo niṣadya
analyzed: stokānām agne medasaḥ ghṛtasya hotar prāśāna prathamaḥ niṣadya
translated: Of the drops, O Agni, of fat and ghee, O Hotar, eat the first, being seated

original: ghṛtavantaḥ pāvaka te stokā ścotanti medasaḥ
analyzed: ghṛtavantaḥ pāvaka te stokā ścotanti medasaḥ
translated: The drops of fat, O purifying one, flow for you, full of ghee.

original: svadharman devavītaye śreṣṭhaṃ no dhehi vāryam
analyzed: svadharman deva vītaye śreṣṭham naḥ dhehi vāryam
translated: O one of natural law, for the enjoyment of the gods, bestow on us the best treasure.

original: tubhyaṃ stokā ghṛtaścuto 'gne viprāya santya
analyzed: tubhyam stokāḥ ghṛtaścutaḥ gne viprāya santya
translated: For you, O Agni, the drops full of ghee are ready, O sage.

original: ṛṣiḥ śreṣṭhaḥ samidhyase yajñasya prāvitā bhava
analyzed: ṛṣiḥ śreṣṭhaḥ samidhyase yajñasya prāvitā bhava
translated: You, O sage, are kindled as the best, become the forerunner of the sacrifice.

original: tubhyaṃ ścotantyadhrigo śacīva stokāso agne medaso ghṛtasya
analyzed: tubhyam ścotanti adhrigo śacīva stokāsaḥ agne medasaḥ ghṛtasya
translated: For you, O unassailable one, the drops full of strength flow, O Agni, of fat and ghee.

original: kaviśasto bṛhatā bhānunāgā havyā juṣasva medhira
analyzed: kavi śastaḥ bṛhatā bhānunā āgāḥ havyā juṣasva medhira
translated: Accept the oblations, O wise one, with your great light, praised by the sages.

original: ojiṣṭhaṃ te madhyato meda udbhṛtaṃ pra te vayaṃ dadāmahe
analyzed: ojiṣṭham te madhyatas medaḥ udbhṛtam pra te vayam dadāmahe
translated: The most powerful fat is brought forth from your middle, we offer it to you.

original: ścotanti te vaso stokā adhi tvaci prati tān devaśo vihi
analyzed: ścotanti te vaso stokāḥ adhi tvaci prati tān devaśas vihi
translated: The drops full of ghee flow for you, O good one, on your skin, O god, accept them.

original: ayaṃ so agniryasmin somamindraḥ sutaṃ dadhe jaṭhare vāvaśānaḥ
analyzed: ayam saḥ agniḥ yasmin somam indraḥ sutam dadhe jaṭhare vāvaśānaḥ
translated: This is that Agni in whom Indra, rejoicing, placed the pressed Soma in his belly.

original: sahasriṇaṃ vājamatyaṃ na saptiṃ sasavān san stūyase jātavedaḥ
analyzed: sahasriṇam vājamatyam na saptim sasavān san stūyase jātavedaḥ
translated: The thousandfold prize, the swift one, like a horse, O you who are full of oblations, O all-knower, you are praised.

original: agne yat te divi varcaḥ pṛthivyāṃ yadoṣadhīṣvapsvā yajatra
analyzed: agne yat te divi varcaḥ pṛthivyām yat oṣadhīṣu apsvā yajatra
translated: O Agni, your radiance in the sky, on earth, in the plants, in the waters, O you who are to be worshipped,

original: yenāntarikṣamurvātatantha tveṣaḥ sa bhānurarṇavo nṛcakṣāḥ
analyzed: yena antarikṣam urvā atatantha tveṣaḥ sa bhānuḥ arṇavaḥ nṛ cakṣāḥ
translated: By whom thou hast stretched out the atmosphere, that is thy bright light, the ocean, beholding men.

original: agne divo arṇamachā jigāsyachā devānūciṣe dhiṣṇyāye
analyzed: agne divaḥ arṇam achā jigāsi achā deva anūciṣe dhiṣṇyāye
translated: O Agni, thou goest to the ocean of the sky, to the gods, to the most adorable.

original: yā rocane parastāt sūryasya yāścāvastādupatiṣṭhaṇta āpaḥ🔽purīṣyāso agnayaḥ prāvaṇebhiḥ sajoṣasaḥ
analyzed: yāḥ rocane parastāt sūryasya yāḥ ca avastāt upatiṣṭhaṇte āpaḥ  purīṣyāsaḥ agnayaḥ prāvaṇebhiḥ sajoṣasaḥ
translated: Those waters which are above the light of the sun and those which are below,🔽The purifying fires, in unison with the rain-bringing ones,

original: juṣantāṃ yajñamadruho 'namīvā iṣo mahīḥ
analyzed: juṣantām yajñam adruhaḥ namīvāḥ iṣaḥ mahīḥ
translated: May they enjoy the sacrifice, free from enmity, the great powers of food, free from disease.

original: iḷāmagne / / /
analyzed: iḍām agne
translated: O Agni, the one to be praised...

original: nirmathitaḥ sudhita ā sadhasthe yuvā kaviradhvarasya praṇetā
analyzed: nirmathitaḥ sudhite ā sadhasthe yuvā kaviḥ adhvarasya praṇetā
translated: Anointed, well-placed in his abode, the young sage, the leader of the sacrifice,

original: jūryatsvagnirajaro vaneṣvatrā dadhe amṛtaṃ jātavedāḥ
analyzed: jūryatsu agniḥ ajaraḥ vaneṣu atra ā dadhe amṛtam jātavedāḥ
translated: Agni, the immortal, shines in the woods, here he has placed the immortal, all-knowing one.

original: amanthiṣṭāṃ bhāratā revadagniṃ devaśravā devavātaḥ sudakṣam
analyzed: amanthiṣṭām bhāratā revat agnim devaśravāḥ deva vātaḥ su dakṣam
translated: The Bharatas have vigorously churned Agni, the god-renowned, god-inspired, of good sacrifice.

original: agne vi paśya bṛhatābhi rāyeṣāṃ no netā bhavatādanu dyūn
analyzed: agne vi paśya bṛhatā abhi rāyā iṣām naḥ netā bhavatāt anu dyūn
translated: O Agni, look with the great ones upon their riches. Be our leader through the days.

original: daśa kṣipaḥ pūrvyaṃ sīmajījanan sujātaṃ mātṛṣu priyam
analyzed: daśa kṣipaḥ pūrvyam sīmajījanan su jātam mātṛṣu priyam
translated: The ten fingers have generated the ancient, well-born, dear one among the mothers.

original: agniṃ stuhi daivavātaṃ devaśravo yo janānāmasad vaśī
analyzed: agnim stuhi daiva vātam deva śravaḥ yaḥ janānām asat vaśī
translated: Praise Agni, the god-inspired, god-renowned, who is among the people, the powerful one.

original: ni tvā dadhe vara ā pṛthivyā iḷāyās pade sudinatve ahnām
analyzed: ni tvā dadhe vare ā pṛthivyāḥ iḷāyāḥ pade su dina tve ahnām
translated: I have placed thee as a treasure on the earth, in the abode of Iḷā, in the good days.

original: dṛṣadvatyāṃ mānuṣa āpayāyāṃ sarasvatyāṃ revadagnedidīhi
analyzed: dṛṣadvatyām mānuṣe āpayāyām sarasvatyām revat agne didīhi
translated: In the human world of Dṛṣadvatī, in the world of Sarasvatī, O Agni, shine forth with splendor

original: iḷāmagne / / /🔽agne sahasva pṛtanā abhimātīrapāsya
analyzed: iḍām agne  agne sahasva pṛtanāḥ abhimātīḥ apāsya
translated: O Agni, I praise you, O Agni, I praise you🔽O Agni, conquer the battles and drive away the enemies

original: duṣṭarastarannarātīrvarco dhā yajñavāhase
analyzed: duṣṭaraḥ taran arātīḥ varcaḥ dhāḥ yajña vāhase
translated: O Agni, the one who overcomes the enemies, bestow splendor upon the one who brings the sacrifice

original: agna iḷā samidhyase vītihotro amartyaḥ
analyzed: agne iḷā samidhyase vītihotraḥ amartyaḥ
translated: O Agni, you are kindled with the Iḷā, the immortal one who offers oblations to the gods

original: juṣasva sū no adhvaram
analyzed: juṣasva su u naḥ adhvaram
translated: Accept our sacrifice

original: agne dyumnena jāgṛve sahasaḥ sūnavāhuta
analyzed: agne dyumnena jāgṛve sahasaḥ sūnava āhuta
translated: O Agni, the son of strength, the one who is awake with splendor, the one who is invoked by all

original: edaṃ barhiḥ sado
analyzed: ā idam barhiḥ sadaḥ
translated: This is the seat of the sacrificial grass

original: mama
analyzed: mama
translated: mine

original: agne viśvebhiragnibhirdevebhirmahayā giraḥ
analyzed: agne viśvebhiḥ agnibhiḥ devebhiḥ mahaya giraḥ
translated: O Agni, with all the fires, with the gods, magnify the songs

original: yajñeṣu yau cāyavaḥ
analyzed: yajñeṣu yau ca āyavaḥ
translated: And those who are active in the sacrifices

original: agne dā dāśuṣe rayiṃ vīravantaṃ parīṇasam
analyzed: agne dāḥ dāśuṣe rayim vīravantam parīṇasam
translated: O Agni, grant wealth to the one who offers, with heroes, beyond distress

original: śiśīhi naḥ sūnumataḥ
analyzed: śiśīhi naḥ sūnumataḥ
translated: Make us prosperous with sons

original: agne divaḥ sūnurasi pracetāstanā pṛthivyā uta viśvavedāḥ
analyzed: agne divaḥ sūnuḥ asi pracetāḥ stanā pṛthivyāḥ uta viśva vedāḥ
translated: O Agni, you are the son of the sky, the wise one, and of the earth, the all-knowing one

original: ṛdhag devāniha yajā cikitvaḥ
analyzed: ṛdhak devān iha yaja ā cikitvaḥ
translated: Worship the gods here, O wise one

original: agniḥ sanoti vīryāṇi vidvān sanoti vājamamṛtāya bhūṣan
analyzed: agniḥ sanoti vīryāṇi vidvān sanoti vājam amṛtāya bhūṣan
translated: Agni, the wise one, bestows manly powers, bestows strength, adorning himself for the immortal

original: sa no devāneha vahā purukṣo
analyzed: sa naḥ devān ā iha vaha purukṣo
translated: O Agni, bring the gods to us, O you of great strength

original: agnirdyāvāpṛthivī viśvajanye ā bhāti devī amṛte amūraḥ
analyzed: agniḥ dyāvāpṛthivī viśvajanye ā bhāti devī amṛte amūraḥ
translated: Agni shines between heaven and earth, the all-supporting goddess, the immortal one, the wise one

original: kṣayan vājaiḥ puruścandro namobhiḥ
analyzed: kṣayan vājaiḥ puru ścandraḥ namobhiḥ
translated: Decreasing with the powers, the one with many desires, with salutations

original: agna indraśca dāśuṣo durone sutāvato yajñamihopa yātam
analyzed: agne indraḥ ca dāśuṣaḥ durone sutāvataḥ yajñam iha upa yātam
translated: O Agni and Indra, come to the sacrifice of the generous worshipper in his house,

original: amardhantā somapeyāya devā
analyzed: amardhantā soma peyāya devā
translated: Immortal Gods, to drink the Soma.

original: agne apāṃ samidhyase duroṇe nityaḥ sūno sahaso jātavedaḥ
analyzed: agne apām samidhyase duroṇe nityaḥ sūno sahasaḥ jātavedaḥ
translated: O Agni, in the house thou art kindled of the waters, eternal, O son of strength, O all-knower,

original: sadhasthāni mahayamāna ūtī
analyzed: sadhasthāni mahayamānaḥ ūtī
translated: Magnifying the abodes with help.

original: vaiśvānaraṃ manasāgniṃ nicāyyā haviṣmanto anuṣatyaṃ svarvidam
analyzed: vaiśvānaram manasā agnim nicāyyāḥ haviṣmantaḥ anuṣatyam svar vidam
translated: Having kindled in our hearts the fire Vaiṣvânara, the bountiful, the finder of light, the Gods,

original: sudānuṃ devaṃ rathiraṃ vasūyavo gīrbhī raṇvaṃkuśikāso havāmahe
analyzed: sudānum devam rathiram vasūyavaḥ gīrbhiḥ raṇvaṃkuśikāsaḥ havāmahe
translated: The bountiful God, the charioteer, we, seeking wealth, call with our songs the son of Kuṣika.

original: taṃ śubhramagnimavase havāmahe vaiśvānaraṃ mātariśvānamukthyam
analyzed: tam śubhram agnim avase havāmahe vaiśvānaram mātariśvānam ukthyam
translated: We call on that bright Agni for help, Vaiṣvânara, Mâtariṣvan, worthy of praise,

original: bṛhaspatiṃ manuṣo devatātaye vipraṃ śrotāramatithiṃ raghuṣyadam
analyzed: bṛhaspatim manuṣaḥ devatātaye vipram śrotāram atithim raghuṣyadam
translated: Br̥ihaspati, for the worship of men, the priest, the hearer, the guest, the swift to listen.

original: aśvo na krandañ janibhiḥ samidhyate vaiśvānaraḥ kuśikebhiryugeyuge🔽sa no agniḥ suvīryaṃ svaśvyaṃ dadhātu ratnamamṛteṣu jāgṛviḥ
analyzed: aśvaḥ na krandam janibhiḥ samidhyate vaiśvānaraḥ kuśikebhiḥ yuge yuge  sa naḥ agniḥ su vīryam su aśvyam dadhātu ratnam amṛteṣu jāgṛviḥ
translated: Like a horse neighing, he is kindled with the rays, Vaiṣvânara, by the Kuṣikas in every age.🔽May that Agni bestow on us good heroism, good possession of horses, treasure, watchful among the immortals.

original: pra yantu vājāstaviṣībhiragnayaḥ śubhe sammiṣlāḥ pṛṣatīrayukṣata
analyzed: pra yantu vājāḥ taviṣībhiḥ agnayaḥ śubhe sammiṣlāḥ pṛṣatīḥ ayukṣata
translated: Let the strong steeds go forth with their powers, the fires, the spotted ones, well-yoked, have been harnessed for the fair fight.

original: bṛhadukṣo maruto viśvavedasaḥ pra vepayantiparvatānadābhyāḥ
analyzed: bṛhat ukṣaḥ marutaḥ viśva vedasaḥ pra
translated: The Maruts, the bountiful, the all-possessing, make the mountains tremble with their irresistible might.

original: agniśriyo maruto viśvakṛṣṭaya ā tveṣamugramava īmahe vayam
analyzed: agni śriyaḥ marutaḥ viśvakṛṣṭayaḥ ā tveṣam ugram avaḥ īmahe vayam
translated: The Maruts, the brilliant ones, the all-powerful ones, we invoke the fierce and awe-inspiring one.

original: te svānino rudriyā varṣanirṇijaḥ siṃhā na heṣakratavaḥ sudānavaḥ
analyzed: te svāninaḥ rudriyāḥ varṣa nirṇijaḥ siṃhāḥ na heṣa kratavaḥ sudānavaḥ
translated: They, the self-moving ones, the Rudras, the ones with rain-like garments, the ones with lion-like strength, the ones with good gifts,

original: vrātaṃvrātaṃ gaṇaṃgaṇaṃ suśastibhiragnerbhāmaṃ marutāmoja īmahe
analyzed: vrātam vrātam gaṇam gaṇam su śastibhiḥ agneḥ bhāmam marutām ojaḥ īmahe
translated: We invoke with good praises the troop after troop, the band after band, the splendor of Agni, the strength of the Maruts.

original: pṛṣadaśvāso anavabhrarādhaso gantāro yajñaṃ vidatheṣu dhīrāḥ
analyzed: pṛṣat aśvāsaḥ anavabhra rādhasaḥ gantāraḥ yajñam vidatheṣu dhīrāḥ
translated: The ones with dappled horses, the ones with unfailing bounty, the ones who go to the sacrifice, the wise ones,

original: agnirasmi janmanā jātavedā ghṛtaṃ me cakṣuramṛtaṃ ma āsan
analyzed: agniḥ asmi janmanā jātavedāḥ ghṛtam me cakṣuḥ amṛtam me āsan
translated: I am Agni, born of birth, the all-knower, my eye is ghee, my food is nectar.

original: arkastridhātū rajaso vimāno 'jasro gharmo havirasmi nāma
analyzed: arkaḥ tri dhātuḥ rajasaḥ vimānaḥ jasraḥ gharmaḥ haviḥ asmi nāma
translated: The sun, the three-formed one, the measurer of space, the ceaseless heat, the oblation, I am by name.

original: tribhiḥ pavitrairapupod dhyarkaṃ hṛdā matiṃ jyotiranu prajānan
analyzed: tribhiḥ pavitraiḥ apupot hi arkam hṛdā matim jyotiḥ anu prajānan
translated: With three purifiers he has purified the sun, the thought in the heart, following the light, knowing.

original: varṣiṣṭhaṃ ratnamakṛta svadhābhirādid dyāvāpṛthivī paryapaśyat
analyzed: varṣiṣṭham ratnam akṛta svadhābhiḥ ādid dyāvāpṛthivī paryapaśyat
translated: He has made the best treasure with his own powers. He has illumined heaven and earth, he has looked around.

original: śatadhāramutsamakṣīyamāṇaṃ vipaścitaṃ pitaraṃ vaktvānām
analyzed: śata dhāram utsam a kṣīyamāṇam vipaścitam pitaram vaktvānām
translated: The one with a hundred streams, the one who is being diminished, the wise one, the father, the one who speaks,

original: meḷiṃ madantaṃ pitrorupasthe taṃ rodasī pipṛtaṃ satyavācam
analyzed: meḷim madantam pitroḥ upasthe tam rodasī pipṛtam satya vācam
translated: The one who rejoices in the lap of the parents, him, the true-speaking one, may the two worlds nourish.

original: pra vo vājā abhidyavo haviṣmanto ghṛtācyā
analyzed: pra vaḥ vājāḥ abhidyavaḥ haviṣmantaḥ ghṛtācyā
translated: Your powerful and awe-inspiring sacrifices, accompanied by ghee,

original: devāñ jigātisumnayuḥ
analyzed: devām jigātisumnayuḥ
translated: Go to the gods, eager for bliss.

original: īḷe agniṃ vipaścitaṃ girā yajñasya sādhanam
analyzed: īḍe agnim vipaścitam girā yajñasya sādhanam
translated: I praise Agni, the wise one, with a song, the fulfiller of the sacrifice,

original: śruṣṭīvānaṃ dhitāvānam
analyzed: śruṣṭīvānam dhitāvānam
translated: The one who listens, the one who is to be made rich,

original: agne śakema te vayaṃ yamaṃ devasya vājinaḥ
analyzed: agne śakema te vayam yamam devasya vājinaḥ
translated: O Agni, may we be able to serve you, O god, the strong one,

original: ati dveṣāṃsi tarema
analyzed: ati dveṣāṃsi tarema
translated: May we overcome our enemies.

original: samidhyamāno adhvare 'gniḥ pāvaka īḍyaḥ
analyzed: samidhyamānaḥ adhvare gniḥ pāvakaḥ īḍyaḥ
translated: Agni, the purifying one, to be praised, is kindled at the sacrifice,

original: śociṣkeśastamīmahe
analyzed: śociṣkeśaḥ tam īmahe
translated: We invoke him, the one with radiant hair.

original: pṛthupājā amartyo ghṛtanirṇik svāhutaḥ🔽agniryajñasya havyavāṭ
analyzed: pṛthu pājāḥ amartyaḥ ghṛta nirṇij su āhutaḥ  agniḥ yajñasya havyavāṭ
translated: The one with wide paths, the immortal one, whose path is purified by ghee, well-offered,🔽Agni, the carrier of sacrificial offerings,

original: taṃ sabādho yatasruca itthā dhiyā yajñavantaḥ
analyzed: tam sabādhaḥ yata srucaḥ itthā dhiyā yajñavantaḥ
translated: The sacrificers, with their ladles ready, have brought Agni here with their thoughts

original: ā cakruragnimūtaye
analyzed: ā cakruḥ agnim ūtaye
translated: For help.

original: hotā devo amartyaḥ purastādeti māyayā
analyzed: hotā devaḥ amartyaḥ purastāt eti māyayā
translated: The immortal god, the priest, goes forth in front with his magic,

original: vidathāni pracodayan
analyzed: vidathāni pracodayan
translated: Urging the assemblies forward.

original: vājī vājeṣu dhīyate 'dhvareṣu pra ṇīyate
analyzed: vājī vājeṣu dhīyate dhvareṣu pra nīyate
translated: The strong one is placed in the contests, is led forth in the sacrifices,

original: vipro yajñasya sādhanaḥ
analyzed: vipraḥ yajñasya sādhanaḥ
translated: The sage, the performer of the sacrifice.

original: dhiyā cakre vareṇyo bhūtānāṃ garbhamā dadhe
analyzed: dhiyā cakre vareṇyaḥ bhūtānām garbham ā dadhe
translated: By his thought, he, the most excellent one, has made the embryo of beings,

original: dakṣasyapitaraṃ tanā
analyzed: dakṣasya pitaram tanā
translated: The father of Daksha, by his power.

original: ni tvā dadhe vareṇyaṃ dakṣasyeḷā sahaskṛta
analyzed: ni tvā dadhe vareṇyam dakṣasya iḷā sahaskṛta
translated: I have placed you, the most excellent one, as Daksha's priest, O Agni, the performer of a thousand sacrifices,

original: agne sudītimuśijam
analyzed: agne su dītim uśijam
translated: O Agni, the well-shining one, the wise one.

original: agniṃ yanturamapturam ṛtasya yoge vanuṣaḥ
analyzed: agnim yanturam apturam ṛtasya yoge
translated: Agni, the charioteer, the swift one, the sages, the lovers, kindle him with their strength at the union of truth.

original: viprā vājaiḥ samindhate
analyzed: viprāḥ vājaiḥ samindhate
translated: The priests kindle him with their strength.

original: ūrjo napātamadhvare dīdivāṃsamupa dyavi
analyzed: ūrjaḥ napātam adhvare dīdivāṃsam upa dyavi
translated: The son of strength, the shining one, at the sacrifice, they place in the sky.

original: agnimīḷe kavikratum
analyzed: agnim īḍe kavi kratum
translated: I praise Agni, the one with the wise thought.

original: īḷenyo namasyastirastamāṃsi darśataḥ
analyzed: īḍenyaḥ namasyaḥ tirastamāṃsi darśataḥ
translated: Worthy of praise, to be revered, dispelling the darkness, manifest

original: samagniridhyat
analyzed: sam agniḥ idhyat
translated: Agni is kindled well

original: e vṛṣā
analyzed: e vṛṣā
translated: The bull

original: vṛṣo agniḥ samidhyate 'śvo na devavāhanaḥ
analyzed: vṛṣaḥ agniḥ samidhyate śvas na deva vāhanaḥ
translated: The bull Agni is kindled, like a horse, the bearer of the gods

original: taṃ haviṣmanta īḷate
analyzed: tam haviṣmantaḥ īḍate
translated: The sacrificers seek him

original: vṛṣaṇaṃ tvā vayaṃ vṛṣan vṛṣaṇaḥ samidhīmahi
analyzed: vṛṣaṇam tvā vayam vṛṣan vṛṣaṇaḥ samidhīmahi
translated: O bull, we, bulls, kindle thee, O bull,

original: agne dīdyataṃ bṛhat
analyzed: agne dīdyatam bṛhat
translated: O Agni, shine forth greatly

original: agne juṣasva no haviḥ puroḷāśaṃ jātavedaḥ
analyzed: agne juṣasva naḥ haviḥ puroḷāśam jātavedaḥ
translated: O Agni, accept our oblation, the cake, O all-knower,

original: prātaḥsāvedhiyāvaso
analyzed: prātaḥsāvedhiyāvaso
translated: at the morning pressing, O you who are to be invoked with prayer

original: puroḷā agne pacatastubhyaṃ vā ghā pariṣkṛtaḥ
analyzed: puroḍās agne pacataḥ tubhyam vā gha pariṣkṛtaḥ
translated: The cakes, O Agni, are cooked for thee, or the one prepared around

original: taṃ juṣasva yaviṣṭhya
analyzed: tam juṣasva yaviṣṭhya
translated: Accept that, O youngest one

original: agne vīhi puroḷāṣamāhutaṃ tiroahnyam
analyzed: agne vīhi puroḷāṣam āhutam tiroahnyam
translated: O Agni, come to the cake offered, to be eaten across the day,

original: sahasaḥ sūnurasyadhvare hitaḥ
analyzed: sahasaḥ sūnuḥ asi adhvare hitaḥ
translated: The son of strength, placed in the sacrifice

original: mādhyandine savane jātavedaḥ puroḷāśamiha kave juṣasva
analyzed: mādhyandine savane jātavedaḥ puroḷāśam iha kave juṣasva
translated: O all-knower, O wise one, accept here the cake at the midday pressing

original: agne yahvasya tava bhāgadheyaṃ na pra minanti vidatheṣu dhīrāḥ
analyzed: agne yahvasya tava bhāgadheyam na pra minanti vidatheṣu dhīrāḥ
translated: O Agni, the wise ones do not diminish your share in the assemblies, in the great sacrifice

original: agne tṛtīye savane hi kāniṣaḥ puroḷāśaṃ sahasaḥ sūnavāhutam
analyzed: agne tṛtīye savane hi kāniṣaḥ puroḷāśam sahasaḥ sūnava āhutam
translated: O Agni, at the third pressing, you are to be offered the cake, O son of strength

original: athā deveṣvadhvaraṃ vipanyayā dhā ratnavantamamṛteṣu jāgṛvim
analyzed: athā deveṣu adhvaram vipanyayā dhāḥ ratnavantam amṛteṣu jāgṛvim
translated: Then, with your guidance, establish the sacrifice among the gods, watchful among the immortals, rich in treasures

original: agne vṛdhāna āhutiṃ puroḷāśaṃ jātavedaḥ
analyzed: agne vṛdhānaḥ āhutim puroḍāśam jātavedaḥ
translated: O Agni, O all-knower, enjoy the increasing oblation, the cake

original: juṣasva tiroahnyam
analyzed: juṣasva tiroahnyam
translated: Accept it across the day

original: astīdamadhimanthanamasti prajananaṃ kṛtam
analyzed: asti idam adhimanthanam asti prajananam kṛtam
translated: This is the churning, this is the act of generation performed

original: etāṃ viśpatnīmā bharāgniṃ manthāma pūrvathā
analyzed: etām viś patnīm ā bhara agnim manthāma pūrvathā
translated: Bring this wife of the clan, we will churn the fire as before

original: araṇyornihito jātavedā garbha iva sudhito garbhiṇīṣu
analyzed: araṇyoḥ nihitaḥ jātavedāḥ garbhaḥ iva sudhitaḥ garbhiṇīṣu
translated: Jatavedas placed in the kindling woods, like a well-disposed embryo in pregnant women

original: divediva īḍyo jāgṛvadbhirhaviṣmadbhirmanuṣyebhiragniḥ
analyzed: dive dive īḍyaḥ jāgṛvadbhiḥ haviṣmadbhiḥ manuṣyebhiḥ agniḥ
translated: Agni is to be praised day by day by the watchful and offering men

original: uttānāyāmava bharā cikitvān sadyaḥ pravītā vṛṣaṇaṃ jajāna
analyzed: uttānāyām ava bhara cikitvān sadyas pravītā vṛṣaṇam jajāna
translated: Laying him on his back, the wise one, the quickly woven one, gave birth to the powerful one

original: aruṣastūpo ruśadasya pāja iḷāyās putro vayune 'janiṣṭa🔽iḷāyāstvā pade vayaṃ nābhā pṛthivyā adhi
analyzed: aruṣa stūpaḥ ruśadasya pājaḥ iḷāyāḥ putraḥ vayune janiṣṭa  iḷāyāḥ tvā pade vayam nābhā pṛthivyāḥ adhi
translated: His topknot is red, his radiance is white, the son of Iḷā was born in the division🔽We in the abode of Iḷā, on the navel of the earth

original: jātavedo ni dhīmahyagne havyāya voḷhave
analyzed: jātavedaḥ ni dhīmahi agne havyāya voḷhave
translated: We place you, O all-knower Agni, for the offering to carry

original: manthatā naraḥ kavimadvayantaṃ pracetasamamṛtaṃ supratīkam
analyzed: manthatā naraḥ kavim advayantam pracetasam amṛtam su pratīkam
translated: Men churn the wise one, the all-knowing, the immortal, the well-formed one

original: yajñasya ketuṃ prathamaṃ purastādagniṃ naro janayatā suśevam🔽yadī manthanti bāhubhirvi rocate 'śvo na vājyaruṣo vaneṣvā
analyzed: yajñasya ketum prathamam purastāt agnim naraḥ janayata su śevam  yadī manthanti bāhubhiḥ vi rocate śvas na vājī aruṣaḥ vaneṣvā
translated: The banner of the sacrifice, the first in front, men generate Agni, the very gracious one🔽When they churn with their arms, he shines forth, like a swift red horse in the woods

original: citro na yāmannaśvinoranivṛtaḥ pari vṛṇaktyaśmanastṛṇā dahan
analyzed: citraḥ na yāman aśvinoḥ anivṛtaḥ pari vṛṇakti aśmanaḥ tṛṇā dahan
translated: Unrestrained, like a variegated horse, he encircles the stones, burning the grass, on the way of the Ashvins

original: jāto agnī rocate cekitāno vājī vipraḥ kaviśastaḥ sudānuḥ
analyzed: jātaḥ agniḥ rocate cekitānaḥ vājī vipraḥ kavi śastaḥ sudānuḥ
translated: The born Agni shines, the wise one, the strong one, the sage, praised by the wise, the bountiful one

original: yaṃ devāsa īḍyaṃ viśvavidaṃ havyavāhamadadhuradhvareṣu
analyzed: yam devāsaḥ īḍyam viśva vidam havyavāham adadhuḥ adhvareṣu
translated: Whom the gods have placed as to be worshipped, all-knowing, as the bearer of oblations, in the sacrifices

original: sīda hotaḥ sva u loke cikitvān sādayā yajñaṃ sukṛtasya yonau
analyzed: sīda hotar sve u loke cikitvān sādaya yajñam sukṛtasya yonau
translated: Sit as Hotar in your own world, O wise one, seat the sacrifice in the womb of good deeds

original: devāvīrdevān haviṣā yajāsyagne bṛhad yajamāne vayo dhāḥ
analyzed: devāvīḥ devān haviṣā yajāsi agne bṛhat yajamāne vayaḥ dhāḥ
translated: Worship the gods with oblation, O Agni, bestow great life on the sacrificer

original: kṛṇota dhūmaṃ vṛṣaṇaṃ sakhāyo 'sredhanta itana vājamacha
analyzed: kṛṇota dhūmam vṛṣaṇam sakhāyo sredhantaḥ itana vājam acha
translated: Make the smoke strong, O friends, those who desire strength, go forth to the prize

original: ayamagniḥ pṛtanāṣāṭ suvīro yena devāso asahanta dasyūn
analyzed: ayam agniḥ pṛtanāṣāh su vīraḥ yena devāsaḥ asahanta dasyūn
translated: This Agni is the conqueror in battles, with great heroes, by whom the gods overcame the dasyus

original: ayaṃ te yonirṛtviyo yato jāto arocathāḥ
analyzed: ayam te yoniḥ ṛtviyaḥ yatas jātaḥ arocathāḥ
translated: This is your proper birthplace, from which born you have shone forth

original: taṃ jānannagna ā sīdāthā no vardhayā giraḥ
analyzed: tam jānan agne ā sīda atha ā naḥ vardhaya giraḥ
translated: Knowing that, O Agni, sit down, and then increase our songs

original: tanūnapāducyate garbha āsuro narāśaṃso bhavati yad vijāyate
analyzed: tanūnapāt ucyate garbhaḥ āsuraḥ narāśaṃsaḥ bhavati yat vijāyate
translated: Tanūnapāt is called the embryo, the Asura, Narāśaṁsa, when he is born

original: mātariśvā yadamimīta mātari vātasya sargo abhavatsarīmaṇi
analyzed: mātariśvā yat amimīta mātari vātasya sargaḥ abhavat sarīmaṇi
translated: When he measured in the mother, in the mother, the creation of the wind became in the swift one

original: sunirmathā nirmathitaḥ sunidhā nihitaḥ kaviḥ
analyzed: sunirmathā nirmathitaḥ sunidhā nihitaḥ kaviḥ
translated: Well-broken, he is broken, well-placed, he is placed, the wise one

original: agne svadhvarā kṛṇu devān devayate yaja
analyzed: agne su adhvarā kṛṇu devān devayate yaja
translated: O Agni, make the sacrifices, worship the gods who are to be worshipped

original: ajījanannamṛtaṃ martyāso 'sremāṇaṃ taraṇiṃ vīḷujambham
analyzed: ajījanan amṛtam martyāsaḥ sremāṇam taraṇim vīḍu jambham
translated: The mortals have generated the immortal, the unaging, the swift one, the thunder-armed

original: daśa svasāro agruvaḥ samīcīḥ pumāṃsaṃ jātamabhi saṃ rabhante
analyzed: daśa svasāraḥ agruvaḥ samīcīḥ pumāṃsam jātam abhi sam rabhante
translated: The ten sisters, the unmarried ones, the same ones, rush together to the male who is born

original: pra saptahotā sanakādarocata māturupasthe yadaśocadūdhani
analyzed: pra saptahotā sanakāt arocata mātuḥ upasthe yat aśocat ūdhani
translated: The seven-priest shone forth from the beginning, when he shone in the womb, in the udder of his mother.

original: na ni miṣati suraṇo divedive yadasurasya jaṭharādajāyata
analyzed: na ni miṣati suraṇaḥ dive dive yat asurasya jaṭharāt ajāyata
translated: The one who delights does not close his eyes day by day, when he was born from the belly of the Asura.

original: amitrāyudho marutāmiva prayāḥ prathamajā brahmaṇo viśvamid viduḥ
analyzed: amitra āyudhaḥ marutām iva prayāḥ prathama jāḥ brahmaṇaḥ viśvam id viduḥ
translated: Like the Maruts, the weapons of the enemy, the first-born know all this, the Brahman of the Kuśikas.

original: dyumnavad brahma kuśikāsa erira ekaeko dame agniṃ samīdhire
analyzed: dyumnavat brahma kuśikāsaḥ erire ekaikaḥ dame agnim samīdhire
translated: The Brahman with glory, the Kuśikas, the one and only one, have kindled Agni in the house.

original: yadadya tvā prayati yajñe asmin hotaścikitvo 'vṛṇīmahīha
analyzed: yat adya tvā prayati yajñe asmin hotar cikitvaḥ vṛṇīmahi iha
translated: Since today, when thou art active, in this sacrifice, we have chosen thee, O wise Hotar,

original: dhruvamayā dhruvamutāśamiṣṭhāḥ prajānan vidvānupa yāhi somam
analyzed: dhruvam ayāḥ dhruvam uta aśamiṣṭhāḥ prajānan vidvān upa yāhi somam
translated: Firmly have they stood, firmly have they sat down. Knowing, understanding, come to the Soma.

original: ichanti tvā somyāsaḥ sakhāyaḥ sunvanti somaṃ dadhati prayāṃsi
analyzed: ichanti tvā somyāsaḥ sakhāyaḥ sunvanti somam dadhati prayāṃsi
translated: Thy friends who love Soma long for thee. They press Soma, they prepare the offerings.

original: titikṣante abhiśastiṃ janānāmindra tvadā kaścana hi praketaḥ
analyzed: titikṣante abhiśastim janānām indra tvadā kaścana hi praketaḥ
translated: They endure the curse of men. No one, O Indra, is a match for thee.

original: na te dūre paramā cid rajāṃsyā tu pra yāhi harivo haribhyām
analyzed: na te dūre paramā cit rajāṃsyā tu pra yāhi harivas haribhyām
translated: Not even the farthest regions are far for thee. Come hither, O thou who lovest the tawny ones, with the two tawny ones.

original: sthirāya vṛṣṇe savanā kṛtemā yuktā grāvāṇaḥ samidhāne agnau
analyzed: sthirāya vṛṣṇe savanā kṛtā imā yuktāḥ grāvāṇaḥ samidhāne agnau
translated: For the firm, the strong, these libations are prepared. The pressing-stones are yoked, the fire is kindled with fuel.

original: indraḥ suśipro maghavā tarutro mahāvrātastuvikūrmirṛghāvān
analyzed: indraḥ su śipraḥ maghavā tarutraḥ mahā vrātaḥ tuvikūrmiḥ ṛghāvān
translated: Indra, of beautiful eyebrows, the bountiful, the deliverer, the one with great hosts, the all-conquering, the impetuous,

original: yadugro dhā bādhito martyeṣu kva tyā te vṛṣabha vīryāṇi
analyzed: yat ugraḥ dhāḥ bādhitaḥ martyeṣu kva tyā te vṛṣabha vīryāṇi
translated: When thou, O mighty one, art offended with mortals, O bull, where are thy manly powers?

original: tvaṃ hi ṣmā cyāvayannacyutānyeko vṛtrā carasi jighnamānaḥ
analyzed: tvam hi sma ā cyāvayan acyutāni ekaḥ vṛtrā carasi jighnamānaḥ
translated: For thou, shaking the unshaken, alone, O Indra, goest about destroying the Vr̥itras.

original: tava dyāvāpṛthivī parvatāso 'nu vratāya nimiteva tasthuḥ
analyzed: tava dyāvāpṛthivī parvatāsaḥ nu vratāya nimitā iva tasthuḥ
translated: To thee, O Indra, the two world-halves, the mountains, as if obedient to a command, have stood fast in the observance of the law.

original: utābhaye puruhūta śravobhireko dṛḷhamavado vṛtrahā san🔽ime cidindra rodasī apāre yat saṃgṛbhṇā maghavan kāśirit te
analyzed: uta abhaye puruhūta śravobhiḥ ekaḥ dṛḍham avadaḥ vṛtrahā san  ime cit indra rodasī apāre yat saṃgṛbhṇāḥ maghavan kāśiḥ id te
translated: And in the fearless (battle), O much-invoked one, alone, being the Vr̥itra-slayer, thou hast uttered thy firm (promise) for (winning) glory.🔽Even these two world-halves, O Indra, are not too broad for thee, when, O bountiful one, thou hast encompassed them, O Kaśir.

original: pra sū ta indra pravatā haribhyāṃ pra te vajraḥ pramṛṇannetu śatrūn
analyzed: pra su u te indra pravatā haribhyām pra te vajraḥ pramṛṇan etu śatrūn
translated: Go forth, O Indra, on thy paths with thy two bay steeds; let thy bolt go forth, crushing the enemies.

original: jahi pratīco anūcaḥ parāco viśvaṃ satyaṃkṛṇuhi viṣṭamastu
analyzed: jahi pratīcaḥ anūcaḥ parācaḥ viśvam satyaṃkṛṇuhi viṣṭam astu
translated: Destroy the near and the far enemies; make all things real; let the whole (world) be subject (to us).

original: yasmai dhāyuradadhā martyāyābhaktaṃ cid bhajate gehyaṃ saḥ
analyzed: yasmai dhāyuḥ adadhāḥ martyāya a bhaktam cit bhajate gehyam saḥ
translated: To that mortal whom thou hast made to live, even the unfaithful one will give of his house.

original: bhadrā ta indra sumatirghṛtācī sahasradānā puruhūta rātiḥ
analyzed: bhadrā te indra sumatiḥ ghṛtācī sahasra dānā puruhūta rātiḥ
translated: O Indra, thy gracious favour, O much-invoked one, is good, the gift of a thousand, the gift of ghee.

original: sahadānuṃ puruhūta kṣiyantamahastamindra saṃ piṇak kuṇārum
analyzed: saha dānum puruhūta kṣiyantam ahastam indra sam piṇak kuṇārum
translated: Thou, O Indra, hast crushed the Dānu who dwelt in the earth, and Kuṇâru who dwelt in the sky.

original: abhi vṛtraṃ vardhamānaṃ piyārumapādamindra tavasā jaghantha
analyzed: abhi vṛtram vardhamānam piyāruma pādam indra tavasā jaghantha
translated: Thou, O Indra, with thy strength hast smitten down the Vr̥itra who waxed strong, the pitiless one, the footless one.

original: ni sāmanāmiṣirāmindra bhūmiṃ mahīmapārāṃ sadane sasattha
analyzed: ni sāmanām iṣirām indra bhūmim mahīm apārām sadane sasattha
translated: I yoke thee with the hymn, O Indra, to the great boundless region in the seat of the strong

original: astabhnād dyāṃ vṛṣabho antarikṣamarṣantvāpastvayeha prasūtāḥ
analyzed: astabhnāt dyām vṛṣabhaḥ antarikṣam arṣantu āpaḥ tvayā iha prasūtāḥ
translated: The bull hath supported the sky and the atmosphere; let the waters flow here, impelled by thee

original: alātṛṇo vala indra vrajo goḥ purā hantorbhayamāno vyāra
analyzed: alātṛṇaḥ valaḥ indra vrajaḥ goḥ purā hantoḥ bhayamānaḥ vyāra
translated: The pen of the cow, O Indra, is without a fence, fearing the stroke, it hath gone away

original: sugān patho akṛṇon niraje gāḥ prāvan vāṇīḥ puruhūtaṃ dhamantīḥ
analyzed: su gān pathaḥ akṛṇot niraje gāḥ prāvan vāṇīḥ puruhūtam dhamantīḥ
translated: He hath made the paths easy, the cows are free from debt; the voices, blowing, have filled the much-invoked one

original: eko dve vasumatī samīcī indra ā paprau pṛthivīmuta dyām
analyzed: ekaḥ dve vasumatī samīcī indraḥ ā paprau pṛthivīm uta dyām
translated: Alone, Indra, he hath filled the two vast worlds, the earth and the sky, in unison

original: utāntarikṣādabhi naḥ samīka iṣo rathīḥ sayujaḥ śūra vājān
analyzed: uta antarikṣāt abhi naḥ samīke iṣaḥ rathīḥ sayujaḥ śūra vājān
translated: And from the atmosphere, O hero, bring us food, chariots, and wealth, with thy yoked (steeds)

original: diśaḥ sūryo na mināti pradiṣṭā divedive haryaśvaprasūtāḥ
analyzed: diśaḥ sūryaḥ na mināti pradiṣṭāḥ dive dive haryaśva prasūtāḥ
translated: The sun, the guide, does not transgress the regions, urged on day by day by the bay steeds

original: saṃ yadānaḷ adhvana ādidaśvairvimocanaṃ kṛṇute tat tvasya
analyzed: sam yadā anaḍ adhvanaḥ ādidaśvaiḥ vimocanam kṛṇute tat tvasya
translated: When he hath yoked the two in the beginning with the horses, he performs the loosing of them, that is his

original: didṛkṣanta uṣaso yāmannaktorvivasvatyā mahi citramanīkam
analyzed: didṛkṣantaḥ uṣasaḥ yāman naktoḥ vivasvatyāḥ mahi citram anīkam
translated: The dawns, looking for the great wondrous form of the night, are coming

original: viśve jānanti mahinā yadāgādindrasya karma sukṛtāpurūṇi
analyzed: viśve jānanti mahinā yat āgāt indrasya karma su kṛtā a purūṇi
translated: All know by their greatness when he hath come, the many well-performed deeds of Indra

original: mahi jyotirnihitaṃ vakṣaṇāsvāmā pakvaṃ carati bibhratī gauḥ
analyzed: mahi jyotiḥ nihitam vakṣaṇāsvāmā pakvam carati bibhratī gauḥ
translated: The great light is laid in the womb; the cow, bearing the ripe (food), moves about

original: viśvaṃ svādma sambhṛtamusriyāyāṃ yat sīmindro adadhād bhojanāya
analyzed: viśvam svādma sambhṛtam usriyāyām yat sīm indraḥ adadhāt bhojanāya
translated: The universe is gathered in the cow's udder, which Indra has placed there for our enjoyment.

original: indra dṛhya yāmakośā abhūvan yajñāya śikṣa gṛṇate sakhibhyaḥ
analyzed: indra dṛhya yāma kośāḥ abhūvan yajñāya śikṣa gṛṇate sakhibhyaḥ
translated: O Indra, be firm; the treasures are ready. Train for the sacrifice, for the singing, for the friends.

original: durmāyavo durevā martyāso niṣaṅgiṇo ripavo hantvāsaḥ
analyzed: durmāyavaḥ durevāḥ martyāsaḥ niṣaṅgiṇaḥ ripavaḥ hantvāsaḥ
translated: The mortals with evil thoughts, the evil-doers, the bowmen, the enemies, the slayers,

original: saṃ ghoṣaḥ śṛṇve 'vamairamitrairjahī nyeṣvaśaniṃ tapiṣṭhām🔽vṛścemadhastād vi rujā sahasva jahi rakṣo maghavan randhayasva
analyzed: sam ghoṣaḥ śṛṇve vamaiḥ amitraiḥ jahi nyeṣu aśanim tapiṣṭhām  vṛśca id adhastāt vi rujā sahasva jahi rakṣaḥ maghavan randhayasva
translated: I hear the shout of the low ones, the enemies. Strike them with thy sharpest thunderbolt.🔽Break them below, rend them asunder, conquer. Slay the Rakshas, O mighty one, destroy them.

original: ud vṛha rakṣaḥ sahamūlamindra vṛścā madhyaṃ pratyagraṃśṛṇīhi
analyzed: ud vṛha rakṣaḥ saha mūlam indra vṛśca madhyam pratyagraṃśṛṇīhi
translated: Break the Rakshas, O Indra, with its roots. Break its middle, make its end sharp.

original: ā kīvataḥ salalūkaṃ cakartha brahmadviṣe tapuṣiṃ hetimasya
analyzed: ā kīvataḥ salalūkam cakartha brahma dviṣe tapuṣim hetimasya
translated: Thou hast made the Brahman-hater's weapon burn like a flame, O thou of the Kivi tribe.

original: svastaye vājibhiśca praṇetaḥ saṃ yan mahīriṣa āsatsipūrvīḥ🔽rāyo vantāro bṛhataḥ syāmāsme astu bhaga indraprajāvān
analyzed: svastaye vājibhiḥ ca praṇetar sam yat mahīriṣaḥ āsatsipūrvīḥ  rāyaḥ vantāraḥ bṛhataḥ syāma asme astu bhagaḥ indra prajāvān
translated: For our welfare, O thou who leadest with the strong ones, when thou hast sat down on the great seats.🔽May we be the supporters of great wealth. May fortune with offspring be ours, O Indra.

original: ā no bhara bhagamindra dyumantaṃ ni te deṣṇasya dhīmahi prareke
analyzed: ā naḥ bhara bhagam indra dyumantam ni te deṣṇasya dhīmahi prareke
translated: Bring us, O Indra, glorious fortune. We will think of the first portion of thy gifts.

original: ūrva iva paprathe kāmo asme tamā pṛṇa vasupate vasūnām
analyzed: ūrvaḥ iva paprathe kāmaḥ asme tamā pṛṇa vasu pate vasūnām
translated: Desire hath spread itself like a wide plain among us. Fulfil that, O Lord of treasure, of treasures.

original: imaṃ kāmaṃ mandayā gobhiraśvaiścandravatā rādhasā paprathaśca
analyzed: imam kāmam mandayā gobhiḥ aśvaiḥ candravatā rādhasā paprathaḥ ca
translated: Fulfill this wish of mine with cattle and horses, with wealth that is rich in horses, and with fame

original: svaryavo matibhistubhyaṃ viprā indrāya vāhaḥkuśikāso akran
analyzed: svaryavaḥ matibhiḥ tubhyam viprāḥ indrāya vāhaḥ kuśikāsaḥ akran
translated: The singers, rich in heaven, the Kuśikas have brought the oblation to you, O Indra, with their thoughts

original: ā no gotrā dardṛhi gopate gāḥ samasmabhyaṃ sanayo yantu vājāḥ
analyzed: ā naḥ gotrā dardṛhi gopate gāḥ sam asmabhyam sanayaḥ yantu vājāḥ
translated: O lord of cattle, burst open our stalls for the cattle; may the prizes come to us, O thou who givest prizes

original: divakṣā asi vṛṣabha satyaśuṣmo 'smabhyaṃ su maghavan bodhi godāḥ
analyzed: divakṣāḥ asi vṛṣabha satya śuṣma u smabhyam su maghavan bodhi go dāḥ
translated: Thou art the one who desires heaven, O bull, with true strength; be thou, O bountiful one, a giver of cattle to us

original: śunaṃ huvema maghavānamindramasmin bhare nṛtamaṃ vājasātau🔽śṛṇvantamugramūtaye samatsu ghnantaṃ vṛtrāṇi saṃjitaṃ dhanānām
analyzed: śunam huvema maghavānam indram asmin bhare nṛtamam vājasātau  śṛṇvantam ugram ūtaye samatsu ghnantam vṛtrāṇi saṃjitam dhanānām
translated: We will invoke the bountiful Indra, the best of men, in this contest, in the winning of booty🔽The terrible one who listens for help in battles, who slays Vr̥itras, who conquers in winning wealth

original: śāsad vahnirduhiturnaptyaṃ gād vidvān ṛtasya dīdhitiṃsaparyan
analyzed: śāsat vahniḥ duhituḥ naptyam gāt vidvān ṛtasya dīdhitim saparyan
translated: The priest, knowing the light of truth, has served the grandson of the daughter,

original: pitā yatra duhituḥ sekam ṛñjan saṃ śagmyena manasā dadhanve
analyzed: pitā yatra duhituḥ sekam ṛñjan sam śagmyena manasā dadhanve
translated: Where the father, longing for the daughter's embrace, has stretched out with a friendly mind

original: na jāmaye tānvo rikthamāraik cakāra garbhaṃ saniturnidhānam
analyzed: na jāmaye tānvaḥ riktham āraik cakāra garbham sanituḥ nidhānam
translated: He has not taken away the inheritance of the daughter, the son of the one who wins, the treasure

original: yadī mātaro janayanta vahnimanyaḥ kartā sukṛtoranya ṛndhan
analyzed: yadī mātaraḥ janayanta vahnim anyaḥ kartā sukṛtoḥ anyaḥ ṛndhan
translated: When the mothers bring forth the priest, one makes the well-made ones, another brings them forth

original: agnirjajñe juhvā rejamāno mahas putrānaruṣasya prayakṣe
analyzed: agniḥ jajñe juhvā rejamānaḥ mahaḥ putrān aruṣasya prayakṣe
translated: Agni was born, shining with the ladle, the son of the ruddy one, in the sight of the great ones

original: mahān garbho mahyā jātameṣāṃ mahī pravṛd dharyaśvasya yajñaiḥ
analyzed: mahān garbhaḥ mahyāḥ jātam eṣām mahī pravṛdh haryaśvasya yajñaiḥ
translated: The great womb, the great one born of me, the earth is their place. With the sacrifices of Haryaśva

original: abhi jaitrīrasacanta spṛdhānaṃ mahi jyotistamaso nirajānan
analyzed: abhi jaitrīḥ asacanta spṛdhānam mahi jyotiḥ tamasaḥ nirajānan
translated: They followed the victorious, the companion, they brought great light out of the darkness.

original: taṃ jānatīḥ pratyudāyannuṣāsaḥ patirgavāmabhavadeka indraḥ
analyzed: tam jānatīḥ pratyudāyan uṣāsaḥ patiḥ gavām abhavat ekaḥ indraḥ
translated: The dawns, knowing him, returned, Indra became the lord of the cattle, the one.

original: vīḷau satīrabhi dhīrā atṛndan prācāhinvan manasā saptaviprāḥ
analyzed: vīḍau satīḥ abhi dhīrāḥ atṛndan prācā ahinvan manasā sapta viprāḥ
translated: The wise ones milked the cows that were full, the seven priests urged them on with their minds.

original: viśvāmavindan pathyām ṛtasya prajānannit tānamasā viveśa
analyzed: viśvām avindan pathyām ṛtasya prajānan id tā namasā viveśa
translated: They found the path of truth, knowing it, he entered it with his mind.

original: vidad yadī saramā rugṇamadrermahi pāthaḥ pūrvyaṃ sadhryak kaḥ
analyzed: vidat yadī saramā rugṇam adreḥ mahi pāthaḥ pūrvyam sadhryak kaḥ
translated: If Saramā found the wounded one of the mountain, who is the great ancient path?

original: agraṃ nayat supadyakṣarāṇāmachā ravaṃ prathamā jānatī gāt🔽agachadu vipratamaḥ sakhīyannasūdayat sukṛte garbhamadriḥ
analyzed: agram nayat su padī akṣarāṇām achā ravam prathamā jānatī gāt  agacchat u vipratamaḥ sakhīyan asūdayat su kṛte garbham adriḥ
translated: He led the foremost of the swift-moving ones, the first one knowing the way went to the light.🔽He went, the most inspired of the sages, befriending, the mountain brought forth the well-prepared embryo.

original: sasāna maryo yuvabhirmakhasyannathābhavadaṅgirāḥ sadyo arcan
analyzed: sasāna maryaḥ yuvabhiḥ makhasyan atha abhavat aṅgirāḥ sadyas arcan
translated: The young man, nourished by the two, the sacrificer, then became Aṅgiras, immediately shining.

original: sataḥsataḥ pratimānaṃ purobhūrviśvā veda janimā hanti śuṣṇam
analyzed: satas sataḥ pratimānam purobhūḥ viśvā veda janimā hanti śuṣṇam
translated: The forerunner of each good thing, he knows all generations, he destroys the wicked.

original: pra ṇo divaḥ padavīrgavyurarcan sakhā sakhīnramuñcan niravadyāt
analyzed: pra naḥ divaḥ padavīḥ gavyuḥ arcan sakhā sakhīn ramuñcat niravadyāt
translated: Shining from heaven, the one to be praised, the friend, releasing the friends from blame,

original: ni gavyatā manasā sedurarkaiḥ kṛṇvānāso amṛtatvāya gātum
analyzed: ni gavyatā manasā seduḥ arkaiḥ kṛṇvānāsaḥ amṛta tvāya gātum
translated: They have sat down with thoughts of kine and hymns, making for themselves a way to immortality.

original: idaṃ cin nu sadanaṃ bhūryeṣāṃ yena māsānasiṣāsannṛtena
analyzed: idam cit nu sadanam bhūri eṣām yena māsān asiṣāsan ṛtena
translated: This is indeed the seat of those by whom, through the eternal law, they have gained the months.

original: sampaśyamānā amadannabhi svaṃ payaḥ pratnasya retaso dughānāḥ🔽vi rodasī atapad ghoṣa eṣāṃ jāte niṣṭhāmadadhurgoṣu vīrān
analyzed: sampaśyamānāḥ amadan abhi svam payaḥ pratnasya retasaḥ dughānāḥ  vi rodasī atapat ghoṣaḥ eṣām jāte niṣṭhām adadhuḥ goṣu vīrān
translated: Looking on each other, they have rejoiced in their own milk, milking the ancient seed.🔽The light of these hath shone between the two world-halves: they have placed the youngling in the stalls, the heroes.

original: sa jātebhirvṛtrahā sedu havyairudusriyā asṛjadindro arkaiḥ🔽urūcyasmai ghṛtavad bharantī madhu svādma duduhe jenyā gauḥ
analyzed: sa jātebhiḥ vṛtrahā sedu havyaiḥ udusriyāḥ asṛjat indraḥ arkaiḥ  urūcī asmai ghṛtavat bharantī madhu svādma duduhe jenyā gauḥ
translated: The Vritra-slayer hath sat down with the younglings: with the oblations Indra hath sent forth the two brown ones.🔽The wide earth bears to him the food filled with fat: the noble cow hath yielded sweet milk to drink.

original: pitre ciccakruḥ sadanaṃ samasmai mahi tviṣīmat sukṛto vihi khyan
analyzed: pitre cit cakruḥ sadanam samasmai mahi tviṣīmat su kṛtaḥ vihi khyan
translated: They have made a seat for him, the Father, for him: the well-made ones have spread out the mighty one, the radiant.

original: viṣkabhnanta skambhanenā janitrī āsīnā ūrdhvaṃ rabhasaṃ vi minvan
analyzed: viṣkabhnanta skambhanena ā janitrī āsīnāḥ ūrdhvam rabhasam vi minvan
translated: The two mothers have extended the support with the prop: sitting, they have spread out the lofty one.

original: mahī yadi dhiṣaṇā śiśnathe dhāt sadyovṛdhaṃ vibhvaṃ rodasyoḥ
analyzed: mahī yadi dhiṣaṇā śiśnathe dhāt sadyovṛdham vibhvam rodasyoḥ
translated: If the mighty Dhishaṇâ will give him strength, the suddenly-waxing, mighty one of the two world-halves.

original: giro yasminnanavadyāḥ samīcīrviśvā indrāya taviṣīranuttāḥ
analyzed: giraḥ yasmin anavadyāḥ samīcīḥ viśvāḥ indrāya taviṣīḥ anuttāḥ
translated: In him the faultless, harmonious songs, all the mighty ones, are for Indra, the unconquered.

original: mahyā te sakhyaṃ vaśmi śaktīrā vṛtraghne niyuto yanti pūrvīḥ
analyzed: mahyā te sakhyam vaśmi śaktīrā vṛtra ghne niyutaḥ yanti pūrvīḥ
translated: I seek thy great friendship, thy powers: many teams go forth to the Vr̥itra-slayer.

original: mahi stotramava āganma sūrerasmākaṃ su maghavan bodhi gopāḥ🔽mahi kṣetraṃ puru ścandraṃ vividvānādit sakhibhyaścarathaṃ samairat
analyzed: mahi stotramavaḥ āganma sūreḥ asmākam su maghavan bodhi gopāḥ  mahi kṣetram puru ścandram vividvān ādit sakhibhyaḥ caratham samairat
translated: Great is the praise: come to us, O Sūrya. Be our protector, O bountiful one.🔽The wise one has found the great field, the very bright one. He has made the chariot go to his friends.

original: indro nṛbhirajanad dīdyānaḥ sākaṃ sūryamuṣasaṃ gātumagnim🔽apaścideṣa vibhvo damūnāḥ pra sadhrīcīrasṛjad viśvaścandrāḥ
analyzed: indraḥ nṛbhiḥ ajanat dīdyānaḥ sākam sūryam uṣasam gātum agnim  apaścit eṣa vibhvaḥ damūnāḥ pra sadhrīcīḥ asṛjat viśva ścandrāḥ
translated: Indra, the shining one, has been born with men, together with the sun, the dawn, and Agni.🔽This all-pervading one, the guest, has created the two straight-going ones, all-shining, together with the waters.

original: madhvaḥ punānāḥ kavibhiḥ pavitrairdyubhirhinvantyaktubhirdhanutrīḥ
analyzed: madhvaḥ punānāḥ kavibhiḥ pavitraiḥ dyubhiḥ hinvanti aktubhiḥ dhanutrīḥ
translated: The purifying ones, with the sweet drink, are urged on by the wise ones with the purifying filters, the sky-like ones, the two that support.

original: anu kṛṣṇe vasudhitī jihāte ubhe sūryasya maṃhanā yajatre
analyzed: anu kṛṣṇe vasu dhitī jihāte ubhe sūryasya maṃhanā yajatre
translated: The two dark ones, the supporters of wealth, are extended by the greatness of the sun, the two worthy of sacrifice.

original: pari yat te mahimānaṃ vṛjadhyai sakhāya indra kāmyā ṛjipyāḥ
analyzed: pari yat te mahimānam vṛjadhyai sakhāyaḥ indra kāmyāḥ ṛjipyāḥ
translated: I will extol your greatness, O Indra, the friends, the desirers of good, the straight-going ones.

original: patirbhava vṛtrahan sūnṛtānāṃ girāṃ viśvāyurvṛṣabho vayodhāḥ🔽ā no gahi sakhyebhiḥ śivebhirmahān mahībhirūtibhiḥ saraṇyan🔽tamaṅgirasvan namasā saparyan navyaṃ kṛṇomi sanyase purājām
analyzed: patiḥ bhava vṛtrahan sūnṛtānām girām viśvāyuḥ vṛṣabhaḥ vayodhāḥ  ā naḥ gahi sakhyebhiḥ śivebhiḥ mahān mahībhiḥ ūtibhiḥ saraṇyan  tam aṅgirasvat namasā saparyan navyam kṛṇomi sanyase purājām
translated: Be the lord of the truthful ones, O Vṛtra-killer, the all-supporting bull, the strength-bestowing one, with the songs.🔽Come to us with your auspicious friendships, the great one, the one to be sought, with your mighty aids.🔽I will honor you, O Aṅgiras-like one, with reverence, I will make the new one, the ancient one, ready for the sacrifice.

original: druho vi yāhi bahulā adevīḥ svaśca no maghavan sātaye dhāḥ
analyzed: druhaḥ vi yāhi bahulāḥ adevīḥ svar ca naḥ maghavan sātaye dhāḥ
translated: Go away from the many, the godless enemies. Be our lord, O bountiful one, for our support.

original: mihaḥ pāvakāḥ pratatā abhūvan svasti naḥ pipṛhi pāramāsām
analyzed: mihaḥ pāvakāḥ pratatāḥ abhūvan svasti naḥ pipṛhi pāramāsām
translated: The purifying flames have spread forth from the rain, grant us well-being, nourish us to the end of our days.

original: indra tvaṃ rathiraḥ pāhi no riṣo makṣūmakṣū kṛṇuhi gojito naḥ
analyzed: indra tvam rathiraḥ pāhi naḥ riṣaḥ makṣūmakṣū kṛṇuhi go jitaḥ naḥ
translated: O Indra, be our protector from harm, make us victorious in battles for cattle.

original: adediṣṭa vṛtrahā gopatirgā antaḥ kṛṣṇānaruṣairdhāmabhirgāt
analyzed: adediṣṭa vṛtrahā go patiḥ gāḥ antar kṛṣṇān aruṣaiḥ dhāmabhiḥ gāt
translated: The slayer of Vrtra, the lord of cattle, has given the cattle. He has gone among the dark and red abodes.

original: pra sūnṛtā diśamāna ṛtena duraśca viśvā avṛṇodapa svāḥ
analyzed: pra sūnṛtāḥ diśamānaḥ ṛtena duraḥ ca viśvāḥ avṛṇot apa svāḥ
translated: He, the one who bestows joy, has separated the directions by law, and has covered all the evil ones with his own (power).

original: śunaṃ huvema / / /
analyzed: śunam huvema
translated: We will call him, the one who is to be praised, the one who is to be invoked, the one who is to be glorified, the one who is to be extolled, the one who is to be honored, the one who is to be revered, the one who is to be praised, the one who is to be sung, the one who is to be glorified, the one who is to be praised with lauds.

original: indra somaṃ somapate pibemaṃ mādhyandinaṃ savanaṃ cāru yat te
analyzed: indra somam soma pate piba imam mādhyandinam savanam cāru yat te
translated: O Indra, lord of Soma, drink this Soma, the beautiful midday libation that is yours.

original: prapruthyā śipre maghavannṛjīṣin vimucyā harī ihamādayasva
analyzed: prapruthyā śipre maghavan ṛjīṣin vimucyā harī iha mādayasva
translated: Having unyoked your swift and powerful tawny horses here, O mighty one, rejoice!

original: gavāśiraṃ manthinamindra śukraṃ pibā somaṃ rarimā te madāya
analyzed: gavāśiram manthinam indra śukram piba somam rarimā te madāya
translated: O Indra, drink the milk-topped, frothy, bright Soma. We have pressed it for your intoxication.

original: brahmakṛtā mārutenā gaṇena sajoṣā rudraistṛpadāvṛṣasva
analyzed: brahma kṛtā mārutenā gaṇena sajoṣāḥ rudraiḥ tṛpadā āvṛṣasva
translated: In accord with the host of Maruts who perform the prayers, rejoice with the Rudras in the three-paced (Soma).

original: ye te śuṣmaṃ ye taviṣīmavardhannarcanta indra marutastaojaḥ
analyzed: ye te śuṣmam ye taviṣīm avardhan arcantaḥ indra marutaḥ taojaḥ
translated: Those who have increased your strength and power, O Indra, the Maruts who have praised your vigor,

original: mādhyandine savane vajrahasta pibā rudrebhiḥ sagaṇaḥ suśipra🔽ta in nvasya madhumad vivipra indrasya śardho maruto ya āsan
analyzed: mādhyandine savane vajrahasta pibā rudrebhiḥ sa gaṇaḥ su śipra 🔽te id nu asya madhumat vivipre indrasya śardhaḥ marutaḥ ye āsan
translated: O wielder of the thunderbolt, at the midday libation, drink with the Rudras, O you with beautiful hair, together with your retinue.

original: yebhirvṛtrasyeṣito vivedāmarmaṇo manyamānasya marma
analyzed: yebhiḥ vṛtrasya iṣitaḥ viveda amarmaṇaḥ manyamānasya marma
translated: By which thou hast pierced the heart of the conceited Vṛtra, O thou who art to be invoked,

original: manuṣvadindra savanaṃ juṣāṇaḥ pibā somaṃ śaśvate vīryāya
analyzed: manuṣvat indra savanam juṣāṇaḥ piba somam śaśvate vīryāya
translated: Enjoy the Soma, O Indra, as a man, delighting in the libation, for ever-during strength.

original: sa ā vavṛtsva haryaśva yajñaiḥ saraṇyubhirapo arṇā sisarṣi
analyzed: saḥ ā vavṛtsva hari aśva yajñaiḥ saraṇyubhiḥ apaḥ arṇā sisarṣi
translated: Turn hither, O thou with the tawny steeds, with sacrifices, with the swift ones, thou movest the waters and the floods.

original: tvamapo yad dha vṛtraṃ jaghanvānatyāniva prāsṛjaḥ sartavājau
analyzed: tvam apaḥ yat ha vṛtram jaghanva an atyān iva prāsṛjaḥ sartava ājau
translated: When thou, O Indra, having slain Vṛtra, didst let loose the two swift ones, as if they were carried,

original: śayānamindra carata vadhena vavrivāṃsaṃ pari devīradevam
analyzed: śayānam indra carata vadhena vavrivāṃsam pari devīradevam
translated: The godless one, O Indra, who lies around, as if covered, with death, the goddesses have surrounded.

original: yajāma in namasā vṛddhamindraṃ bṛhantam ṛṣvamajaraṃ yuvānam
analyzed: yajāmaḥ id namasā vṛddham indram bṛhantam ṛṣvam ajaram yuvānam
translated: We worship with reverence the increased Indra, the lofty, the tall, the undecaying, the young,

original: yasya priye mamaturyajñiyasya na rodasī mahimānaṃ mamāte
analyzed: yasya priye mamatuḥ yajñiyasya na rodasī mahimānam mamāte
translated: Whose dear, sacrificial abode the two mighty worlds do not contain the greatness of.

original: indrasya karma sukṛtā purūṇi vratāni devā na minanti viśve
analyzed: indrasya karma su kṛtā purūṇi vratāni devāḥ na minanti viśve
translated: The gods do not violate the many well-performed deeds and vows of Indra.

original: dādhāra yaḥ pṛthivīṃ dyāmutemāṃ jajāna sūryamuṣasaṃ sudaṃsāḥ
analyzed: dādhāra yaḥ pṛthivīm dyām uta imām jajāna sūryam uṣasam su daṃsāḥ
translated: He who supports the earth and this heaven, who begot the sun and the dawn, the wise one.

original: adrogha satyaṃ tava tan mahitvaṃ sadyo yajjāto apibo ha somam
analyzed: adrogha satyam tava tat mahitvam sadyas yat jātaḥ apibaḥ ha somam
translated: Thy greatness, O Indra, is true and not false, that as soon as thou wast born thou didst drink the Soma.

original: na dyāva indra tavasasta ojo nāhā na māsāḥ śarado varanta
analyzed: na dyāvaḥ indra tavasaḥ te ojaḥ na ahā na māsāḥ śaradaḥ varanta
translated: Neither the heavens nor the mighty ones, O Indra, nor the months nor the autumns resist thy strength.

original: tvaṃ sadyo apibo jāta indra madāya somaṃ parame vyoman
analyzed: tvam sadyas apibaḥ jātaḥ indra madāya somam parame vyoman
translated: Thou, O Indra, as soon as thou wast born, didst drink the Soma for intoxication in the highest heaven.

original: yad dha dyāvāpṛthivī āviveṣīrathābhavaḥ pūrvyaḥ kārudhāyāḥ
analyzed: yat ha dyāvāpṛthivī āviveṣīḥ atha abhavaḥ pūrvyaḥ kāru dhāyāḥ
translated: When thou didst enter heaven and earth, then thou wast the first to be worshipped by the singer.

original: ahannahiṃ pariśayānamarṇa ojāyamānaṃ tuvijāta tavyān
analyzed: ahan ahim pariśayānam arṇaḥ ojāyamānam tuvi jāta tavyān
translated: Thou slewest Ahi, the coiled one, the dragon, O thou of mighty birth, the most manly.

original: na te mahitvamanu bhūdadha dyauryadanyayā sphigyā kṣāmavasthāḥ
analyzed: na te mahitvam anu bhūt adha dyauḥ yat anyayā sphigyā kṣām avasthāḥ
translated: The heaven hath not attained to thy greatness, when thou hast set the earth apart with thy other hip.

original: yajño hi ta indra vardhano bhūduta priyaḥ sutasomo miyedhaḥ
analyzed: yajñaḥ hi te indra vardhanaḥ bhūt uta priyaḥ suta somaḥ miyedhaḥ
translated: For thee, O Indra, the sacrifice hath been a strengthener, dear, with pressed Soma, a holy rite.

original: yajñena yajñamava yajñiyaḥ san yajñaste vajramahihatya āvat
analyzed: yajñena yajñam ava yajñiyaḥ san yajñaḥ te vajram ahi hatye āvat
translated: With the sacrifice, being worthy of the sacrifice, the sacrifice hath helped thee to slay the dragon.

original: yajñenendramavasā cakre arvāgainaṃ sumnāya navyase vavṛtyām
analyzed: yajñena indram avasā cakre arvāk ā enam sumnāya navyase vavṛtyām
translated: With the sacrifice he made Indra to come hitherward, that he might turn to him for new favour.

original: ya stomebhirvāvṛdhe pūrvyebhiryo madhyamebhiruta nūtanebhiḥ
analyzed: ya stomebhiḥ vāvṛdhe pūrvyebhiḥ yaḥ madhyamebhiḥ uta nūtanebhiḥ
translated: He who hath waxed strong with ancient praises, with those of middle time, and with the newest,

original: viveṣa yan mā dhiṣaṇā jajāna stavai purā pāryādindramahnaḥ
analyzed: viveṣa yat mā dhiṣaṇā jajāna stavai purā pāryāt indra mahnaḥ
translated: Whom the thought which he begat hath entered, I will praise Indra before the break of day.

original: aṃhaso yatra pīparad yathā no nāveva yāntamubhaye havante
analyzed: aṃhasaḥ yatra pīparat yathā naḥ nāvā iva yāntam ubhaye havante
translated: Where he may carry us over tribulation, as in a boat, all call on him who cometh.

original: āpūrṇo asya kalaśaḥ svāhā sekteva kośaṃ sisice pibadhyai
analyzed: āpūrṇaḥ asya kalaśaḥ svāhā sektā iva kośam sisice pibadhyai
translated: His jar is full, hail! He drops like a sprinkler, to make him flow for drinking.

original: samu priyā āvavṛtran madāya pradakṣiṇidabhi somāsaindram
analyzed: samu priyāḥ āvavṛtran madāya pradakṣiṇit abhi somāsa aindram
translated: The dear ones have turned hither for his delight, the Soma-streams have flowed around for Indra.

original: na tvā gabhīraḥ puruhūta sindhurnādrayaḥ pari ṣanto varanta
analyzed: na tvā gabhīraḥ puruhūta sindhuḥ na adrayaḥ pari santaḥ varanta
translated: The deep river, O much-invoked one, nor the surrounding mountains can hold thee back

original: itthā sakhibhya iṣito yadindrā dṛḷhaṃ cidarujo gavyamūrvam
analyzed: itthā sakhibhyaḥ iṣitaḥ yat indra ā dṛḍham cit arujaḥ gavyam ūrvam
translated: Thus urged on by thy friends, O Indra, thou hast cleft even the firm stall of kine for Gavyuti

original: śunaṃ huvema / / /
analyzed: śunam huvema
translated: We will invoke him for good fortune

original: pra parvatānāmuśatī upasthādaśve iva viṣite hāsamāne
analyzed: pra parvatānām uśatī upasthāt aśve iva viṣite hāsamāne
translated: She has approached the summits of the mountains, like two horses let loose, eager to play

original: gāveva śubhre mātarā rihāṇe vipāṭ chutudrī payasājavete
analyzed: gāvā iva śubhre mātarā rihāṇe vipāś śutudrī payasā ājavete
translated: Like two bright cows, lowing, the two streams, Vipā and Śutudrī, swift with milk

original: indreṣite prasavaṃ bhikṣamāṇe achā samudraṃ rathyeva yāthaḥ
analyzed: indra iṣite prasavam bhikṣamāṇe achā samudram rathyā iva yāthaḥ
translated: Urged on by Indra, seeking increase, you go to the ocean as if on a chariot

original: samārāṇe ūrmibhiḥ pinvamāne anyā vāmanyāmapyeti śubhre
analyzed: samārāṇe ūrmibhiḥ pinvamāne anyā vām anyām apyeti śubhre
translated: Meeting, swelling with waves, one of you comes to the other, O bright one

original: achā sindhuṃ mātṛtamāmayāsaṃ vipāśamurvīṃ subhagāmaganma
analyzed: achā sindhum mātṛtamām ayāsam vipāśam urvīm subhagām aganma
translated: We have come to the river, most motherly, most youthful, most spacious, most fortunate, free from snares

original: vatsamiva mātarā saṃrihāṇe samānaṃ yonimanu saṃcarantī
analyzed: vatsam iva mātarā saṃrihāṇe samānam yonim anu saṃcarantī
translated: Lowing like a cow to her calf, following the same birthplace, flowing together

original: ena vayaṃ payasā pinvamānā anu yoniṃ devakṛtaṃ carantīḥ
analyzed: enā vayam payasā pinvamānāḥ anu yonim deva kṛtam carantīḥ
translated: We, swelling with milk, are following the birthplace created by the gods

original: na vartave prasavaḥ sargataktaḥ kiṃyurvipro nadyo johavīti
analyzed: na vartave prasavaḥ sarga taktaḥ kiṃyuḥ vipraḥ nadyaḥ johavīti
translated: The birth-giving, swift-moving stream cannot be turned back. What does the active sage, the singer of songs, invoke?

original: ramadhvaṃ me vacase somyāya ṛtāvarīrupa muhūrtamevaiḥ
analyzed: ramadhvam me vacase somyāya ṛtāvarīḥ upa muhūrtam evaiḥ
translated: Delight yourselves in my speech fit for the Soma sacrifice, O you who are rich in truth, for just a moment with the swift ones

original: pra sindhumachā bṛhatī manīṣāvasyurahve kuśikasya sūnuḥ
analyzed: pra sindhum achā bṛhatī manīṣā vasyuḥ ahve kuśikasya sūnuḥ
translated: The great thought has approached the river. The eager one, the son of Kuśika, has called out

original: indro asmānaradad vajrabāhurapāhan vṛtraṃ paridhiṃ nadīnām
analyzed: indraḥ asmān aradat vajra bāhuḥ apāhan vṛtram paridhim nadīnām
translated: Indra, whose arm wields the thunderbolt, has helped us: he has slain Vr̥itra, the dam of the rivers.

original: devo 'nayat savita supāṇistasya vayaṃ prasave yāma urvīḥ
analyzed: devaḥ nayat savita su pāṇiḥ tasya vayam prasave yāmaḥ urvīḥ
translated: The God Savitar, the skilful, has led us: by his impulsion we have gained wide freedom.

original: pravācyaṃ śaśvadhā vīryaṃ tadindrasya karma yadahiṃvivṛścat
analyzed: pravācyam śaśvadhā vīryam tat indrasya karma yat ahim vivṛścat
translated: This is the ever-varying hero exploit, the deed of Indra, that he rent Ahi asunder.

original: vi vajreṇa pariṣado jaghānāyannāpo 'yanamichamānāḥ
analyzed: vi vajreṇa pariṣadaḥ jaghāna āyan āpaḥ yanam icchamānāḥ
translated: With his thunderbolt he cleft the gathering clouds: the waters flowed, seeking the path they long for.

original: etad vaco jaritarmāpi mṛṣṭhā ā yat te ghoṣānuttarā yugāni
analyzed: etat vacaḥ jaritar mā api mṛṣṭhāḥ ā yat te ghoṣa anuttarā yugāni
translated: This word, O singer, must be spoken, since thy highest glories are in the future.

original: uktheṣu kāro prati no juṣasva mā no ni kaḥ puruṣatrā namaste
analyzed: uktheṣu kāro prati naḥ juṣasva mā naḥ ni kaḥ puruṣatrā namaḥ te
translated: Be pleased with our lauds, O thou who art to be praised: harm us not, O thou who lovest men: homage to thee.

original: o ṣu svasāraḥ kārave śṛṇota yayau vo dūrādanasā rathena
analyzed: ā u su svasāraḥ kārave śṛṇota yayau vaḥ dūrāt anasā rathena
translated: O ye sisters, listen to Kārava: he has come to you from afar with his chariot and team.

original: ni ṣū namadhvaṃ bhavatā supārā adhoakṣāḥ sindhavaḥsrotyābhiḥ
analyzed: ni su namadhvam bhavata su pārāḥ adhoakṣāḥ sindhavaḥ srotyābhiḥ
translated: Bend down, be easy to be passed, O ye streams, with your currents flowing downward.

original: ā te kāro śṛṇavāmā vacāṃsi yayātha dūrādanasā rathena
analyzed: ā te kāro śṛṇavāmā vacāṃsi yayātha dūrāt anasā rathena
translated: We will listen to thy words, O Kārava, since thou hast come from afar with thy chariot and team.

original: ni te naṃsai pīpyāneva yoṣā maryāyeva kanyā śaśvacai te🔽yadaṅga tvā bharatāḥ santareyurgavyan grāma iṣita indrajūtaḥ
analyzed: ni te naṃsai pīpyānā iva yoṣā maryāyā iva kanyā śaśvacai te  yat aṅga tvā bharatāḥ santareyuḥ gavyan grāmaḥ iṣitaḥ indra jūtaḥ
translated: Let thy mind be bent on us, as a woman on her husband, as a maiden on her lover.🔽If the Bharatas should carry thee away, urged on, O Indra, like a village with its cattle,

original: arṣādaha prasavaḥ sargatakta ā vo vṛṇe sumatiṃ yajñiyānām
analyzed: arṣa adaha prasavaḥ sarga taktaḥ ā vaḥ vṛṇe sumatim yajñiyānām
translated: Flow on, impelled by impulse, to the birth: I choose the favour of you who are to be worshipped.

original: atāriṣurbharatā gavyavaḥ samabhakta vipraḥ sumatiṃ nadīnām
analyzed: atāriṣuḥ bharatāḥ gavyavaḥ samabhakta vipraḥ sumatim nadīnām
translated: The Bharatas have crossed over the obstacles, the sage has obtained the favour of the rivers

original: pra pinvadhvamiṣayantīḥ surādhā ā vakṣaṇāḥ pṛṇadhvaṃ yāta śībham
analyzed: pra pinvadhvam iṣayantīḥ su rādhāḥ ā vakṣaṇāḥ pṛṇadhvam yāta śībham
translated: You who increase food and bestow good gifts, you who are rich in nourishment, fill up the womb, go quickly

original: ud va ūrmiḥ śamyā hantvāpo yoktrāṇi muñcata
analyzed: ud vaḥ ūrmiḥ śamyāḥ hantvā apaḥ yoktrāṇi muñcata
translated: Let the wave of the Samya carry you up, O waters, loosen the bonds

original: māduṣkṛtau vyenasāghnyau śūnamāratām
analyzed: mā a duṣkṛtau vyenasā aghnyau śūnam āratām
translated: Let not the two unoffending ones be slain by the guilty one

original: indraḥ pūrbhidātirad dāsamarkairvidadvasurdayamāno viśatrūn
analyzed: indraḥ pūrbhidā atirat dāsam arkaiḥ vidadvasuḥ dayamānaḥ viśatrūn
translated: Indra with the forts has overcome the Dāsa with the Arkas, the one who gives wealth, shining upon his enemies

original: brahmajūtastanvā vāvṛdhāno bhūridātra āpṛṇad rodasī ubhe
analyzed: brahma jūtaḥ tanvā vāvṛdhānaḥ bhūri dātraḥ āpṛṇat rodasī ubhe
translated: Urged on by prayer, grown great in his own body, the bountiful one has filled both heaven and earth

original: makhasya te taviṣasya pra jūtimiyarmi vācamamṛtāya bhūṣan
analyzed: makhasya te taviṣasya pra jūtim iyarmi vācam amṛtāya bhūṣan
translated: I send forth the impulse of thy sacrifice, adorning the word for the immortal one

original: indra kṣitīnāmasi mānuṣīṇāṃ viśāṃ daivīnāmuta pūrvayāvā
analyzed: indra kṣitīnām asi mānuṣīṇām viśām daivīnām uta pūrva yāvā
translated: O Indra, thou art the lord of the human abodes and of the divine clans and of the ancient ones

original: indro vṛtramavṛṇocchardhanītiḥ pra māyināmaminād varpaṇītiḥ
analyzed: indraḥ vṛtram avṛṇot śardha nītiḥ pra māyinām amināt varpaṇītiḥ
translated: Indra, with overpowering might, hath overcome Vṛtra, hath overcome the deceitful ones with overpowering might

original: ahan vyaṃsamuśadhag vaneṣvāvirdhenā akṛṇod rāmyāṇām🔽indraḥ svarṣā janayannahāni jigāyośigbhiḥ pṛtanā abhiṣṭiḥ
analyzed: ahan vyaṃsam uśadhak vaneṣu āvirdhenāḥ akṛṇot rāmyāṇām  indraḥ svarṣāḥ janayan ahāni jigāya uśigbhiḥ pṛtanāḥ abhiṣṭiḥ
translated: He hath slain the wicked one, the scorcher in the woods, he hath made the dwellings of the Rāṃs visible🔽Indra, the self-resplendent one, producing the days, hath conquered with the strong ones, the protector, in the battles

original: prārocayan manave ketumahnāmavindajjyotirbṛhateraṇāya
analyzed: prārocayat manave ketum ahnām avindat jyotiḥ bṛhatā īraṇāya
translated: He hath made the light of the great sacrifice shine forth, the banner of the name of Manu, finding the light

original: indrastujo barhaṇā ā viveśa nṛvad dadhāno naryā purūṇi
analyzed: indra stujaḥ barhaṇāḥ ā viveśa nṛvat dadhānaḥ naryā purūṇi
translated: Indra hath entered with his might and glory, bearing as man bears many manly exploits

original: acetayad dhiya imā jaritre premaṃ varṇamatiracchukramāsām
analyzed: acetayat dhiyaḥ imāḥ jaritre pra imam varṇam atirat śukra māsām
translated: He hath inspired these thoughts in him who lauds him, and hath surpassed the bright ones in his splendour

original: maho mahāni panayantyasyendrasya karma sukṛtā purūṇi🔽vṛjanena vṛjinān saṃ pipeṣa māyābhirdasyūnrabhibhūtyojāḥ
analyzed: mahaḥ mahāni panayanti asya indrasya karma su kṛtā purūṇi  vṛjanena vṛjinān sam pipeṣa māyābhiḥ dasyūn rabhibhūti ojāḥ
translated: They celebrate with lauds the mighty deeds of Indra, the well-performed, the very mighty🔽With his own power he crushed the Vr̥itras, with his magic power the Dasyus, he whose strength is overwhelming

original: yudhendro mahnā varivaścakāra devebhyaḥ satpatiścarṣaṇiprāḥ
analyzed: yudhā indraḥ mahnā varivaḥ cakāra devebhyaḥ satpatiḥ carṣaṇi prāḥ
translated: In the conflict Indra, Lord of the brave, the chief of men, hath made a wide place for the people

original: vivasvataḥ sadane asya tāni viprā ukthebhiḥ kavayogṛṇanti
analyzed: vivasvataḥ sadane asya tāni viprāḥ ukthebhiḥ kavayaḥ gṛṇanti
translated: In the abode of Vivasvan the sages with their hymns and sacred songs sing forth his glories

original: satrāsāhaṃ vareṇyaṃ sahodāṃ sasavāṃsaṃ svarapaśca devīḥ
analyzed: satrāsāham vareṇyam sahaḥ dām sasavāṃsam svarapaḥ ca devīḥ
translated: The Goddesses have sung Indra, the invincible, the excellent, the mighty, the bountiful, the liberal

original: sasāna yaḥ pṛthivīṃ dyāmutemāmindraṃ madantyanu dhīraṇāsaḥ
analyzed: sasāna yaḥ pṛthivīm dyām uta imām indram madanti anu dhīraṇāsaḥ
translated: Him who hath conquered this earth and this heaven, the people rejoice in Indra with their thoughts

original: sasānātyānuta sūryaṃ sasānendraḥ sasāna purubhojasaṃ gām
analyzed: sasāna atyānuta sūryam sasāna indraḥ sasāna purubhojasam gām
translated: He hath conquered the conquering, he hath conquered the sun, he hath conquered the cow who yields abundant milk

original: hiraṇyayamuta bhogaṃ sasāna hatvī dasyūn prāryaṃvarṇamāvat
analyzed: hiraṇyayam uta bhogam sasāna hatvī dasyūn pra aryaṃvarṇam āvat
translated: He hath conquered the golden treasure, the slayer of the Dasyus, the protector of the Aryan race

original: indra oṣadhīrasanodahāni vanaspatīnrasanodantarikṣam
analyzed: indraḥ oṣadhīḥ rasanā udahāni vanaspatīn rasanā udantarikṣam
translated: Indra hath conquered the plants, the waters, the trees, he hath conquered the atmosphere

original: bibheda valaṃ nunude vivāco 'thābhavad damitadbhikratūnām
analyzed: bibheda valam nunude vivācaḥ thā bhavat damita dbhi kratūnām
translated: He hath cleft Vala, he hath driven away the enemies, and now he is the tamer of the fierce

original: śunaṃ huvema / / /
analyzed: śunam huvema
translated: We invoke the auspicious...

original: tiṣṭhā harī ratha ā yujyamānā yāhi vāyurna niyuto no acha
analyzed: tiṣṭha harī rathe ā yujyamānā yāhi vāyuḥ na niyutaḥ naḥ acha
translated: Stand, O tawny ones, yoked to the chariot, come, like Vayu, to our teams, to us

original: pibāsyandho abhisṛṣṭo asme indra svāhā rarimāte madāya
analyzed: pibāsi andhaḥ abhisṛṣṭaḥ asme indra svāhā rarimāte madāya
translated: Drink this pressed juice offered to us, O Indra, we offer it to you for delight

original: upājirā puruhūtāya saptī harī rathasya dhūrṣvā yunajmi
analyzed: upa ajirā puruhūtāya saptī harī rathasya dhūrṣvā yunajmi
translated: I yoke to the reins of the chariot the two tawny horses for the much-invoked one who is near

original: dravad yathā sambhṛtaṃ viśvataścidupemaṃ yajñamāvahāta indram
analyzed: dravat yathā sambhṛtam viśvatas cit upa imam yajñam āvahātaḥ indram
translated: As if running, bring from all around to this sacrifice Indra

original: upo nayasva vṛṣaṇā tapuṣpotemava tvaṃ vṛṣabha svadhāvaḥ
analyzed: upa u nayasva vṛṣaṇā tapuṣpā uta imava tvam vṛṣabha svadhāvas
translated: Bring the two mighty ones, the glowing ones, you yourself, O bull, who are self-moving

original: grasetāmaśvā vi muceha śoṇā divedive sadṛśīraddhidhānāḥ
analyzed: grasetām aśvā vi muca iha śoṇā dive dive sadṛśīḥ addhi dhānāḥ
translated: Let the horses swallow, let the red ones be released here. Every day give us similar gifts

original: brahmaṇā te brahmayujā yunajmi harī sakhāyā sadhamāda āśū /x
analyzed: brahmaṇā te brahma yujā yunajmi harī sakhāyā sadhamāde āśū
translated: With prayer I yoke for you the two prayer-yoked tawny horses, the swift friends who rejoice together

original: sthiraṃ rathaṃ sukhamindrādhitiṣṭhan prajānan vidvānupa yāhi somam
analyzed: sthiram ratham sukham indra adhitiṣṭhan prajānan vidvān upa yāhi somam
translated: Sitting in the firm chariot, O Indra, knowing, wise, come to the Soma

original: mā te harī vṛṣaṇā vītapṛṣṭhā ni rīraman yajamānāso anye
analyzed: mā te harī vṛṣaṇā vīta pṛṣṭhā ni rīraman yajamānāsaḥ anye
translated: Let not other sacrificers, O mighty one, let not other tawny horses with wide backs hinder you

original: atyāyāhi śaśvato vayaṃ te 'raṃ sutebhiḥ kṛṇavāmasomaiḥ
analyzed: ati āyāhi śaśvataḥ vayam te raṃ sutebhiḥ kṛṇavāma somaiḥ
translated: Come to us, O mighty one, we will make you glad with these pressed juices every day

original: tavāyaṃ somastvamehyarvāṃ chaśvattamaṃ sumanā asyapāhi
analyzed: tava ayam somaḥ tvam ehi arvām śaśvattamam sumanāḥ asi apāhi
translated: This Soma is yours, come hither, O Indra, be most gracious to this sacrificer

original: asmin yajñe barhiṣyā niṣadyā dadhiṣvemaṃ jaṭhara indumindra
analyzed: asmin yajñe barhiṣyā niṣadyā dadhiṣva imam jaṭhare indum indra
translated: In this sacrifice, O Indra, seated on the sacrificial grass, enjoy this Soma in thy belly.

original: stīrṇaṃ te barhiḥ suta indra somaḥ kṛtā dhānā attave teharibhyām
analyzed: stīrṇam te barhiḥ sutaḥ indra somaḥ kṛtāḥ dhānāḥ attave te haribhyām
translated: The grass is strewn for thee, O Indra, the Soma is pressed. The grains are prepared for thee to eat with thy two bay steeds.

original: tadokase puruśākāya vṛṣṇe marutvate tubhyaṃrātā havīṃṣi
analyzed: tad okase puru śākāya vṛṣṇe marutvate tubhyaṃrātā havīṃṣi
translated: To that abode of thine, O thou of much strength, O mighty one, accompanied by the Maruts, are offered the oblations.

original: imaṃ naraḥ parvatāstubhyamāpaḥ samindra gobhirmadhumantamakran
analyzed: imam naraḥ parvatāḥ tubhyam āpaḥ sam indra gobhiḥ madhumantam akran
translated: These men, O Indra, these mountains, these waters, have made this (oblation) rich in milk and honey for thee.

original: tasyāgatyā sumanā ṛṣva pāhi prajānan vidvān pathyā anu svāḥ
analyzed: tasya āgatya sumanāḥ ṛṣva pāhi prajānan vidvān pathyāḥ anu svāḥ
translated: Come to that (oblation) with a good mind, O lofty one, protect it, knowing it, O wise one, along the paths that are thine own.

original: yānābhajo maruta indra some ye tvāmavardhannabhavan gaṇaste
analyzed: yān ābhajaḥ marutaḥ indra some ye tvām avardhan abhavan gaṇaḥ te
translated: O Indra, those Maruts who have not shared in this Soma, who have become thy troop, have strengthened thee.

original: tebhiretaṃ sajoṣā vāvaśāno 'gneḥ piba jihvayāsomamindra🔽indra piba svadhayā cit sutasyāgnervā pāhi jihvayā yajatra
analyzed: tebhiḥ etam sajoṣāḥ vāvaśānaḥ gneḥ piba jihvayā somam indra  indra piba svadhayā cit sutasya agneḥ vā pāhi jihvayā yajatra
translated: With them, O Indra, being of one mind, eager, drink the Soma with the tongue of Agni.🔽O Indra, drink even by thy own nature of the pressed (Soma); or protect it by the tongue of Agni, O thou who art to be worshipped.

original: adhvaryorvā prayataṃ śakra hastād dhoturvā yajñaṃ haviṣo juṣasva
analyzed: adhvaryoḥ vā prayatam śakra hastāt hotuḥ vā yajñam haviṣaḥ juṣasva
translated: Or accept, O Sakra, the sacrifice offered by the Adhvaryu's hands, or by the Hotri's, and the oblation.

original: śunaṃ huvema / / /
analyzed: śunam huvema
translated: We will invoke him who is good to invoke...

original: imāmū ṣu prabhṛtiṃ sātaye dhāḥ śaśvacḥ chaśvadūtibhiryādamānaḥ
analyzed: imā amū su prabhṛtim sātaye dhāḥ śaśvat śaśvat ūtibhiḥ yādamānaḥ
translated: Grant this our prayer for prosperity, O thou who art ever to be invoked, who art ever to be worshipped with the messages (of the priests).

original: sutesute vāvṛdhe vardhanebhiryaḥ karmabhirmahadbhiḥ suśruto bhūt
analyzed: sute sute vāvṛdhe vardhanebhiḥ yaḥ karmabhiḥ mahadbhiḥ su śrutaḥ bhūt
translated: He who is well known for his great deeds, has grown by the successful performances, at every pressing, of the strengthening (sacrifices).

original: indrāya somāḥ pradivo vidānā ṛbhuryebhirvṛṣaparvā vihāyāḥ
analyzed: indrāya somāḥ pradivaḥ vidānāḥ ṛbhuḥ yebhiḥ vṛṣa parvā vihāyāḥ
translated: The Soma juices, O Indra, from the sky, R̥ibhu with those, Vṛṣaparvan, have sent forth

original: prayamyamānān prati ṣū gṛbhāyendra piba vṛṣadhūtasya vṛṣṇaḥ
analyzed: prayamyamānān prati su gṛbhāya indra piba vṛṣa dhūtasya vṛṣṇaḥ
translated: Seize them as they are being pressed, O Indra, drink of the strong drink which the strong have drawn

original: pibā vardhasva tava ghā sutāsa indra somāsaḥ prathamā uteme
analyzed: pibā vardhasva tava gha sutāsaḥ indra somāsaḥ prathamāḥ uta ime
translated: Drink, be exalted: thine are these, O Indra, the first and these new-pressed Soma juices

original: yathāpibaḥ pūrvyānindra somānevā pāhi panyo adyā navīyān
analyzed: yathā apibaḥ pūrvyān indra somān evā pāhi panyaḥ adyā navīyān
translated: As thou hast drunk the ancient ones, O Indra, so drink thou now the new-pressed Soma juices

original: mahānamatro vṛjane virapśyugraṃ śavaḥ patyate dhṛṣṇvojaḥ
analyzed: mahān amatraḥ vṛjane virapśī ugram śavaḥ patyate dhṛṣṇu ojaḥ
translated: The mighty one, the wondrous one in the conflict, the strong one's strong power is ruling as a hero

original: nāha vivyāca pṛthivī canainaṃ yat somāso haryaśvamamandan
analyzed: na aha vivyāca pṛthivī cana enam yat somāsaḥ haryaśvam amandan
translated: The earth itself hath not contained his greatness when the Soma juices have delighted Haryaśva

original: mahānugro vāvṛdhe vīryāya samācakre vṛṣabhaḥ kāvyena
analyzed: mahān ugraḥ vāvṛdhe vīryāya samācakre vṛṣabhaḥ kāvyena
translated: The mighty one hath grown for hero strength: the Bull hath been adorned with holy verse

original: indro bhago vājadā asya gāvaḥ pra jāyante dakṣiṇā asya pūrvīḥ
analyzed: indraḥ bhagaḥ vāja dāḥ asya gāvaḥ pra jāyante dakṣiṇāḥ asya pūrvīḥ
translated: Indra is rich in spoil, in kine, in horses: his are the plentiful gifts of the pious

original: pra yat sindhavaḥ prasavaṃ yathāyannāpaḥ samudraṃ rathyeva jagmuḥ
analyzed: pra yat sindhavaḥ prasavam yathā āyan āpaḥ samudram rathyā iva jagmuḥ
translated: When the streams move to their appointed places, the waters go to the sea as 'twere on wheels
