original: ataścidindraḥ sadaso varīyān yadīṃ somaḥ pṛṇati dugdho aṃśuḥ
analyzed: atas cit indraḥ sadasaḥ varīyān yadi īm somaḥ pṛṇati dugdhaḥ aṃśuḥ
translated: From thence, from the most spacious seat, Indra, when the milk-distilling Soma fills him full

original: samudreṇa sindhavo yādamānā indrāya somaṃ suṣutaṃ bharantaḥ
analyzed: samudreṇa sindhavaḥ yādamānāḥ indrāya somam suṣutam bharantaḥ
translated: The rivers, striving to the ocean, bringing Indra the well-pressed Soma,

original: aṃśuṃ duhanti hastino bharitrairmadhvaḥ punanti dhārayā pavitraiḥ
analyzed: aṃśum duhanti hastinaḥ bharitraiḥ madhvaḥ punanti dhārayā pavitraiḥ
translated: The milkmen milk the stalk with their milking vessels; they purify the sweet drink with the stream and the purifying strain

original: hradā iva kukṣayaḥ somadhānāḥ samī vivyāca savanā purūṇi
analyzed: hradāḥ iva kukṣayaḥ soma dhānāḥ samī vivyāca savanā purūṇi
translated: Like lakes are the wombs of him who bears the Soma; he hath disclosed to us the many libations

original: annā yadindraḥ prathamā vyāśa vṛtraṃ jaghanvānavṛṇīta somam
analyzed: annā yat indraḥ prathamā vyāśa vṛtram jaghanvān avṛṇīta somam
translated: If, O Indra, thou hast first drunk the food, thou hast chosen Soma after thou hadst slain Vrtra

original: ā tū bhara mākiretat pari ṣṭhād vidmā hi tvā vasupatiṃ vasūnām
analyzed: ā tū bhara mākir etat pari sthāt vidma hi tvā vasu patim vasūnām
translated: Bring it hither, let it not pass away from us; for we know thee as the lord of treasures, O lord of treasures

original: indra yat te māhinaṃ datramastyasmabhyaṃ tad dharyaśva pra yandhi
analyzed: indra yat te māhinam datram asti asmabhyam tat haryaśva pra yandhi
translated: O Indra, whatever great gift thou hast, O thou of Bay steeds, bring it hither to us

original: asme pra yandhi maghavannṛjīṣinnindra rāyo viśvavārasya bhūreḥ
analyzed: asme pra yandhi maghavan ṛjīṣin indra rāyaḥ viśva vārasya bhūreḥ
translated: Bring it hither to us, O bountiful one, O strong one; O Indra, to the enjoyment of abundant wealth

original: asme śataṃ śarado jīvase dhā asme vīrān chaśvata indra śiprin
analyzed: asme śatam śaradaḥ jīvase dhāḥ asme vīrān śaśvataḥ indra śiprin
translated: Grant us a hundred winters for our life; grant us, O Indra, heroes evermore, O thou of fair cheeks

original: śunaṃ huvema / / /
analyzed: śunam huvema
translated: We will invoke him who is good to deliver us

original: vārtrahatyāya śavase pṛtanāṣāhyāya ca
analyzed: vārtrahatyāya śavase pṛtanāṣāhyāya ca
translated: For the slaying of Vritra, for strength, and for conquering in battles

original: indra tvā vartayāmasi
analyzed: indra tvā vartayāmasi
translated: O Indra, we direct thee

original: arvācīnaṃ su te mana uta cakṣuḥ śatakrato
analyzed: arvācīnam su te manaḥ uta cakṣuḥ śatakrato
translated: Thy mind and eye, O thou of a hundred powers, we direct hitherward

original: indra kṛṇvantu vāghataḥ
analyzed: indra kṛṇvantu vāghataḥ
translated: O Indra, let the priests

original: nāmāni te śatakrato viśvābhirgīrbhirīmahe
analyzed: nāmāni te śatakrato viśvābhiḥ gīrbhiḥ īmahe
translated: We honour with all our hymns thy names, O thou of a hundred powers,

original: indrābhimātiṣāhye
analyzed: indra abhimātiṣāhye
translated: O Indra, for overcoming our enemies

original: puruṣṭutasya dhāmabhiḥ śatena mahayāmasi
analyzed: puruṣṭutasya dhāmabhiḥ śatena mahayāmasi
translated: With the powers of thee who art much praised, with a hundred (praises) we exalt thee

original: indrasya carṣaṇīdhṛtaḥ
analyzed: indrasya carṣaṇī dhṛtaḥ
translated: Of Indra, the supporter of the people

original: indraṃ vṛtrāya hantave puruhūtamupa bruve
analyzed: indram vṛtrāya hantave puruhūtam upa bruve
translated: I address Indra, invoked by many, to slay Vrtra

original: bhareṣu vājasātaye
analyzed: bhareṣu vājasātaye
translated: In battles, to win strength

original: vājeṣu sāsahirbhava tvāmīmahe śatakrato
analyzed: vājeṣu sāsahiḥ bhava tvā amīmahe śatakrato
translated: Be invincible in battles, we invoke you, O Shatakratu

original: indra vṛtrāyahantave
analyzed: indra vṛtrāya hantave
translated: O Indra, to slay Vrtra

original: dyumneṣu pṛtanājye pṛtsutūrṣu śravassu ca
analyzed: dyumneṣu pṛtanājye pṛtsutūrṣu śravassu ca
translated: In glories, in battles, in contests, and in fame

original: indra sākṣvābhimātiṣu
analyzed: indra sākṣva abhimātiṣu
translated: O Indra, in battles

original: śuṣmintamaṃ na ūtaye dyumninaṃ pāhi jāgṛvim
analyzed: śuṣmintamam naḥ ūtaye dyumninam pāhi jāgṛvim
translated: Most powerful, protect us for help, the glorious one, the watchful one

original: indra somaṃśatakrato
analyzed: indra somam śatakrato
translated: O Indra, the Soma, O Shatakratu

original: indriyāṇi śatakrato yā te janeṣu pañcasu
analyzed: indriyāṇi śatakrato yā te janeṣu pañcasu
translated: The powers, O Shatakratu, which you have in the five peoples

original: indra tāni taā vṛṇe
analyzed: indra tāni taā vṛṇe
translated: Those, O Indra, I choose

original: agannindra śravo bṛhad dyumnaṃ dadhiṣva duṣṭaram
analyzed: agan indra śravaḥ bṛhat dyumnam dadhiṣva duṣṭaram
translated: O Indra, you have gone to great glory, win terrible fame

original: ut te śuṣmaṃ tirāmasi
analyzed: ud te śuṣmam tirāmasi
translated: We cross over your strength

original: arvāvato na ā gahyatho śakra parāvataḥ
analyzed: arvāvataḥ naḥ ā gahi atho śakra parāvataḥ
translated: Come to us from the near or far, O Shakra

original: u loko yaste adriva indreha tata ā gahi🔽abhi taṣṭeva dīdhayā manīṣāmatyo na vājī sudhuro jihānaḥ
analyzed: u lokaḥ yaḥ te adrivas indra iha tatas ā gahi  abhi taṣṭā iva dīdhayāḥ manīṣāmatyaḥ na vājī su dhuraḥ jihānaḥ
translated: The world that is yours, O Indra, O wielder of the thunderbolt, come from there🔽Like a smith with his plan, with my thought I reach for the prize, like a strong horse with good reins

original: abhi priyāṇi marmṛśat parāṇi kavīnrichāmi sandṛśe sumedhāḥ
analyzed: abhi priyāṇi marmṛśat parāṇi kavīn richāmi sandṛśe sumedhāḥ
translated: I touch the most excellent, the most distant, I seek the wise sages for the sake of seeing

original: inota pṛcha janimā kavīnāṃ manodhṛtaḥ sukṛtastakṣata dyām
analyzed: inā uta pṛccha janimā kavīnām manodhṛtaḥ su kṛtaḥ takṣata dyām
translated: Now ask about the birth of the sages, supported by the mind, well-made, fashion the sky

original: imā u te praṇyo vardhamānā manovātā adha nu dharmaṇigman🔽ni ṣīmidatra guhyā dadhānā uta kṣatrāya rodasī samañjan
analyzed: imāḥ u te praṇyaḥ vardhamānāḥ manaḥ vātāḥ adha nu dharmaṇigman  ni sīmidatra guhyā dadhānāḥ uta kṣatrāya rodasī samañjan
translated: These thy two swift steeds, O God, increasing in strength, have gone to the place of worship, O thou who art to be invoked.🔽Here, O King, they have settled down, bestowing the secret (power), and have united the two worlds for the sake of the kingdom.

original: saṃ mātrābhirmamire yemur urvī antar mahī samṛte dhāyase dhuḥ
analyzed: sam mātrābhiḥ mamire yemuḥ urvī antar mahī samṛte dhāyase dhuḥ
translated: They have been measured by the measures, they have been made firm, the great ones, for the sake of prosperity and support.

original: ātiṣṭhantaṃ pari viśve abhūṣañchriyo vasānaścarati svarociḥ
analyzed: ātiṣṭhantam pari viśve abhūṣan śriyaḥ vasānaḥ carati sva rociḥ
translated: All have surrounded him who stands near; he moves, clothed in glory, shining of himself.

original: mahat tad vṛṣṇo asurasya nāmā viśvarūpo amṛtāni tasthau
analyzed: mahat tat vṛṣṇaḥ asurasya nāma ā viśva rūpaḥ amṛtāni tasthau
translated: That is the great name of the strong Asura; he stands in the immortal (waters), of universal form.

original: asūta pūrvo vṛṣabho jyāyānimā asya śurudhaḥ santi pūrvīḥ🔽divo napātā vidathasya dhībhiḥ kṣatraṃ rājānā pradivo dadhāthe
analyzed: asūta pūrvaḥ vṛṣabhaḥ jyāyān imāḥ asya śurudhaḥ santi pūrvīḥ  divaḥ napātā vidathasya dhībhiḥ kṣatram rājānā pradivaḥ dadhāthe
translated: The strong one, the first, has produced the greater (waters); these his are the many ancient (waters).🔽O ye two Kings, who rain down from heaven, by the thoughts of the sacrifice ye have established the kingdom, O ye two who rain down from heaven.

original: trīṇi rājānā vidathe purūṇi pari viśvāni bhūṣathaḥ sadāṃsi
analyzed: trīṇi rājānā vidathe purūṇi pari viśvāni bhūṣathaḥ sadāṃsi
translated: O ye two Kings, ye adorn in the sacrifice the many great (objects) of all kinds.

original: apaśyamatra manasā jaganvān vrate gandharvānapi vāyukeśān
analyzed: apaśyam atra manasā jaganvān vrate gandharvān api vāyu keśān
translated: I, the wanderer, have seen here with my mind the Gandharvas, with Vayu for their hair, in the vow (of penance).

original: tadin nvasya vṛṣabhasya dhenorā nāmabhirmamire sakmyaṃgoḥ

original: jajñāno harito vṛṣā viśvamā bhāti rocanam
analyzed: jajñānaḥ haritaḥ vṛṣā viśvamā bhāti rocanam
translated: The tawny bull, as soon as born, shineth with all his light.

original: haryaśvo haritaṃ dhatta āyudhamā vajraṃ bāhvorharim
analyzed: hari aśvaḥ haritam dhatte āyudham ā vajram bāhvoḥ harim
translated: Haryaśva gave the tawny one the tawny weapon, the thunderbolt in his arms

original: indro haryantamarjunaṃ vajraṃ śukrairabhīvṛtam🔽apāvṛṇod dharibhiradribhiḥ sutamud gā haribhirājata
analyzed: indraḥ haryantam arjunam vajram śukraiḥ abhīvṛtam  apāvṛṇot haribhiḥ adribhiḥ sutam ud gāḥ haribhiḥ ājata
translated: Indra opened the tawny, tawny-hued thunderbolt, surrounded by the bright ones🔽He opened with the tawny ones, the mountains, the pressed (juice) with the tawny ones, sing the songs

original: ā mandrairindra haribhiryāhi mayūraromabhiḥ
analyzed: ā mandraiḥ indra haribhiḥ yāhi mayūra romabhiḥ
translated: Come, O Indra, with the cheerful tawny ones, with the peacock-feathered ones

original: mā tvā kecin ni yaman viṃ na pāśino 'ti dhanveva tānihi
analyzed: mā tvā kecid ni yaman vim na pāśinaḥ ti dhanvā iva tānihi
translated: Let none restrain thee, as with a rope, go past them as over a desert

original: vṛtrakhādo valaṃrujaḥ purāṃ darmo apāmajaḥ
analyzed: vṛtra khādaḥ valaṃrujaḥ purām darmaḥ apām ajaḥ
translated: The eater of Vṛtra, the punisher of Vala, the breaker of forts, the lord of the waters

original: sthātā rathasya haryorabhisvara indro dṛḷhā cidārujaḥ🔽gambhīrānudadhīnriva kratuṃ puṣyasi gā iva
analyzed: sthātā rathasya haryoḥ abhisvaraḥ indraḥ dṛḷhā cit ārujaḥ  gambhīrān udadhīn riva kratum puṣyasi gāḥ iva
translated: The standing, the rushing of the chariot, the cry of the tawny ones, Indra, the breaker of the firm (forts)🔽Like the deep oceans, thou increasest thy power like (one increases) cows

original: pra sugopāyavasaṃ dhenavo yathā hradaṃ kulyā ivāśata
analyzed: pra su gopā yavasam dhenavaḥ yathā hradam kulyāḥ iva āśata
translated: As the streams hasten to the lake, so hasten to the well-guarded food, as the cows (to the stable)

original: ā nastujaṃ rayiṃ bharāṃśaṃ na pratijānate
analyzed: ā nastujam rayim bhara aṃśam na pratijānate
translated: Bring us wealth that is to be praised, as one brings a portion that is to be accepted

original: vṛkṣaṃ pakvaṃ phalamaṅkīva dhūnuhīndra sampāraṇaṃ vasu
analyzed: vṛkṣam pakvam phalam aṅkī iva dhūnuhi indra sampāraṇam vasu
translated: Shake, O Indra, like a ripe fruit from the tree, the Vasu that is to be crossed over

original: svayurindra svarāḷ asi smaddiṣṭiḥ svayaśastaraḥ
analyzed: svayuḥ indra svarāj asi smaddiṣṭiḥ sva yaśastaraḥ
translated: Thou art the self-moving, O Indra, the self-aiming, the most self-famous

original: sa vāvṛdhāna ojasā puruṣṭuta bhavā naḥ suśravastamaḥ
analyzed: sa vāvṛdhānaḥ ojasā puruṣṭuta bhava naḥ su śravastamaḥ
translated: Thou, having increased in strength, O much-praised one, be to us the most renowned for good fame

original: yudhmasya te vṛṣabhasya svarāja ugrasya yūna sthavirasya ghṛṣveḥ
analyzed: yudhmasya te vṛṣabhasya svarājaḥ ugrasya yūna sthavirasya ghṛṣveḥ
translated: Of thee the warrior, the bull, the self-dependent, the fierce, the young, the strong, the ancient,

original: ajūryato vajriṇo vīryāṇīndra śrutasya mahato mahāni
analyzed: a jūryataḥ vajriṇaḥ vīryāṇi indra śrutasya mahataḥ mahāni
translated: The undecaying deeds of thee the wielder of the thunderbolt, O Indra, the great deeds of the renowned,

original: mahānasi mahiṣa vṛṣṇyebhirdhanaspṛdugra sahamāno anyān
analyzed: mahān asi mahiṣa vṛṣṇyebhiḥ dhana spṛt ugra sahamānaḥ anyān
translated: Thou art great, O bull, with mighty powers, winning wealth, overcoming others,

original: eko viśvasya bhuvanasya rājā sa yodhayā ca kṣayayā ca janān
analyzed: ekaḥ viśvasya bhuvanasya rājā sa yodhayā ca kṣayayā ca janān
translated: Thou art the sole king of the whole world, thou with war and destruction dost afflict the people.

original: pra mātrābhī ririce rocamānaḥ pra devebhirviśvato apratītaḥ
analyzed: pra mātrābhiḥ ririce rocamānaḥ pra devebhiḥ viśvatas apratītaḥ
translated: Shining, he hath risen above his measures, unopposed on every side by the gods,

original: pra majmanā diva indraḥ pṛthivyāḥ prorormaho antarikṣād ṛjīṣī
analyzed: pra majmanā divaḥ indraḥ pṛthivyāḥ pra uroḥ mahaḥ antarikṣāt ṛjīṣī
translated: On his course through the sky, on the earth, through the wide air, Indra, the impetuous one,

original: uruṃ gabhīraṃ januṣābhyugraṃ viśvavyacasamavataṃ matīnām🔽indraṃ somāsaḥ pradivi sutāsaḥ samudraṃ na sravataā viśanti
analyzed: urum gabhīram januṣā abhi ugram viśva vyacasam avatam matīnām  indram somāsaḥ pradivi sutāsaḥ samudram na sravataā viśanti
translated: Wide, deep, by nature exceeding mighty, all-containing, the abode of thoughts,🔽The pressed Soma juices, O Indra, enter thee, the ocean, as streams enter the earth and the sky,

original: yaṃ somamindra pṛthivīdyāvā garbhaṃ na mātā bibhṛtastvāyā
analyzed: yam somam indra pṛthivī dyāvā garbham na mātā bibhṛtaḥ tvāyā
translated: As a mother her son, so have the earth and the sky borne thee, O Indra, as their embryo, for greatness,

original: taṃ te hinvanti tamu te mṛjantyadhvaryavo vṛṣabha pātavā u
analyzed: tam te hinvanti tam u te mṛjanti adhvaryavaḥ vṛṣabha pātavai u
translated: They urge him, they cleanse him for thee, O bull, the Adhvaryus, to drink,

original: marutvānindra vṛṣabho raṇāya pibā somamanuṣvadhaṃ madāya
analyzed: marutvān indra vṛṣabhaḥ raṇāya piba somam anuṣvadham madāya
translated: O Indra, accompanied by the Maruts, be a bull for the battle, drink the Soma according to the rite for the rapture,

original: ā siñcasva jaṭhare madhva ūrmiṃ tvaṃ rājāsi pradivaḥ sutānām
analyzed: ā siñcasva jaṭhare madhvaḥ ūrmim tvam rājā asi pradivaḥ sutānām
translated: Pour into thy belly the wave of sweet meath; thou art the king of the juices by divine appointment

original: sajoṣā indra sagaṇo marudbhiḥ somaṃ piba vṛtrahā śūra vidvān
analyzed: sajoṣāḥ indra sa gaṇaḥ marudbhiḥ somam piba vṛtrahā śūra vidvān
translated: In unison with the Maruts, O Indra, with thy band, drink the Soma, thou who knowest, O hero, the Vrtra-slayer

original: jahi śatrūnrapa mṛdho nudasvāthābhayaṃ kṛṇuhi viśvato naḥ
analyzed: jahi śatrūn rapa mṛdhaḥ nudasva atha abhayam kṛṇuhi viśvatas naḥ
translated: Slay the foes, drive away the enemies, and then make us free from fear on every side

original: uta ṛtubhirṛtupāḥ pāhi somamindra devebhiḥ sakhibhiḥ sutaṃ naḥ
analyzed: uta ṛtubhiḥ ṛtu pāḥ pāhi somam indra devebhiḥ sakhibhiḥ sutam naḥ
translated: And, O thou who presidest over the seasons, protect the Soma in the seasons, O Indra, with the gods, with the friends, the pressed (juice), for us

original: yānābhajo maruto ye tvānvahan vṛtramadadhustubhyamojaḥ
analyzed: yānābhajaḥ marutaḥ ye tvā anvahan vṛtram adadhuḥ tubhyam ojaḥ
translated: Those Maruts who have shared thy portion, who have carried thee, have bestowed strength on thee for the Vrtra-slayer

original: ye tvāhihatye maghavannavardhan ye śāmbare harivo ye gaviṣṭau
analyzed: ye tvā ahi hatye maghavan avardhan ye śāmbare harivas ye gaviṣṭau
translated: Those who have increased thee, O bountiful one, in the battle with Ahi, in the battle with Śambara, in the battle with the cows

original: ye tvā nūnamanumadanti viprāḥ pibendra somaṃ sagaṇo marudbhiḥ
analyzed: ye tvā nūnam anumadanti viprāḥ piba indra somam sa gaṇaḥ marudbhiḥ
translated: Those who now rejoice in thee, O sage, drink the Soma, O Indra, with thy band, with the Maruts

original: marutvantaṃ vṛṣabhaṃ vāvṛdhānamakavāriṃ divyaṃ śāsamindram
analyzed: marutvantam vṛṣabham vāvṛdhānam akava arim divyam śāsam indram
translated: The Marut-attended bull, the grown, the wielder of the thunderbolt, the heavenly ruler, Indra

original: viśvāsāhamavase nūtanāyograṃ sahodāmiha taṃhuvema
analyzed: viśvāsāham avase nūtanāya ugram sahaḥ dām iha tam huvema
translated: The all-conquering one, for new help, the mighty one, let us invoke him here

original: sadyo ha jāto vṛṣabhaḥ kanīnaḥ prabhartumāvadandhasaḥ sutasya
analyzed: sadyas ha jātaḥ vṛṣabhaḥ kanīnaḥ prabhartum āvat andhasaḥ sutasya
translated: The bull, the infant, as soon as born, to bear the juice of the pressed (Soma), to speak

original: sādhoḥ piba pratikāmaṃ yathā te rasāśiraḥ prathamaṃ somyasya
analyzed: sādhoḥ piba pratikāmam yathā te rasāśiraḥ prathamam somyasya
translated: Drink of the good, according to thy desire, as the first of the sweet, of the Soma

original: yajjāyathāstadaharasya kāme 'ṃśoḥ pīyūṣamapibo giriṣṭhām
analyzed: yat jāyathāḥ tat aharasya kāme ṃśoḥ pīyūṣam apibaḥ giriṣṭhām
translated: The portion of that day which was born, the nectar which he drank on the mountain peak

original: taṃ te mātā pari yoṣā janitrī mahaḥ piturdama āsiñcadagre
analyzed: tam te mātā pari yoṣā janitrī mahaḥ pituḥ dame āsiñcat agre
translated: That your mother, the woman who gave birth to you, poured into the great father's mouth first

original: upasthāya mātaramannamaiṭṭa tigmamapaśyadabhi somamūdhaḥ
analyzed: upasthāya mātaram annam aiṭṭa tigmam apaśyat abhi somam ūdhaḥ
translated: Having approached his mother, he ate food, and saw the sharp-pointed udder of the Soma

original: prayāvayannacarad gṛtso anyān mahāni cakre purudhapratīkaḥ
analyzed: prayāvayan acarat gṛtsaḥ anyān mahāni cakre purudha pratīkaḥ
translated: Driving away the others, the strong one moved about, making great deeds, with many forms

original: ugrasturāṣāḷ abhibhūtyojā yathāvaśaṃ tanvaṃ cakra eṣaḥ
analyzed: ugraḥ turāṣāh abhibhūti ojāḥ yathāvaśam tanvam cakre eṣaḥ
translated: The strong one, with overpowering strength, made his body as he wished

original: tvaṣṭāramindro januṣābhibhūyāmuṣyā somamapibaccamūṣu
analyzed: tvaṣṭāram indraḥ januṣā abhibhūya amuṣya ā somam apibat camūṣu
translated: Indra, having surpassed Tvaṣṭṛ by birth, drank Soma with the Uṣṇīkṣa cups

original: śunaṃ huvema / / /
analyzed: śunam huvema
translated: We will invoke the auspicious one...

original: śaṃsā mahāmindraṃ yasmin viśvā ā kṛṣṭayaḥ somapāḥ kāmamavyan
analyzed: śaṃsa mahām indram yasmin viśvāḥ ā kṛṣṭayaḥ soma pāḥ kāmam avyan
translated: I praise the great Indra, in whom all the Soma-drinking clans have their desire

original: yaṃ sukratuṃ dhiṣaṇe vibhvataṣṭaṃ ghanaṃ vṛtrāṇāṃ janayanta devāḥ
analyzed: yam sukratum dhiṣaṇe vibhva taṣṭam ghanam vṛtrāṇām janayanta devāḥ
translated: Whom the wise ones, the creators, the all-shaping ones, the gods, beget as the breaker of forts

original: yaṃ nu nakiḥ pṛtanāsu svarājaṃ dvitā tarati nṛtamaṃ hariṣṭhām
analyzed: yam nu nakir pṛtanāsu sva rājam dvitā tarati nṛtamam hariṣṭhām
translated: Whom no one surpasses in battles, the best of men, the most beautiful, the twice-born

original: inatamaḥ satvabhiryo ha śūṣaiḥ pṛthujrayā aminādāyurdasyoḥ
analyzed: inatamaḥ satvabhiḥ yaḥ ha śūṣaiḥ pṛthujrayā amināt āyuḥ dasyoḥ
translated: The most powerful one who with his strength has overcome the wide-ruling life of the Dasyu

original: sahāvā pṛtsu taraṇirnārvā vyānaśī rodasī mehanāvān
analyzed: sahāvā pṛtsu taraṇiḥ na arvā vyānaśī rodasī mehanāvān
translated: The swift one in battles, the one who has measured the two worlds, the one who has measured the two worlds with his greatness

original: bhago na kāre havyo matīnāṃ piteva cāruḥ suhavo vayodhāḥ
analyzed: bhagaḥ na kāre havyaḥ matīnām pitā iva cāruḥ su havaḥ vayodhāḥ
translated: Bhaga, to be invoked in the sacrifice of our thoughts, like a dear father, easily invoked, giving life,

original: dhartā divo rajasas pṛṣṭa ūrdhvo ratho na vāyurvasubhirniyutvān
analyzed: dhartā divaḥ rajasaḥ pṛṣṭaḥ ūrdhvaḥ rathaḥ na vāyuḥ vasubhiḥ niyutvān
translated: Supporting the sky, the highest of the regions, like a chariot, like Vayu with his team,

original: kṣapāṃ vastā janitā sūryasya vibhaktā bhāgaṃ dhiṣaṇeva vājam
analyzed: kṣapām vastā janitā sūryasya vibhaktā bhāgam dhiṣaṇā iva vājam
translated: The spreader of the night, the begetter of the sun, distributing his portion like a mind-born one,

original: śunaṃ huvema / / /
analyzed: śunam huvema
translated: We will invoke him for good fortune.

original: indraḥ svāhā pibatu yasya soma āgatyā tumro vṛṣabho marutvān🔽oruvyacāḥ pṛṇatāmebhirannairāsya havistanvaḥkāmam ṛdhyāḥ🔽ā te saparyū javase yunajmi yayoranu pradivaḥ śruṣṭimāvaḥ
analyzed: indraḥ svāhā pibatu yasya somaḥ āgatyā tumraḥ vṛṣabhaḥ marutvān  ā uru vyacāḥ pṛṇatām ebhiḥ annaiḥ ā asya haviḥ tanvaḥ kāmam ṛdhyāḥ  ā te saparyū javase yunajmi yayoḥ anu pradivaḥ śruṣṭim āvaḥ
translated: May Indra, to whom the Soma belongs, having come, the red bull accompanied by the Maruts,🔽May he, with these foods that fill out the thighs, having received this oblation, fulfill his desire.🔽I yoke for thee thy two swift steeds, by whom thou hearest the prayer of the day,

original: iha tvā dheyurharayaḥ suśipra pibā tvasya suṣutasya cāroḥ🔽gobhirmimikṣuṃ dadhire supāramindraṃ jyaiṣṭhyāya dhāyase gṛṇānāḥ
analyzed: iha tvā dheyuḥ harayaḥ su śipra pibā tvasya suṣutasya cāroḥ  gobhiḥ mimikṣum dadhire su pāram indram jyaiṣṭhyāya dhāyase gṛṇānāḥ
translated: O thou of beautiful eyebrows, may the tawny ones bring thee hither. Drink of this well-pressed juice.🔽They have made the much-praised one, the bountiful one, Indra, to be honoured with songs, with milk,

original: mandānaḥ somaṃ papivān ṛjīṣin samasmabhyaṃ purudhā gā iṣaṇya
analyzed: mandānaḥ somam papivān ṛjīṣin sam asmabhyam purudhā gāḥ iṣaṇya
translated: Rejoicing, O impetuous one, having drunk the Soma, send us in many ways the cattle.

original: imaṃ kāmaṃ / / /
analyzed: imam kāmam
translated: This desire...

original: śunaṃ huvema / / /
analyzed: śunam huvema
translated: We will invoke him for good fortune.

original: carṣaṇīdhṛtaṃ maghavānamukthyamindraṃ giro bṛhatīrabhyanūṣata
analyzed: carṣaṇī dhṛtam maghavānam ukthyam indram giraḥ bṛhatīḥ abhyanūṣata
translated: The bountiful one, supported by men, worthy of praise, Indra, the lofty songs have sung to him.

original: vāvṛdhānaṃ puruhūtaṃ suvṛktibhiramartyaṃ jaramāṇaṃ divedive
analyzed: vāvṛdhānam puruhūtam suvṛktibhiḥ amartyam jaramāṇam dive dive
translated: Exalted by good hymns, invoked by many, immortal, ever waxing great from day to day,

original: śatakratumarṇavaṃ śākinaṃ naraṃ giro ma indramupa yanti viśvataḥ
analyzed: śatakratum arṇavam śākinam naram giraḥ me indram upa yanti viśvatas
translated: Indra, the Lord of a hundred powers, the ocean, the hero, my songs come from all sides to him.

original: vājasaniṃ pūrbhidaṃ tūrṇimapturaṃ dhāmasācamabhiṣācaṃ svarvidam
analyzed: vāja sanim pūḥ bhidam tūrṇim ap turam dhāmasācam abhiṣācam svar vidam
translated: The winner of spoil, the breaker of forts, the swift, the bountiful, the giver of gifts, the finder of light,

original: ākare vasorjaritā panasyate 'nehasa stubha indro duvasyati🔽vivasvataḥ sadana ā hi pipriye satrāsāhamabhimātihanaṃ stuhi
analyzed: ākare vasoḥ jaritā panasyate na ihasaḥ stubhaḥ indraḥ duvasyati  vivasvataḥ sadane ā hi pipriye satrāsāham abhimāti hanam stuhi
translated: The singer is sent forth to the abode of treasure, the worshipper is sent forth to the abode of treasure. Indra is gracious to the singer who brings no guerdon.🔽I will delight him in the seat of Vivasvan, praise him, the irresistible, the slayer of his foes.

original: nṛṇāmu tvā nṛtamaṃ gīrbhirukthairabhi pra vīramarcatā sabādhaḥ
analyzed: nṛṇāmu tvā nṛtamam gīrbhiḥ ukthaiḥ abhi pra vīram arcata sabādhas
translated: Thee, best of men, with songs and lauds will I glorify, O hero, with all my heart.

original: saṃ sahase purumāyo jihīte namo asya pradiva eka īśe
analyzed: sam sahase puru māyaḥ jihīte namaḥ asya pradivaḥ ekaḥ īśe
translated: He spreads himself in his might, the very wise one. Alone he rules over his gift of reverence.

original: pūrvīrasya niṣṣidho martyeṣu purū vasūni pṛthivī bibharti
analyzed: pūrvīrasya niṣṣidhaḥ martyeṣu purū vasūni pṛthivī bibharti
translated: His ancient doors among mankind, O Earth, bear many treasures.

original: indrāya dyāva oṣadhīrutāpo rayiṃ rakṣanti jīrayo vanāni
analyzed: indrāya dyāvaḥ oṣadhīḥ uta apaḥ rayim rakṣanti jīrayaḥ vanāni
translated: To Indra the heavens, the plants, and the waters, the streams, the woods, and the treasures guard riches.

original: tubhyaṃ brahmāṇi gira indra tubhyaṃ satrā dadhire harivo juṣasva
analyzed: tubhyam brahmāṇi giraḥ indra tubhyam satrā dadhire harivas juṣasva
translated: To thee, O Indra, the prayers and the hymns have ever been given. O thou of tawny steeds, accept them.

original: bodhyāpiravaso nūtanasya sakhe vaso jaritṛbhyo vayodhāḥ
analyzed: bodhyāpiḥ avasaḥ nūtanasya sakhe vaso jaritṛbhyaḥ vayodhāḥ
translated: O friend, O Vasu, be thou awake to the new and the ancient. O Vasu, be thou the bestower of life to the singers.

original: indra marutva iha pāhi somaṃ yathā śāryāte apibaḥ sutasya
analyzed: indra marutvas iha pāhi somam yathā śāryāte apibaḥ sutasya
translated: Indra, accompanied by the Maruts, here drink the Soma as you drank the pressed (juice) of Sarvarya

original: tava praṇītī tava śūra śarmannā vivāsanti kavayaḥsuyajñāḥ
analyzed: tava praṇītī tava śūra śarman nā vivāsanti kavayaḥ su yajñāḥ
translated: Through your favour, O hero, the wise, well-sacrificing ones spread out your protection

original: sa vāvaśāna iha pāhi somaṃ marudbhirindra sakhibhiḥ sutaṃ naḥ
analyzed: sa vāvaśānaḥ iha pāhi somam marudbhiḥ indra sakhibhiḥ sutam naḥ
translated: So, eager, here drink the Soma, O Indra, with the Maruts, our friends, the pressed (juice)

original: jātaṃ yat tvā pari devā abhūṣan mahe bharāya puruhūta viśve
analyzed: jātam yat tvā pari devāḥ abhūṣan mahe bharāya puruhūta viśve
translated: When all the gods made you, invoked by many, for the great burden

original: aptūrye maruta āpireṣo 'mandannindramanu dātivārāḥ
analyzed: aptūrye marutaḥ āpiḥ eṣaḥ mandan indram anu dāti vārāḥ
translated: The Maruts, the swift ones, the impetuous ones, have gladdened Indra, the protector from injury

original: tebhiḥ sākaṃ pibatu vṛtrakhādaḥ sutaṃ somaṃ dāśuṣaḥ sve sadhasthe
analyzed: tebhiḥ sākam pibatu vṛtra khādaḥ sutam somam dāśuṣaḥ sve sadhasthe
translated: With them may he who devours Vritra drink the pressed Soma of the worshipper in his own abode

original: idaṃ hyanvojasā sutaṃ rādhānāṃ pate
analyzed: idam hi anvojasā sutam rādhānām pate
translated: For this, indeed, is the pressed (juice) which follows with strength, O lord of gifts

original: pibā tvasya girvaṇaḥ
analyzed: pibā tvasya girvaṇaḥ
translated: Drink of it, O lover of praise!

original: yaste anu svadhāmasat sute ni yacha tanvam
analyzed: yaḥ te anu svadhām asat sute ni yaccha tanvam
translated: He who shall be according to your nature, place your body in the pressed (juice)

original: sa tvā mamattu somyam🔽pra te aśnotu kukṣyoḥ prendra brahmaṇā śiraḥ
analyzed: sa tvā mamattu somyam  pra te aśnotu kukṣyoḥ pra indra brahmaṇā śiraḥ
translated: May he delight in your Soma-mixture

original: pra bāhū śūra rādhase
analyzed: pra bāhū śūra rādhase
translated: Let your sides be filled, O Indra, let your head be filled with prayer, O hero, let your arms be filled for bounty

original: dhānāvantaṃ karambhiṇamapūpavantamukthinam
analyzed: dhānāvantam karambhiṇam apūpavantam ukthinam
translated: The one possessing the milk, the one possessing the curds, the one possessing the cakes, the one possessing the praises

original: indra prātarjuṣasva naḥ
analyzed: indra prātar juṣasva naḥ
translated: O Indra, be pleased with us in the morning

original: puroḷāśaṃ pacatyaṃ juṣasvendrā gurasva ca
analyzed: puroḷāśam pacatyam juṣasva indra ā gurasva ca
translated: Be pleased with the cake being cooked, O Indra, and be satisfied

original: tubhyaṃ havyāni sisrate
analyzed: tubhyam havyāni sisrate
translated: The offerings flow forth for you

original: puroḷāśaṃ ca no ghaso joṣayāse giraśca naḥ
analyzed: puroḷāśam ca naḥ ghasaḥ joṣayāse giraḥ ca naḥ
translated: And accept our sacrificial cake and our songs,

original: vadhūyuriva yoṣaṇām
analyzed: vadhūyuḥ iva yoṣaṇām
translated: Like a bridegroom to a bride.

original: puroḷāśaṃ sanaśruta prātaḥsāve juṣasva naḥ
analyzed: puroḷāśam sana śruta prātaḥsāve juṣasva naḥ
translated: Accept our sacrificial cake, O thou of good fame, at the morning pressing, O Indra,

original: indra kraturhi te bṛhan🔽mādhyandinasya savanasya dhānāḥ puroḷāśamindra kṛṣvehacārum
analyzed: indra kratuḥ hi te bṛhan  mādhyandinasya savanasya dhānāḥ puroḷāśam indra kṛṣva iha cārum
translated: For thy power, O Indra, is great.🔽At the midday pressing, O Indra, crush the grains and make here the beautiful sacrificial cake,

original: pra yat stotā jaritā tūrṇyartho vṛṣāyamāṇa upa gīrbhirīṭṭe🔽tṛtīye dhānāḥ savane puruṣṭuta puroḷāśamāhutaṃ māmahasva naḥ🔽ṛbhumantaṃ vājavantaṃ tvā kave prayasvanta upa śikṣema dhītibhiḥ
analyzed: pra yat stotā jaritā tūrṇi arthaḥ vṛṣāyamāṇaḥ upa gīrbhiḥ īṭṭe  tṛtīye dhānāḥ savane puruṣṭuta puroḷāśam āhutam māmahasva naḥ  ṛbhumantam vājavantam tvā kave prayasvantaḥ upa śikṣema dhītibhiḥ
translated: When the singer, the praiser, swift in purpose, approaches with songs, like a bull eager (for the cow).🔽At the third pressing, O thou who art praised by many, enjoy the grains and the offered sacrificial cake for us.🔽We, O wise one, with our thoughts, approach thee, accompanied by the Rbhus and Vājas, with offerings.

original: pūṣaṇvate te cakṛmā karambhaṃ harivate haryaśvāya dhānāḥ
analyzed: pūṣaṇvate te cakṛma karambham harivate haryaśvāya dhānāḥ
translated: We have made a mess for thee, O Pūṣan, grains for thee, O lord of bays, O thou with bay steeds.

original: apūpamaddhi sagaṇo marudbhiḥ somaṃ piba vṛtrahā śūra vidvān
analyzed: apūpam addhi sa gaṇaḥ marudbhiḥ somam piba vṛtrahā śūra vidvān
translated: Eat the cake together with the Maruts. Drink the Soma, O Vṛtra-killer, O hero, O wise one.

original: prati dhānā bharata tūyamasmai puroḷāśaṃ vīratamāya nṛṇām
analyzed: prati dhānāḥ bharata tūyam asmai puroḷāśam vīratamāya nṛṇām
translated: Bring quickly the grains to him, the sacrificial cake to the most manly of men.

original: divedive sadṛśīrindra tubhyaṃ vardhantu tvā somapeyāya dhṛṣṇo
analyzed: dive dive sadṛśīḥ indra tubhyam vardhantu tvā soma peyāya dhṛṣṇo
translated: Day by day, O Indra, may the equal ones increase for thee, to make thee drink Soma, O bold one.

original: indrāparvatā bṛhatā rathena vāmīriṣa ā vahataṃ suvīrāḥ
analyzed: indrāparvatā bṛhatā rathena vāmīriṣaḥ ā vahatam su vīrāḥ
translated: O Indra and Parvata, bring with your great chariot rich gifts and good heroes.

original: vītaṃ havyānyadhvareṣu devā vardhethāṃ gīrbhīriḷayā madantā
analyzed: vītam havyāni adhvareṣu devā vardhethām gīrbhīriḍayā madantā
translated: Purified, O gods, the oblations at the sacrifices, may you increase with the praises, rejoicing

original: tiṣṭhā su kaṃ maghavan mā parā gāḥ somasya nu tvā suṣutasya yakṣi🔽piturna putraḥ sicamā rabhe ta indra svādiṣṭhayā girā śacīvaḥ
analyzed: tiṣṭha su kam maghavan mā parā gāḥ somasya nu tvā suṣutasya yakṣi  pituḥ na putraḥ sicam ā rabhe te indra svādiṣṭhayā girā śacīvas
translated: Stand firm, O bountiful one, do not go away! I will serve you with well-pressed Soma🔽Like a son his father, I grasp your reins, O Indra, with the sweetest speech, O mighty one

original: śaṃsāvādhvaryo prati me gṛṇīhīndrāya vāhaḥ kṛṇavāva juṣṭam
analyzed: śaṃsāva adhvaryo prati me gṛṇīhi indrāya vāhaḥ kṛṇavāva juṣṭam
translated: Praise, O Adhvaryu, respond to me! Let us make an offering acceptable to Indra

original: edaṃ barhiryajamānasya sīdāthā ca bhūdukthamindrāya śastam
analyzed: ā idam barhiḥ yajamānasya sīda athā ca bhūt uktham indrāya śastam
translated: Sit on this sacrificial grass of the sacrificer, then be the praise to Indra

original: jāyedastaṃ maghavan sedu yonistadit tvā yuktā harayo vahantu
analyzed: jāyā id astam maghavan sedu yoniḥ tat id tvā yuktāḥ harayaḥ vahantu
translated: Let the sacrificer be born, O bountiful one, let him sit in the womb, let your yoked tawny horses carry you

original: yadā kadā ca sunavāma somamagniṣ ṭvā dūto dhanvātyacha
analyzed: yadā kadā ca sunavāma somam agniḥ tvā dūtaḥ dhanvātyacha
translated: Whenever we press Soma, let Agni, your messenger, come from afar

original: parā yāhi maghavannā ca yāhīndra bhrātarubhayatrā te artham
analyzed: parā yāhi maghavan nā ca yāhi indra bhrātar ubhayatrā te artham
translated: Go away, O bountiful one, and do not go away! O Indra, your brother's purpose is on both sides

original: yatrā rathasya bṛhato nidhānaṃ vimocanaṃ vājino rāsabhasya
analyzed: yatrā rathasya bṛhataḥ nidhānam vimocanam vājinaḥ rāsabhasya
translated: Where is the resting place of the great chariot, the unyoking of the strong ass

original: apāḥ somamastamindra pra yāhi kalyāṇīrjayā suraṇaṃgṛhe te
analyzed: apāḥ somam astam indra pra yāhi kalyāṇīḥ jaya te
translated: Drink the Soma, O Indra, and go away! In the house of the joyous one, your victory is auspicious

original: yatrā rathasya bṛhato nidhānaṃ vimocanaṃ vājinodakṣiṇāvat
analyzed: yatrā rathasya bṛhataḥ nidhānam vimocanam vājinā dakṣiṇāvat
translated: Where is the resting place of the great chariot, the unyoking of the strong horse, with gifts to the right

original: ime bhojā aṅgiraso virūpā divas putrāso asurasya vīrāḥ
analyzed: ime bhojāḥ aṅgirasaḥ virūpāḥ divaḥ putrāsaḥ asurasya vīrāḥ
translated: These Bhoja Angirasas, of various forms, the sons of heaven, the heroes of the Asura,

original: viśvāmitrāya dadato maghāni sahasrasāve pra tiranta āyuḥ
analyzed: viśvāmitrāya dadataḥ maghāni sahasrasāve pra tirante āyuḥ
translated: Giving to Vishvamitra his boons, extend his life, O thou who hast a thousand gifts.

original: rūpaṃrūpaṃ maghavā bobhavīti māyāḥ kṛṇvānastanvaṃ pari svām🔽triryad divaḥ pari muhūrtamāgāt svairmantrairanṛtupā ṛtāvā
analyzed: rūpam rūpam maghavā bobhavīti māyāḥ kṛṇvānaḥ tanvam pari svām  tris yat divaḥ pari muhūrtam āgāt svaiḥ mantraiḥ anṛtu pāḥ ṛtāvā
translated: Maghavan shines forth in every form, creating illusions, around his own body.

original: mahān ṛṣirdevajā devajūto 'stabhnāt sindhumarṇavaṃ nṛcakṣāḥ
analyzed: mahān ṛṣiḥ deva jāḥ deva jūtaḥ stabhnāt sindhum arṇavam nṛ cakṣāḥ
translated: When the great Rishi, born of the gods, inspired by the gods, of human sight,🔽came for a moment from heaven, the true one, with his own hymns,

original: viśvāmitro yadavahat sudāsamapriyāyata kuśikebhirindraḥ
analyzed: viśvāmitraḥ yat avahat sudāsam apriyāyata kuśikebhiḥ indraḥ
translated: Vishvamitra, when he brought Sudasa to the Apsarases, Indra rejoiced with the Kushikas.

original: haṃsā iva kṛṇutha ślokamadribhirmadanto gīrbhiradhvare sute sacā
analyzed: haṃsāḥ iva kṛṇutha ślokam adribhiḥ madantaḥ gīrbhiḥ adhvare sute sacā
translated: Like swans ye make a song with the stones, rejoicing with the songs at the sacrifice, together with the pressed (Soma).

original: devebhirviprā ṛṣayo nṛcakṣaso vi pibadhvaṃ kuśikāḥ somyaṃ madhu
analyzed: devebhiḥ viprāḥ ṛṣayaḥ nṛ cakṣasaḥ vi pibadhvam kuśikāḥ somyam madhu
translated: O Kushikas, ye sages, seers of men, drink ye the sweet Soma with the gods, O Brahmans.

original: upa preta kuśikāścetayadhvamaśvaṃ rāye pra muñcatā sudāsaḥ
analyzed: upa preta kuśikāḥ cetayadhvam aśvam rāye pra muñcata sudāsaḥ
translated: Go forward, O Kushikas, bethink you; let Sudasa set the horse free for wealth.

original: rājā vṛtraṃ jaṅghanat prāgapāgudagathā yajāte vara ā pṛthivyāḥ
analyzed: rājā vṛtram jaṅghanat prāk apāk udak athā yajāte vare ā pṛthivyāḥ
translated: The king, having slain Vritra, has sacrificed to the east, west, north, and on the surface of the earth.

original: ya ime rodasī ubhe ahamindramatuṣṭavam
analyzed: yaḥ ime rodasī ubhe aham indram atuṣṭavam
translated: I have praised Indra, who is over both these worlds,

original: viśvāmitrasyarakṣati brahmedaṃ bhārataṃ janam
analyzed: brahma idam bhāratam janam
translated: Vishvamitra's Brahman protects this Bharata people.

original: viśvāmitrā arāsata brahmendrāya vajriṇe
analyzed: viśvāmitrāḥ arāsata brahma indrāya vajriṇe
translated: Viśvāmitra and Aṅgiras have bestowed the Brahman on Indra the wielder of the thunderbolt

original: karadin naḥ surādhasaḥ
analyzed: karadin naḥ su rādhasaḥ
translated: May they make us rich in goods

original: kiṃ te kṛṇvanti kīkaṭeṣu gāvo nāśiraṃ duhre na tapantigharmam
analyzed: kim te kṛṇvanti kīkaṭeṣu gāvaḥ na āśiram duhre na tapantigharmam
translated: What do they do for you in the villages, the cows? They do not milk the barren cow, they do not heat the cold water

original: ā no bhara pramagandasya vedo naicāśākhaṃ maghavanrandhayā naḥ
analyzed: ā naḥ bhara pramagandasya vedaḥ naicāśākham maghavan randhaya naḥ
translated: Bring us the treasure of Pramaganda, O bountiful one, stretch out to us the low-hanging one

original: sasarparīramatiṃ bādhamānā bṛhan mimāya jamadagnidattā
analyzed: sasarpa rīramatim bādhamānā bṛhat mimāya jamadagni dattā
translated: Overcoming the serpent-like excess, extending the great (sacrifice) given by Jamadagni

original: ā sūryasya duhitā tatāna śravo deveṣvamṛtamajuryam
analyzed: ā sūryasya duhitā tatāna śravaḥ deveṣu amṛtam ajuryam
translated: The daughter of the sun has spread fame among the gods, the immortal, undecaying (truth)

original: sasarparīrabharat tūyamebhyo 'dhi śravaḥ pāñcajanyāsu kṛṣṭiṣu
analyzed: sasarpa rīrabharat tūyamebhyaḥ dhi śravaḥ pāñcajanyāsu kṛṣṭiṣu
translated: She has brought quickly to these (people) the fame that is in the five peoples' cultivated lands, overcoming the serpent-like (evil)

original: sā pakṣyā navyamāyurdadhānā yāṃ me palastijamadagnayo daduḥ
analyzed: sā pakṣyā navyam āyuḥ dadhānā yām me palasti jamadagnayaḥ daduḥ
translated: She, the bird, bestowing new life, whom the sons of Pṛiṣni Jamadagni gave to me

original: sthirau gāvau bhavatāṃ vīḷurakṣo meṣā vi varhi mā yugaṃ vi śāri🔽indraḥ pātalye dadatāṃ śarītorariṣṭaneme abhi naḥ sacasva
analyzed: sthirau gāvau bhavatām vīḍu rakṣaḥ mā īṣā vi varhi mā yugam vi śāri  indraḥ pātalye dadatām śarītoḥ ariṣṭa neme abhi naḥ sacasva
translated: Be firm, O cows, be firm, O Vīḷurākṣa, let the rams spread out, let not the yoke break🔽Indra, when the two sides are given, be with us for the safe return of the chariot

original: balaṃ dhehi tanūṣu no balamindrānaḷutsu naḥ
analyzed: balam dhehi tanūṣu naḥ balam indra anaḷutsu naḥ
translated: Bestow strength upon our bodies, O Indra, bestow strength upon our horses

original: balaṃ tokāya tanayāya jīvase tvaṃ hi baladā asi
analyzed: balam tokāya tanayāya jīvase tvam hi bala dāḥ asi
translated: Bestow strength upon our offspring for life, for thou art the giver of strength

original: abhi vyayasva khadirasya sāramojo dhehi spandane śiṃśapāyām
analyzed: abhi vyayasva khadirasya sāram ojaḥ dhehi spandane śiṃśapāyām
translated: Stretch out the essence of the khadira, bestow strength in the trembling of the śiṃśapā

original: akṣa vīḷo vīḷita vīḷayasva mā yāmādasmādava jīhipo naḥ
analyzed: akṣa vīḷo vīḍita vīḍayasva mā yāmāt asmāt ava jīhipaḥ naḥ
translated: O dice, roll, roll away, do not deceive us from this throw.

original: ayamasmān vanaspatirmā ca hā mā ca rīriṣat
analyzed: ayam asmān vanaspatiḥ mā ca hāḥ mā ca rīriṣat
translated: May this tree protect us, and do us no harm.

original: svastyāgṛhebhya āvasā ā vimocanāt
analyzed: svastyā gṛhebhyaḥ āvasā ā vimocanāt
translated: From the house of good fortune, from the house of dwelling, from the house of deliverance.

original: indrotibhirbahulābhirno adya yācchreṣṭhābhirmaghavañchūra jinva
analyzed: indra ūtibhiḥ bahulābhiḥ naḥ adya yācchreṣṭhābhiḥ maghavan śūra jinva
translated: O Indra, with your abundant and best aids, O bountiful one, O hero, invigorate us today.

original: yo no dveṣṭyadharaḥ sas padīṣṭa yamu dviṣmastamu prāṇo jahātu
analyzed: yaḥ naḥ dveṣṭi adharaḥ saḥ padīṣṭa yamu dviṣmaḥ tamu prāṇaḥ jahātu
translated: Let him who hates us be below, let him whom we hate be deprived of breath.

original: paraśuṃ cid vi tapati śimbalaṃ cid vi vṛścati
analyzed: paraśum cit vi tapati śimbalam cit vi vṛścati
translated: He splits even the axe, he breaks even the wedge.

original: ukhā cidindra yeṣantī prayastā phenamasyati🔽na sāyakasya cikite janāso lodhaṃ nayanti paśu manyamānāḥ
analyzed: ukhā cit indra yeṣantī prayastā phenam asyati  na sāyakasya cikite janāsaḥ lodham nayanti paśu manyamānāḥ
translated: Even the pot, O Indra, when heated, throws out foam.🔽The people do not know the arrow. They lead away the donkey, thinking it a beast of burden.

original: nāvājinaṃ vājinā hāsayanti na gardabhaṃ puro aśvān nayanti
analyzed: na a vājinam vājinā hāsayanti na gardabham puras aśvāt nayanti
translated: They do not lead the swift horse in front for the swift race.

original: ima indra bharatasya putrā apapitvaṃ cikiturna prapitvam🔽hinvantyaśvamaraṇaṃ na nityaṃ jyāvājaṃ pari ṇayantyājau
analyzed: ime indra bharatasya putrāḥ apapitvam cikituḥ na prapitvam  hinvanti aśva maraṇam na nityam jyā vājam pari nayanti ājau
translated: These sons of Bharata, O Indra, seek your protection, not that of their father.🔽They urge on the horse to be sacrificed, as if it were not a constant thing, they lead the strong one to the battle.

original: imaṃ mahe vidathyāya śūṣaṃ śaśvat kṛtva īḍyaya pra jabhruḥ
analyzed: imam mahe vidathyāya śūṣam śaśvat kṛtvas īḍyaya pra jabhruḥ
translated: They have brought this strength to the great one who goes to the assembly, to be praised at all times.

original: śṛṇotu no damyebhiranīkaiḥ śṛṇotvagnirdivyairajasraḥ
analyzed: śṛṇotu naḥ damyebhiḥ anīkaiḥ śṛṇotu agniḥ divyaiḥ ajasraḥ
translated: May he listen to us with his tame and untamed forms, may Agni listen with his heavenly forms that never fail.

original: mahi mahe dive arcā pṛthivyai kāmo ma ichañcarati prajānan
analyzed: mahi mahe dive arca pṛthivyai kāmaḥ me ichan carati prajānan
translated: I praise the great heaven and the great earth, my desire, knowing, moves about seeking.

original: yayorha stome vidatheṣu devāḥ saparyavo mādayante sacāyoḥ
analyzed: yayoḥ ha stome vidatheṣu devāḥ saparyavaḥ mādayante sacā ayoḥ
translated: In whose praise the gods, the attendants, rejoice in the assemblies, in the two who are together.

original: yuvorṛtaṃ rodasī satyamastu mahe ṣu ṇaḥ suvitāya pra bhūtam
analyzed: yuvoḥ ṛtam rodasī satyam astu mahe su naḥ suvitāya pra bhūtam
translated: Let your truth, O heaven and earth, be firm for us. Be ready for great bliss.

original: idaṃ dive namo agne pṛthivyai saparyāmi prayasā yāmi ratnam
analyzed: idam dive namaḥ agne pṛthivyai saparyāmi prayasā yāmi ratnam
translated: This homage to heaven, O Agni, to earth I offer. With devotion I go to obtain wealth.

original: uto hi vāṃ pūrvyā āvividra ṛtāvarī rodasī satyavācaḥ
analyzed: uta u hi vām pūrvyāḥ āvividre ṛtāvarī rodasī satyavācaḥ
translated: For you two, O ancient ones, the truthful, the two worlds, have been disclosed.

original: naraścid vāṃ samithe śūrasātau vavandire pṛthivi vevidānāḥ
analyzed: naraḥ cit vām samithe śūrasātau vavandire pṛthivi vevidānāḥ
translated: Even men, seeking, have bowed to you two in the assembly, in the contest for the hero's prize.

original: ko addhā veda ka iha pra vocad devānachā pathyā kā sameti
analyzed: kaḥ addhā veda kaḥ iha pra vocat devān achā pathyā kā sameti
translated: Who indeed knows? Who here would declare? The paths to the gods are hidden. Which one goes?

original: dadṛśra eṣāmavamā sadāṃsi pareṣu yā guhyeṣu vrateṣu🔽kavirnṛcakṣā abhi ṣīmacaṣṭa ṛtasya yonā vighṛte madantī
analyzed: dadṛśre eṣām avamā sadāṃsi pareṣu yā guhyeṣu vrateṣu  kaviḥ nṛ cakṣāḥ abhi sīma caṣṭe ṛtasya yonā vighṛte madantī
translated: They have seen the lowest seats of these, which are among the distant, in the secret vows.🔽The wise one, the seer of men, has looked upon them, rejoicing in the womb of truth, in the uncovered place.

original: nānā cakrāte sadanaṃ yathā vaḥ samānena kratunā saṃvidāne
analyzed: nānā cakrāte sadanam yathā vaḥ samānena kratunā saṃvidāne
translated: They have made two different seats for you, as it were, agreeing through a common resolve.

original: samānyā viyute dūreante dhruve pade tasthaturjāgarūke
analyzed: samānyā viyute dūreante dhruve pade tasthatuḥ jāgarūke
translated: In a common place, in a distant end, in a firm abode, they stand, the two watchful ones.

original: uta svasārā yuvatī bhavantī ādu bruvāte mithunāni nāma
analyzed: uta svasārā yuvatī bhavantī ādu bruvāte mithunāni nāma
translated: And the two sisters, the young maidens, become one, and they utter the names of the pairs.

original: viśvedete janimā saṃ vivikto maho devān bibhratī na vyathete
analyzed: viśvā id ete janimā sam viviktaḥ mahaḥ devān bibhratī na vyathete
translated: These all are born together, well distinguished, bearing the great gods, they are not shaken.

original: ejad dhruvaṃ patyate viśvamekaṃ carat patatri viṣuṇaṃ vi jātam
analyzed: ejat dhruvam patyate viśvam ekam carat patatri viṣuṇam vi jātam
translated: The moving one rests firm, all in one place, the flying one moves, the born one is extended.

original: sanā purāṇamadhyemyārān mahaḥ piturjaniturjāmi tan naḥ
analyzed: sanā purāṇam adhyemi ārāt mahaḥ pituḥ janituḥ jāmi tat naḥ
translated: The ancient one, the ancient one, the one to be thought of, the one from the great father's birth, that is our...

original: devāso yatra panitāra evairurau pathi vyute tasthurantaḥ
analyzed: devāsaḥ yatra panitāraḥ evaiḥ urau pathi vyute tasthuḥ antar
translated: Where the gods, the creators, have stood, on the path spread out in the lap, in the middle...

original: imaṃ stomaṃ rodasī pra bravīmy ṛdūdarāḥ śṛṇavannagnijihvāḥ
analyzed: imam stomam rodasī pra bravīmi ṛdūdarāḥ śṛṇavan agni jihvāḥ
translated: I proclaim this praise to the two world-halves, O you with tender bellies, listen, with Agni as your tongue.

original: mitraḥ samrājo varuṇo yuvāna ādityāsaḥ kavayaḥ paprathānāḥ🔽hiraṇyapāṇiḥ savitā sujihvastrirā divo vidathe patyamānaḥ
analyzed: mitraḥ samrājaḥ varuṇaḥ yuvānaḥ ādityāsaḥ kavayaḥ paprathānāḥ  hiraṇya pāṇiḥ savitā su jihvaḥ trirā divaḥ vidathe patyamānaḥ
translated: Mitra, the young king, Varuṇa, the Ādityas, the wise ones, are spreading out.🔽Savitar, with golden hands, with a good tongue, ruling in the three realms of heaven, in the sacred place,

original: deveṣu ca savitaḥ ślokamaśrerādasmabhyamā suvasarvatātim🔽sukṛt supāṇiḥ svavān ṛtāvā devastvaṣṭāvase tāni nodhāt
analyzed: deveṣu ca savitar ślokam aśrerāt asmabhyam ā suva sarvatātim  su kṛt su pāṇiḥ svavān ṛtāvā devaḥ tvaṣṭā avase tāni nodhāt
translated: O Savitar, you have sung a hymn among the gods. Send us all-surpassing prosperity.🔽The well-doing, well-handed, rich, truthful god Tvaṣṭar has granted us those boons.

original: pūṣaṇvanta ṛbhavo mādayadhvamūrdhvagrāvāṇo adhvaramataṣṭa
analyzed: pūṣaṇvantaḥ ṛbhavaḥ mādayadhvam ūrdhva grāvāṇaḥ adhvaram ataṣṭa
translated: O Ṛbhus, rejoice with Pūṣan. You who have raised the stone, you have prepared the sacrifice.

original: vidyudrathā maruta ṛṣṭimanto divo maryā ṛtajātā ayāsaḥ
analyzed: vidyut rathāḥ marutaḥ ṛṣṭimantaḥ divaḥ maryāḥ ṛta jātāḥ ayāsaḥ
translated: O Maruts, with lightning as your chariot, with spears, the boundaries of heaven, born of truth, swift.

original: sarasvatī śṛṇavan yajñiyāso dhātā rayiṃ sahavīraṃ turāsaḥ
analyzed: sarasvatī śṛṇavan yajñiyāsaḥ dhāta rayim saha vīram turāsaḥ
translated: May Sarasvatī, the worthy of sacrifice, Dhatr, the swift ones, grant wealth together with heroic men.

original: viṣṇuṃ stomāsaḥ purudasmamarkā bhagasyeva kāriṇo yāmani gman
analyzed: viṣṇum stomāsaḥ puru dasmam arkāḥ bhagasya iva kāriṇaḥ yāmani gman
translated: The hymns of praise, O Viṣṇu, the songs, O bountiful one, have reached the goal, like the works of Bhaga, in the journey

original: urukramaḥ kakuho yasya pūrvirna mardhanti yuvatayojanitrīḥ
analyzed: uru kramaḥ kakuhaḥ yasya pūrviḥ na mardhanti yuvatayaḥ janitrīḥ
translated: Whose wide stride, lofty one, the young maidens who guide the chariot do not hinder in the east

original: indro viśvairvīryaiḥ patyamāna ubhe ā paprau rodasī mahitvā
analyzed: indraḥ viśvaiḥ vīryaiḥ patyamānaḥ ubhe ā paprau rodasī mahitvā
translated: Indra, ruling with all his powers, has filled both worlds with his greatness

original: purandaro vṛtrahā dhṛṣṇuṣeṇaḥ saṃgṛbhyā na ā bharā bhūri paśvaḥ
analyzed: purandaraḥ vṛtra hā dhṛṣṇuṣeṇaḥ saṃgṛbhyā naḥ ā bhara bhūri paśvaḥ
translated: Purandara, the Vrtra-slayer, the bold one, having grasped, bring to us abundant cattle

original: nāsatyā me pitarā bandhupṛchā sajātyamaśvinoścāru nāma
analyzed: nāsatyā me pitarā bandhu pṛchā sajātyam aśvinoḥ cāru nāma
translated: The Nāsatyas are my parents, seeking kinship with the Aśvins, with the beautiful name

original: yuvaṃ hi stho rayidau no rayīṇāṃ dātraṃ rakṣethe akavairadabdhā
analyzed: yuvam hi sthaḥ rayi dau naḥ rayīṇām dātram rakṣethe akavaiḥ adabdhā
translated: For you two are the givers of wealth among our riches, you two, the unerring, protect the gift

original: mahat tad vaḥ kavayaścāru nāma yad dha deva bhavatha viśva indre
analyzed: mahat tat vaḥ kavayaḥ cāru nāma yat ha deva bhavatha viśve indre
translated: That is your great and beautiful name, O wise ones, when you become all the gods in Indra

original: sakha ṛbhubhiḥ puruhūta priyebhirimāṃ dhiyaṃ sātaye takṣatā naḥ
analyzed: sakhaḥ ṛbhubhiḥ puruhūta priyebhiḥ imām dhiyam sātaye takṣata naḥ
translated: O much-invoked one, with the Rbhus, the beloved ones, fashion for us this thought for attainment

original: aryamā ṇo aditiryajñiyāso 'dabdhāni varuṇasya vratāni
analyzed: aryamā ṇaḥ aditiḥ yajñiyāsaḥ dabdhāni varuṇasya vratāni
translated: May Aryaman, Aditi, the worthy of sacrifice, the inviolate vows of Varuṇa

original: yuyota no anapatyāni gantoḥ prajāvān naḥ paśumānastu gātuḥ
analyzed: yuyota naḥ anapatyāni gantoḥ prajāvān naḥ paśumān astu gātuḥ
translated: Turn away from us childlessness, and let our going be fruitful in offspring and cattle

original: devānāṃ dūtaḥ purudha prasūto 'nāgān no vocatu sarvatātā
analyzed: devānām dūtaḥ purudha prasūtaḥ nāgān naḥ vocatu sarvatātā
translated: The messenger of the gods, much urged on, speak to us who have not come, O all-knowing one

original: śṛṇotu naḥ pṛthivī dyaurutāpaḥ sūryo nakṣatrairurvantarikṣam
analyzed: śṛṇotu naḥ pṛthivī dyauḥ uta apaḥ sūryaḥ nakṣatraiḥ uru antarikṣam
translated: May the earth and heaven hear us, and the waters, the sun with the stars, and the wide atmosphere.

original: śṛṇvantu no vṛṣaṇaḥ parvatāso dhruvakṣemāsa iḷayā madantaḥ
analyzed: śṛṇvantu naḥ vṛṣaṇaḥ parvatāsaḥ dhruva kṣemāsaḥ iḷayā madantaḥ
translated: May the mighty mountains hear us, firm and secure, rejoicing in their strength.

original: ādityairno aditiḥ śṛṇotu yachantu no marutaḥ śarmabhadram
analyzed: ādityaiḥ naḥ aditiḥ śṛṇotu yacchantu naḥ marutaḥ śarma bhadram
translated: May Aditi hear us with the Adityas, and may the Maruts grant us auspicious protection.

original: sadā sugaḥ pitumānastu panthā madhva devā oṣadhīḥ sampipṛkta
analyzed: sadā su gaḥ pitumān astu panthāḥ devāḥ oṣadhīḥ sampipṛkta
translated: May the path be always easy and prosperous, and may the gods mix the plants with sweetness.

original: bhago me agne sakhye na mṛdhyā ud rāyo aśyāṃ sadanaṃ purukṣoḥ🔽svadasva havyā samiṣo didīhyasmadryak saṃ mimīhi śravāṃsi
analyzed: bhagaḥ me agne sakhye na mṛdhyāḥ ud rāyaḥ aśyām sadanam purukṣoḥ  svadasva havyā samiṣaḥ didīhi asmadryak sam mimīhi śravāṃsi
translated: May Bhaga, O Agni, not injure me in my friendship, may I obtain the abode of the rich in cattle.🔽Taste the oblations, shine with food, measure out glories for us.

original: viśvānagne pṛtsu tañ jeṣi śatrūnahā viśvā sumanā dīdihī naḥ
analyzed: viśvānagne pṛtsu tam jeṣi śatrūn ahā viśvā sumanāḥ dīdihi naḥ
translated: In all battles, O Agni, thou shalt conquer these enemies, shine upon us with all thy favour.

original: uṣasaḥ pūrvā adha yad vyūṣurmahad vi jajñe akṣaraṃ pade goḥ
analyzed: uṣasaḥ pūrvāḥ adha yat vyūṣuḥ mahat vi jajñe akṣaram pade goḥ
translated: When the first dawns have departed, a great imperishable thing is born in the place of the cow.

original: vratā devānāmupa nu prabhūṣan mahad devānāmasuratvamekam
analyzed: vratā devānām upa nu prabhūṣan mahat devānām asura tvam ekam
translated: The vows of the gods are increased, the great godhead of the gods is one.

original: mo ṣū ṇo atra juhuranta devā mā pūrve agne pitaraḥ padajñāḥ
analyzed: mā u su naḥ atra juhuranta devāḥ mā pūrve agne pitaraḥ pada jñāḥ
translated: Do not let the gods here abandon us, nor our ancient fathers, O Agni, who know the place.

original: purāṇyoḥ sadmanoḥ keturantarma / / /
analyzed: purāṇyoḥ sadmanoḥ ketuḥ antarma
translated: The light of the two ancient abodes...

original: vi me purutrā patayanti kāmāḥ śamyachā dīdye pūrvyāṇi
analyzed: vi me purutrā patayanti kāmāḥ śamyachāḥ dīdye pūrvyāṇi
translated: My desires fly in many directions, I wish to accomplish the ancient ones.

original: samiddhe agnāv ṛtamid vadema ma / / /
analyzed: samiddhe agnau ṛtamit vadema ma
translated: In the well-kindled fire we will speak the truth.

original: samāno rājā vibhṛtaḥ purutrā śaye śayāsu prayuto vanānu
analyzed: samānaḥ rājā vibhṛtaḥ purutrā śaye śayāsu prayutaḥ vanā anu
translated: The common king is divided in many ways, lying among the lying ones, tied to the woods.

original: anyā vatsaṃ bharati kṣeti mātā ma / / /
analyzed: anyā vatsam bharati kṣeti mātā ma
translated: Another one carries the calf, the mother rests.

original: ākṣit pūrvāsvaparā anūrut sadyo jātāsu taruṇīṣvantaḥ
analyzed: ākṣit pūrvāsu aparāḥ anūrudh sadyas jātāsu taruṇīṣu antar
translated: The earlier ones have not seen, the later ones have not moved, the young ones are born at once.

original: antarvatīḥ suvate apravītā ma / / /
analyzed: antarvatīḥ suvate a pravītāḥ ma
translated: The pregnant ones give birth, the unmarried ones.

original: śayuḥ parastādadha nu dvimātābandhanaścarati vatsa ekaḥ
analyzed: śayuḥ parastāt adha nu dvi mātā bandhanaḥ carati vatsaḥ ekaḥ
translated: The lying one is on the other side, the two-mothered one moves with the bond, the calf alone.

original: mitrasya tā varuṇasya vratāni ma / / /
analyzed: mitrasya tā varuṇasya vratāni ma
translated: Those are the laws of Mitra and Varuna.

original: dvimātā hotā vidatheṣu samrāḷ anvagraṃ carati kṣeti budhnaḥ
analyzed: dvi mātā hotā vidatheṣu samrāj anvagram carati kṣeti budhnaḥ
translated: The two-mothered Hotar moves in the assemblies as the sovereign, the firm one rests.

original: pra raṇyāni raṇyavāco bharante ma / / /
analyzed: pra raṇyāni raṇya vācaḥ bharante ma
translated: They carry the pleasant things, the pleasant-voiced ones.

original: śūrasyeva yudhyato antamasya pratīcīnaṃ dadṛśe viśvamāyat
analyzed: śūrasya iva yudhyataḥ antamasya pratīcīnam dadṛśe viśvamāyat
translated: The end of the fighting one is seen, like a hero fighting, all the ways are turned towards it.

original: antarmatiścarati niṣṣidhaṃ gorma / / /
analyzed: antar matiḥ carati niṣṣidham gorma
translated: The thought moves within, to the enclosure of the cow.

original: ni veveti palito dūta āsvantarmahāṃścarati rocanena
analyzed: ni veveti palitaḥ dūtaḥ āsu antar mahān carati rocanena
translated: The gray one moves as a messenger among them, the great one moves within with radiance.

original: vapūṃṣi bibhradabhi no vi caṣṭe ma / / /
analyzed: vapūṃṣi bibhrat abhi naḥ vi caṣṭe ma
translated: Bearing forms, he looks upon us.

original: viṣṇurgopāḥ paramaṃ pāti pāthaḥ priyā dhāmānyamṛtādadhānaḥ
analyzed: viṣṇuḥ gopāḥ paramam pāti pāthaḥ priyā dhāmāni amṛta ādadhānaḥ
translated: Vishnu, the guardian, protects the highest path, placing the beloved abodes beyond death.

original: agniṣ ṭā viśvā bhuvanāni veda ma / / /
analyzed: agniḥ tā viśvā bhuvanāni veda ma
translated: Agni knows all the worlds.

original: nānā cakrāte yamyā vapūṃṣi tayoranyad rocate kṛṣṇamanyat
analyzed: nānā cakrāte yamyāḥ vapūṃṣi tayoḥ anyat rocate kṛṣṇam anyat
translated: They have created various forms, O Yama; one of them shines black, the other shines

original: śyāvī ca yadaruṣī ca svasārau ma / / /
analyzed: śyāvī ca yat aruṣī ca svasārau ma
translated: red. The two sisters, the dark one and the red one, are united

original: mātā ca yatra duhitā ca dhenū sabardughe dhāpayete samīcī
analyzed: mātā ca yatra duhitā ca dhenū sabardughe dhāpayete samīcī
translated: with the mother and the daughter, the two cows, both yielding much milk, are suckling together.

original: ṛtasya te sadasīḷe antarma / / /
analyzed: ṛtasya te sadasi iḍe antarma
translated: I enter the two seats of truth, the one

original: anyasyā vatsaṃ rihatī mimāya kayā bhuvā ni dadhe dhenurūdhaḥ
analyzed: anyasyāḥ vatsam rihatī mimāya kayā bhuvā ni dadhe dhenu rūdhaḥ
translated: licking the calf of the other, by what means the cow has placed her udders.

original: ṛtasya sā payasāpinvateḷā ma / / /
analyzed: ṛtasya sā payasā apinvata iḍā ma
translated: The two, the mother and the daughter, are filled with the milk of truth.

original: padyā vaste pururūpā vapūṃṣyūrdhvā tasthau tryaviṃ rerihāṇā
analyzed: padyā vaste puru rūpā vapūṃṣi ūrdhvā tasthau tryavim rerihāṇā
translated: The one, wearing the form of a dwarf, stands erect, licking the three-footed one.

original: ṛtasya sadma vi carāmi vidvān ma / / /
analyzed: ṛtasya sadma vi carāmi vidvān ma
translated: I, knowing, enter the abode of truth, the one

original: pade iva nihite dasme antastayoranyad guhyamāviranyat
analyzed: pade iva nihite dasme antar tayoḥ anyat guhyam āvis anyat
translated: placed in the two feet, the one hidden, the other manifest.

original: sadhrīcīnā pathyā sā viṣūcī ma / / /
analyzed: sadhrīcīnā pathyā sā viṣūcī ma
translated: The straight path and the crooked one are united.

original: ā dhenavo dhunayantāmaśiśvīḥ sabardughāḥ śaśayā apradugdhāḥ
analyzed: ā dhenavaḥ dhunayantām aśiśvīḥ sabardughāḥ śaśayāḥ a pradugdhāḥ
translated: Let the young cows, lowing, with their calves, the ever-yielding ones, not yet milked,

original: navyānavyā yuvatayo bhavantīrma / / /
analyzed: navyā anavyāḥ yuvatayaḥ bhavantīḥ ma
translated: the young ones, ever new, becoming young maidens,

original: yadanyāsu vṛṣabho roravīti so anyasmin yūthe ni dadhātiretaḥ
analyzed: yat anyāsu vṛṣabhaḥ roravīti saḥ anyasmin yūthe ni dadhāti retaḥ
translated: when the bull roars to the others, places his seed in another herd.

original: sa hi kṣapāvān sa bhagaḥ sa rājā ma / / /
analyzed: sa hi kṣapāvān sa bhagaḥ sa rājā ma
translated: He is the one who makes the night, he is Bhaga, he is the king.

original: vīrasya nu svaśvyaṃ janāsaḥ pra nu vocāma vidurasya devāḥ
analyzed: vīrasya nu su aśvyam janāsaḥ pra nu vocāma vidurasya devāḥ
translated: Shall we proclaim the heroic deeds of the swift one, the wise one, O gods?

original: ṣoḷhā yuktāḥ pañcapañcā vahanti ma / / /
analyzed: ṣoḍhā yuktāḥ pañca pañcā vahanti ma
translated: Sixteen yoked, five by five, carry him...

original: devastvaṣṭā savitā viśvarūpaḥ pupoṣa prajāḥ purudhājajāna
analyzed: devaḥ tvaṣṭā savitā viśva rūpaḥ pupoṣa prajāḥ purudhā ājajāna
translated: God Tvaṣṭar, Savitar, of all forms, nourished the people, born in many places.

original: imā ca viśvā bhuvanānyasya ma / / /
analyzed: imā ca viśvā bhuvanāni asya ma
translated: And all these worlds of his...

original: mahī samairaccamvā samīcī ubhe te asya vasunā nyṛṣṭe
analyzed: mahī samairat camvā samīcī ubhe te asya vasunā nyṛṣṭe
translated: The great one has extended the two equal bowls; both of them are filled with his wealth.

original: śṛṇve vīro vindamāno vasūni ma / / /
analyzed: śṛṇve vīraḥ vindamānaḥ vasūni ma
translated: The hero is heard, obtaining treasures...

original: imāṃ ca naḥ pṛthivīṃ viśvadhāyā upa kṣeti hitamitro narājā🔽puraḥsadaḥ śarmasado na vīrā ma / / /
analyzed: imām ca naḥ pṛthivīm viśva dhāyai upa kṣeti hita mitraḥ na rājā  puraḥsadaḥ śarma sadaḥ na vīrāḥ
translated: And this earth, the supporter of all, he dwells upon, like a king with friendly allies.🔽The one who sits in the east, the one who sits in the shelter, like heroes...

original: niṣṣidhvarīsta oṣadhīrutāpo rayiṃ ta indra pṛthivī bibharti
analyzed: niṣṣidhvarīḥ te oṣadhīḥ uta apaḥ rayim te indra pṛthivī bibharti
translated: The plants and the waters are his barriers, O Indra, the earth supports your wealth.

original: sakhāyaste vāmabhājaḥ syāma ma / / /
analyzed: sakhāyaḥ te vāma bhājaḥ syāma
translated: May we be your friends who share in the good.

original: na tā minanti māyino na dhīrā vratā devānāṃ prathamā dhruvāṇi🔽na rodasī adruhā vedyābhirna parvatā niname tasthivāṃsaḥ
analyzed: na tā minanti māyinaḥ na dhīrāḥ vratā devānām prathamā dhruvāṇi  na rodasī adruhā vedyābhiḥ na parvatāḥ niname tasthivāṃsaḥ
translated: The magicians and the wise do not diminish the first firm vows of the gods.

original: ṣaḍ bhārāneko acaran bibharty ṛtaṃ varṣiṣṭhamupa gāva āguḥ tisro mahīruparāstasthuratyā guhā dve nihitedarśyekā
analyzed: ṣaṭ bhārān ekaḥ a caran bibharti ṛtam varṣiṣṭham upa gāvaḥ āguḥ tisraḥ mahīḥ uparāḥ tasthuḥ atyāḥ guhā dve nihitā idarśī ekā
translated: The two worlds, the two mountains, the two waters, the two trees, the two birds, the two eyes, the two ears, the two nostrils, the two lips, the two arms, the two feet, the two thighs, the two testicles, the two buttocks, the two sides, the two ribs, the two shoulders, the two breasts, the two nipples, the two hands, the two sides of the neck, the two jaws, the two cheeks, the two temples, the two horns, the two hooves, the two hoofs, the two claws, the two tusks, the two teeth, the two lips, the two tongues, the two throats, the two necks, the two heads, the two eyes, the two ears, the two nostrils, the two eyebrows, the two noses, the two foreheads, the two temples, the two cheeks, the two jaws, the two lips, the two teeth, the two tongues, the two throats, the two necks, the two heads, the two eyes, the two ears, the two nostrils, the two eyebrows, the two noses, the two foreheads, the two temples, the two cheeks, the two jaws, the two lips, the two teeth, the two tongues, the two throats, the two necks, the two heads, the two eyes, the two ears, the two nostrils, the two eyebrows, the two noses, the two foreheads, the two temples, the two cheeks, the two jaws, the two lips, the two teeth, the two tongues, the two throats, the two necks, the two heads, the

original: tripājasyo vṛṣabho viśvarūpa uta tryudhā purudha prajāvān
analyzed: tri pājasyaḥ vṛṣabhaḥ viśva rūpaḥ uta tri udhā purudha prajāvān
translated: The bull of three paśus, of universal form, and also threefold, rich in offspring,

original: tryanīkaḥ patyate māhināvān sa retodhā vṛṣabhaḥ śaśvatīnām
analyzed: tri anīkaḥ patyate māhināvān sa retaḥ dhāḥ vṛṣabhaḥ śaśvatīnām
translated: The three-peaked one rules, possessing might. He is the seed-sower, the bull of all that is permanent.

original: abhīka āsāṃ padavīrabodhyādityānāmahve cāru nāma
analyzed: abhīke āsām padavīra bodhya ādityānām ahve cāru nāma
translated: I would awaken the near ones to their stations. I call to the beautiful names of the Ādityas.

original: āpaścidasmā aramanta devīḥ pṛthag vrajantīḥ pari ṣīmavṛñjan
analyzed: āpaḥ cit asmai aramanta devīḥ pṛthak vrajantīḥ pari sīm avṛñjan
translated: Even the waters have rejoiced in him. The goddesses, going in different directions, have surrounded and chosen him.

original: trī ṣadhasthā sindhavastriḥ kavīnāmuta trimātā vidatheṣu samrāṭ🔽ṛtāvarīryoṣaṇāstisro apyāstrirā divo vidathe patyamānāḥ
analyzed: trī sadhasthā sindhavaḥ tris kavīnām uta tri mātā vidatheṣu samrāj  ṛtāvarīḥ yoṣaṇāḥ tisraḥ apyāḥ trirā divaḥ vidathe patyamānāḥ
translated: The rivers have three stations, the sages three, and the all-seeing king three times in the assemblies.🔽The three truthful maidens, the three waters, and the three times ruling in the sky's expanse,

original: trirā divaḥ savitarvāryāṇi divediva ā suva trirno ahnaḥ
analyzed: tris ā divaḥ savitar vāryāṇi dive dive ā suva tris naḥ ahnaḥ
translated: Three times, O Savitar, from the sky, the good things, day by day, do thou send down to us, three times in our day.

original: tridhātu rāya ā suvā vasūni bhaga trātardhiṣaṇe sātaye dhāḥ
analyzed: tri dhātu rāyaḥ ā suva ā vasūni bhaga trātar dhiṣaṇe sātaye dhāḥ
translated: Three times do thou send down the treasures of wealth, O Bhaga, protector, for the sake of support and gain.

original: trirā divaḥ savitā soṣavīti rājānā mitrāvaruṇā supāṇī
analyzed: trirā divaḥ savitā soṣavīti rājānā mitrāvaruṇā su pāṇī
translated: Three times Savitar shines from the sky, the two kings Mitra and Varuṇa with fair hands,

original: āpaścidasya rodasī cidurvī ratnaṃ bhikṣanta savituḥ savāya🔽triruttamā dūṇaśā rocanāni trayo rājantyasurasya vīrāḥ
analyzed: āpaḥ cit asya rodasī cit urvī ratnam bhikṣanta savituḥ savāya  tris uttamā dūṇaśā rocanāni trayaḥ rājanti asurasya vīrāḥ
translated: Even this one, the two wide worlds, and the waters. He begs for treasure for the sake of Savitar's own.🔽Three times the highest, the most distant lights, three times the king's heroic sons shine.

original: ṛtāvāna iṣirā dūḷabhāsastrirā divo vidathe santu devāḥ
analyzed: ṛtāvānaḥ iṣirāḥ dūḍabhāsaḥ trirā divaḥ vidathe santu devāḥ
translated: The truthful, the powerful, the far-shining ones, may the gods be three times in the sky's expanse.

original: pra me vivikvānavidan manīṣāṃ dhenuṃ carantīṃ prayutāmagopām🔽sadyaścid yā duduhe bhūri dhāserindrastadagniḥ panitāro asyāḥ
analyzed: pra me vivikvān avidat manīṣām dhenum carantīm prayutām agopām  sadyas cit yā duduhe bhūri dhāseḥ indraḥ tat agniḥ panitāraḥ asyāḥ
translated: May the discerning one find my thought, the cow that wanders free, unguarded, and well-filled.🔽Even in a moment she has yielded much milk, and Indra and Agni are her milkers.

original: indraḥ su pūṣā vṛṣaṇā suhastā divo na prītāḥ śaśayaṃ duduhre
analyzed: indraḥ su pūṣā vṛṣaṇā su hastā divaḥ na prītāḥ śaśayam duduhre
translated: Indra and Pūṣan, the mighty ones with good hands, have joyfully milked the milk in heaven.

original: viśve yadasyāṃ raṇayanta devāḥ pra vo 'tra vasavaḥ sumnamaśyām
analyzed: viśve yat asyām raṇayanta devāḥ pra vaḥ tra vasavaḥ sumnam aśyām
translated: When all the gods rejoice in this (earth), may we, O Vasus, obtain your favour here.

original: yā jāmayo vṛṣṇa ichanti śaktiṃ namasyantīrjānate garbhamasmin
analyzed: yāḥ jāmayaḥ vṛṣṇe ichanti śaktim namasyantīḥ jānate garbham asmin
translated: The sisters who desire the powerful one, who pay homage, know the embryo in him.

original: achā putraṃ dhenavo vāvaśānā mahaścaranti bibhrataṃ vapūṃṣi
analyzed: achā putram dhenavaḥ vāvaśānāḥ mahaḥ caranti bibhratam vapūṃṣi
translated: The lowing cows approach the son who bears forms, and move around the great one.

original: achā vivakmi rodasī sumeke grāvṇo yujāno adhvare manīṣā
analyzed: achā vivakmi rodasī sumeke grāvṇaḥ yujānaḥ adhvare manīṣā
translated: I will spread out the well-formed heaven and earth, yoking the pressing-stones in the sacrifice with thought.

original: imā u te manave bhūrivārā ūrdhvā bhavanti darśatā yajatrāḥ
analyzed: imāḥ u te manave bhūri vārāḥ ūrdhvāḥ bhavanti darśatāḥ yajatrāḥ
translated: These, O bountiful one, your most excellent ones, O holy one, stand erect for Manu.

original: yā te jihvā madhumatī sumedhā agne deveṣūcyata urūcī
analyzed: yā te jihvā madhumatī sumedhāḥ agne deveṣu ucyate urūcī
translated: That sweet-voiced, well-disposed tongue of yours, O Agni, which is extended, is called among the gods.

original: tayeha viśvānavase yajatrānā sādaya pāyayā cā madhūni
analyzed: tayā iha viśvānavase yajatrānā sādaya pāyaya cā madhūni
translated: With that, O holy one, seat here all the (gods) for help, and make them drink the sweet juices.

original: yā te agne parvatasyeva dhārāsaścantī pīpayad deva citrā
analyzed: yā te agne parvatasya iva dhārāḥ aścantī pīpayat deva citrā
translated: O Agni, that milk of yours which flows like the stream of a mountain, O god, is wonderful.

original: tāmasmabhyaṃ pramatiṃ jātavedo vaso rāsva sumatiṃ viśvajanyām
analyzed: tām asmabhyam pramatim jātavedaḥ vaso rāsva sumatim viśvajanyām
translated: O Jātavedas, O Vasu, grant us that favour which is common to all men.

original: dhenuḥ pratnasya kāmyaṃ duhānāntaḥ putraścarati dakṣiṇāyāḥ
analyzed: dhenuḥ pratnasya kāmyam duhānā antar putraḥ carati dakṣiṇāyāḥ
translated: The cow, yielding the desired object of the ancient one, moves within the daughter of the south.

original: ā dyotaniṃ vahati śubhrayāmoṣasa stomo aśvināvajīgaḥ🔽suyug vahanti prati vām ṛtenordhvā bhavanti pitareva medhāḥ
analyzed: ā dyotanim vahati śubhra yāmā uṣasaḥ stomaḥ aśvinau ajīgaḥ  su yuj vahanti prati vām ṛtena ūrdhvāḥ bhavanti pitarā iva medhāḥ
translated: The bright one carries the light-giving one. The praise, O Aśvins, has been successful.🔽Well-yoked, they carry you according to your desire. They rise up like the thoughts of the father.

original: jarethāmasmad vi paṇermahīṣāṃ yuvoravaścakṛmā yātamarvāk
analyzed: jarethām asmat vi paṇeḥ mahīṣām yuvā uravaḥ cakṛma yātam arvāk
translated: Go away from us, pass over the great ones. We have made your way easy. Come hither.

original: suyugbhiraśvaiḥ suvṛtā rathena dasrāvimaṃ śṛṇutaṃ ślokamadreḥ
analyzed: su yugbhiḥ aśvaiḥ suvṛtā rathena dasrau imam śṛṇutam ślokam adreḥ
translated: With well-yoked horses, with a well-constructed chariot, O wonder-working ones, listen to this hymn of mine.

original: kimaṅga vāṃ pratyavartiṃ gamiṣṭhāhurviprāso aśvinā purājāḥ
analyzed: kim aṅga vām pratyavartim gamiṣṭhā āhuḥ viprāsaḥ aśvinā purājāḥ
translated: What, indeed, is your most frequent return? The ancient priests call you, O Aśvins.

original: ā manyethāmā gataṃ kaccidevairviśve janāso aśvinā havante
analyzed: ā manyethāma ā gatam kaccit devaiḥ viśve janāsaḥ aśvinā havante
translated: I think you should come. For some reason all the people are calling you, O Aśvins.

original: imā hi vāṃ goṛjīkā madhūni pra mitrāso na dadurusro agre
analyzed: imā hi vām goṛjīkā madhūni pra mitrāsaḥ na daduḥ usraḥ agre
translated: For these are your most liberal gifts of honey, which the friends have given you first.

original: tiraḥ purū cidaśvinā rajāṃsyāṅgūṣo vāṃ maghavānā janeṣu
analyzed: tiras purū cit aśvinā rajāṃsi āṅgūṣaḥ vām maghavānā janeṣu
translated: Through many regions, O Aśvins, the praise of you, O bountiful ones, has gone forth among the people.

original: eha yātaṃ pathibhirdevayānairdasrāvime vāṃ nidhayo madhūnām
analyzed: ā iha yātam pathibhiḥ deva yānaiḥ dasrau ime vām nidhayaḥ madhūnām
translated: Come hither by the paths which the gods travel. These are your treasure-houses of honey.

original: purāṇamokaḥ sakhyaṃ śivaṃ vāṃ yuvornarā draviṇaṃ jahnāvyām
analyzed: purāṇam okaḥ sakhyam śivam vām yuvoḥ narā draviṇam jahnāvyām
translated: Your ancient friendship is a safe refuge, O you two, O men, on the Jahnu river

original: punaḥ kṛṇvānāḥ sakhyā śivāni madhvā mademasaha nū samānāḥ
analyzed: punar kṛṇvānāḥ sakhyā śivāni madhvā madema saha nu samānāḥ
translated: Rekindling your auspicious friendships, may we rejoice together with sweet things

original: aśvinā vāyunā yuvaṃ sudakṣā niyudbhiṣ ca sajoṣasā yuvānā
analyzed: aśvinā vāyunā yuvam su dakṣā niyudbhiḥ ca sajoṣasā yuvānā
translated: O Asvins, you two, with Vayu, are very skillful, with the yokes, you two young ones, are of one accord

original: nāsatyā tiroahnyaṃ juṣāṇā somaṃ pibatamasridhā sudānū
analyzed: nāsatyā tiroahnyam juṣāṇā somam pibatam asridhā sudānū
translated: O Nâsatyas, enjoying the day beyond the day, drink the Soma in three ways, O you two who give good gifts

original: aśvinā pari vāmiṣaḥ purūcīrīyurgīrbhiryatamānā amṛdhrāḥ
analyzed: aśvinā pari vā āmiṣaḥ purūcīḥ īyuḥ gīrbhiḥ yatamānāḥ amṛdhrāḥ
translated: O Asvins, many longing ones have been set in motion by the songs, striving with you, the unwearied ones

original: ratho ha vām ṛtajā adrijūtaḥ pari dyāvāpṛthivī yāti sadyaḥ
analyzed: rathaḥ ha vām ṛta jāḥ adri jūtaḥ pari dyāvāpṛthivī yāti sadyas
translated: Your chariot, born of truth, swift as a mountain, goes around heaven and earth in a moment

original: aśvinā madhuṣuttamo yuvākuḥ somastaṃ pātamā gataṃ duroṇe
analyzed: aśvinā madhuṣuttamaḥ yuvākuḥ somaḥ tam pātama gatam duroṇe
translated: O Asvins, the most delightful Soma has been pressed for you; drink it, come to the house

original: ratho ha vāṃ bhūri varpaḥ karikrat sutāvato niṣkṛtamāgamiṣṭhaḥ🔽mitro janān yātayati bruvāṇo mitro dādhāra pṛthivīmuta dyām🔽mitraḥ kṛṣṭīranimiṣābhi caṣṭe mitrāya havyaṃghṛtavajjuhota
analyzed: rathaḥ ha vām bhūri varpaḥ karikrat sutāvataḥ niṣkṛtam āgamiṣṭhaḥ  mitraḥ janān yātayati bruvāṇaḥ mitraḥ dādhāra pṛthivīm uta dyām  mitraḥ kṛṣṭīḥ animiṣā abhi caṣṭe mitrāya havyaṃ ghṛtavat juhota
translated: Your chariot, moving with abundant splendor, has come to the worshipper's house best🔽Mitra, speaking, guides the people. Mitra upholds the earth and the sky.🔽Mitra looks on the cultivated fields with unblinking eyes. Offer oblations mixed with ghee to Mitra.

original: pra sa mitra marto astu prayasvān yasta āditya śikṣati vratena
analyzed: pra sa mitra martaḥ astu prayasvān yaḥ te āditya śikṣati vratena
translated: O Mitra, may that mortal be prosperous who, O Âditya, trains in your vow.

original: na hanyate na jīyate tvoto nainamaṃho aśnotyantito na dūrāt
analyzed: na hanyate na jīyate tvotaḥ na enam aṃhaḥ aśnoti antitas na dūrāt
translated: He is not slain, he is not conquered, he is not overcome by sin, whether near or far.

original: anamīvāsa iḷayā madanto mitajñavo varimannā pṛthivyāḥ
analyzed: anamīvāsaḥ iḷayā madantaḥ mitajñavaḥ variman ā pṛthivyāḥ
translated: Free from sickness, rejoicing in their strength, knowing the measure of the earth's expanse,

original: ādityasya vratamupakṣiyanto vayaṃ mitrasya sumatau syāma
analyzed: ādityasya vratam upakṣiyantaḥ vayam mitrasya sumatau syāma
translated: Approaching the vow of the sun, may we enjoy the favor of Mitra.

original: ayaṃ mitro namasyaḥ suśevo rājā sukṣatro ajaniṣṭa vedhāḥ
analyzed: ayam mitraḥ namasyaḥ su śevaḥ rājā su kṣatraḥ ajaniṣṭa vedhāḥ
translated: This Mitra, to be revered, very gracious, the king of good rule, the creator, is born.

original: tasya vayaṃ / / /
analyzed: tasya vayam
translated: Of him, we...

original: mahānādityo namasopasadyo yātayajjano gṛṇate suśevaḥ
analyzed: mahān ādityaḥ namasā upasadyaḥ yātayat janaḥ gṛṇate su śevaḥ
translated: The great sun, to be revered, to be served, the people who offer sacrifice, very gracious, to the singer.

original: tasmā etat panyatamāya juṣṭamagnau mitrāya havirā juhota
analyzed: tasmai etat panyatamāya juṣṭam agnau mitrāya haviḥ ā juhota
translated: To him, the most excellent, this most acceptable oblation to Mitra, offer in the fire.

original: mitrasya carṣaṇīdhṛto 'vo devasya sānasi
analyzed: mitrasya carṣaṇī dhṛtaḥ vaḥ devasya sānasi
translated: Of Mitra, the supporter of men, the god who prospers,

original: dyumnaṃ citraśravastamam
analyzed: dyumnam citraśravastamam
translated: The glory most famous in variegated fame,

original: abhi yo mahinā divaṃ mitro babhūva saprathāḥ
analyzed: abhi yaḥ mahinā divam mitraḥ babhūva saprathāḥ
translated: He who by his greatness became Mitra, the all-pervading, in heaven,

original: abhi śravobhiḥ pṛthivīm
analyzed: abhi śravobhiḥ pṛthivīm
translated: By his fame, on earth.

original: mitrāya pañca yemire janā abhiṣṭiśavase
analyzed: mitrāya pañca yemire janāḥ abhiṣṭi śavase
translated: To Mitra, for his all-surpassing might, the people have turned in five directions.

original: sa devān viśvān bibharti
analyzed: sa devān viśvān bibharti
translated: He supports all the gods.

original: mitro deveṣvāyuṣu janāya vṛktabarhiṣe
analyzed: mitraḥ deveṣu āyuṣu janāya vṛkta barhiṣe
translated: Mitra, among the gods in their life, for the man who spreads the sacred grass,

original: iṣa iṣṭavratāakaḥ
analyzed: iṣaḥ iṣṭa vratāakaḥ
translated: Has made food for one whose vows are well observed.

original: iheha vo manasā bandhutā nara uśijo jagmurabhi tāni vedasā
analyzed: iha iha vaḥ manasā bandhu tā naraḥ uśijaḥ jagmuḥ abhi tāni vedasā
translated: Here, here, O men, with your mind, the kinsmen, the eager ones, have come to those (sacrifices) with wealth.

original: yābhirmāyābhiḥ pratijūtivarpasaḥ saudhanvanā yajñiyaṃ bhāgamānaśa
analyzed: yābhiḥ māyābhiḥ pratijūti varpasaḥ saudhanvanāḥ yajñiyam bhāgam ānaśa
translated: By those illusions, O Saudhanvanas, you who change your appearance, you have obtained your share in the sacrifice.

original: yābhiḥ śacībhiścamasānapiṃśata yayā dhiyā gāmariṇīta carmaṇaḥ
analyzed: yābhiḥ śacībhiḥ camasān apiṃśata yayā dhiyā gām ariṇīta carmaṇaḥ
translated: By those powers you have fashioned the goblets, by that wisdom you have brought the cow from the skin.

original: yena harī manasā niratakṣata tena devatvam ṛbhavaḥ samānaśa
analyzed: yena harī manasā niratakṣata tena deva tvam ṛbhavaḥ samānaśa
translated: By that mind with which you have fashioned the two bays, O Rbhus, you have attained godhood together.

original: indrasya sakhyam ṛbhavaḥ samānaśurmanornapāto apaso dadhanvire
analyzed: indrasya sakhyam ṛbhavaḥ samānaśuḥ manoḥ napātaḥ apasaḥ dadhanvire
translated: The Rbhus have attained the friendship of Indra together, the sons of Manu have flowed as priests.

original: saudhanvanāso amṛtatvamerire viṣṭvī śamībhiḥ sukṛtaḥ sukṛtyayā
analyzed: saudhanvanāsaḥ amṛta tvam erire viṣṭvī śamībhiḥ su kṛtaḥ su kṛtyayā
translated: The Saudhanvanas have attained immortality, the well-made ones by their good deeds.

original: indreṇa yātha sarathaṃ sute sacānatho vaśānāṃ bhavathāsaha śriyā
analyzed: indreṇa yātha sa ratham sute sacā anathaḥ vaśānām bhavatha a saha śriyā
translated: You go together with Indra in the chariot to the pressed (Soma), and then become the most powerful through glory.

original: na vaḥ pratimai sukṛtāni vāghataḥ saudhanvanā ṛbhavo vīryāṇi ca
analyzed: na vaḥ pratimai su kṛtāni vāghataḥ saudhanvanāḥ ṛbhavaḥ vīryāṇi ca
translated: The performer of good deeds cannot equal your good deeds, O Saudhanvanas, O Rbhus, and your heroic deeds.

original: indra ṛbhubhirvājavadbhiḥ samukṣitaṃ sutaṃ somamā vṛṣasvā gabhastyoḥ
analyzed: indra ṛbhubhiḥ vājavadbhiḥ samukṣitam sutam somam ā vṛṣasva gabhastyoḥ
translated: O Indra, enjoy the Soma that has been pressed by the Rbhus, the powerful ones, in your arms.

original: dhiyeṣito maghavan dāśuṣo gṛhe saudhanvanebhiḥ saha matsvā nṛbhiḥ
analyzed: dhiyā iṣitaḥ maghavan dāśuṣaḥ gṛhe saudhanvanebhiḥ saha matsva nṛbhiḥ
translated: Urged by the thoughts, O bountiful one, in the house of the worshipper, rejoice with the Saudhanvanas, with the men.

original: indra ṛbhumān vājavān matsveha no 'smin savane śacyā puruṣṭuta
analyzed: indra ṛbhumān vājavān matsva iha naḥ smin savane śacyā puruṣṭuta
translated: O Indra, accompanied by the Rbhus, powerful, rejoice here for us at this libation, O you who are much praised, with (your wife) Sacī.

original: imāni tubhyaṃ svasarāṇi yemire vratā devānāṃ manuṣaśca dharmabhiḥ
analyzed: imāni tubhyam svasarāṇi yemire vratā devānām manuṣaḥ ca dharmabhiḥ
translated: These your own laws have been observed, the ordinances of the gods and the duties of men

original: indra ṛbhubhirvājibhirvājayanniha stomaṃ jariturupa yāhi yajñiyam
