analyzed: indra ṛbhubhiḥ vājibhiḥ vājayan iha stomam jarituḥ upa yāhi yajñiyam
translated: O Indra, winning booty with the strong ones, come hither to the worshipper's sacrificial offering

original: śataṃ ketebhiriṣirebhirāyave sahasraṇīthoadhvarasya homani
analyzed: śatam ketebhiḥ iṣirebhiḥ āyave sahasraṇīthā uadhvarasya homani
translated: With a hundred swift ones have they sent forth the strong one to the sacrifice, with a thousand-wayed path, at the offering

original: uṣo vājena vājini pracetā stomaṃ juṣasva gṛṇato maghoni🔽purāṇī devi yuvatiḥ purandhiranu vrataṃ carasi viśvavāre
analyzed: uṣaḥ vājena vājini pracetāḥ stomam juṣasva gṛṇataḥ maghoni  purāṇī devi yuvatiḥ purandhiḥ anu vratam carasi viśva vāre
translated: O Uṣas, O you who are strong with strength, O you who are wise, accept the praise of the one who sings, O you who are rich in treasures🔽O ancient goddess, O young maiden, O you who are rich in food, you follow the vow, O you who are rich in all things

original: uṣo devyamartyā vi bhāhi candrarathā sūnṛtā īrayantī
analyzed: uṣaḥ devi amartyā vi bhāhi candra rathā sūnṛtāḥ īrayantī
translated: O Uṣas, O goddess, shine forth for the mortal, O you who have a chariot drawn by the moon, sending forth pleasant things

original: ā tvā vahantu suyamāso aśvā hiraṇyavarṇāṃ pṛthupājaso ye
analyzed: ā tvā vahantu su yamāsaḥ aśvāḥ hiraṇya varṇām pṛthu pājasaḥ ye
translated: Let the well-yoked horses bring you, the one whose color is gold, the one who has wide splendor, to the sacrifice

original: uṣaḥ pratīcī bhuvanāni viśvordhvā tiṣṭhasyamṛtasya ketuḥ
analyzed: uṣaḥ pratīcī bhuvanāni viśvā ūrdhvā tiṣṭhasi amṛtasya ketuḥ
translated: O Uṣas, you stand upright, the banner of the immortal, facing the worlds in all directions

original: samānamarthaṃ caraṇīyamānā cakramiva navyasyā vavṛtsva🔽ava syūmeva cinvatī maghonyuṣā yāti svasarasya patnī
analyzed: samānam artham caraṇīyamānā cakram iva navyasyā vavṛtsva  ava syūma iva cinvatī maghonī uṣāḥ yāti svasarasya patnī
translated: Seeking the same goal, turn to me as if on a wheel, as the new one does🔽Like a weaver, the rich one, Uṣas, the wife of the lord of the house, moves along

original: svarjanantī subhagā sudaṃsā āntād divaḥ papratha ā pṛthivyāḥ
analyzed: svar janantī subhagā su daṃsāḥ ā antāt divaḥ paprathe ā pṛthivyāḥ
translated: Generating light, the fortunate one, the one with good thoughts, she extends from the end of the sky to the earth

original: achā vo devīmuṣasaṃ vibhātīṃ pra vo bharadhvaṃ namasā suvṛktim🔽ūrdhvaṃ madhudhā divi pājo aśret pra rocanā ruruce raṇvasandṛk
analyzed: achā vaḥ devīm uṣasam vibhātīm pra vaḥ bharadhvam namasā suvṛktim  ūrdhvam madhu dhāḥ divi pājaḥ aśret pra rocanā ruruce raṇva sandṛś
translated: To you, O Goddess Dawn, who shines forth, come; with reverence bring to you the fair hymn.🔽The light has mounted to the sky, the stream of honey; the radiant one shines forth, lovely to behold.

original: ṛtāvarī divo arkairabodhyā revatī rodasī citramasthāt
analyzed: ṛtāvarī divaḥ arkaiḥ abodhyā revatī rodasī citram asthāt
translated: The truthful one, rich in food, has awakened with the rays of heaven; the splendid one has taken up her variegated place in the two great worlds.

original: āyatīmagna uṣasaṃ vibhātīṃ vāmameṣi draviṇaṃ bhikṣamāṇaḥ🔽ṛtasya budhna uṣasāmiṣaṇyan vṛṣā mahī rodasī ā viveśa
analyzed: āyatīm agne uṣasam vibhātīm vāmam eṣi draviṇam bhikṣamāṇaḥ  ṛtasya budhne uṣasām iṣaṇyan vṛṣā mahī rodasī ā viveśa
translated: O Agni, seeking wealth, you go to the shining Dawn who comes in the morning, begging for it.🔽The bull, desiring the dawn of truth, has entered the two great worlds.

original: mahī mitrasya varuṇasya māyā candreva bhānuṃ vi dadhe purutrā
analyzed: mahī mitrasya varuṇasya māyā candrā iva bhānum vi dadhe purutrā
translated: The great magic of Mitra and Varuna, like the moon, spreads its light in many places.

original: imā u vāṃ bhṛmayo manyamānā yuvāvate na tujyā abhūvan
analyzed: imāḥ u vām bhṛmayaḥ manyamānāḥ yuvāvate na tujyāḥ abhūvan
translated: These two, thinking of you, have become like sparks of fire for the young one.

original: kva tyadindrāvaruṇā yaśo vāṃ yena smā sinaṃ bharathaḥ sakhibhyaḥ
analyzed: kva tyad indrāvaruṇāḥ yaśaḥ vām yena smā sinam bharathaḥ sakhibhyaḥ
translated: Where is your glory, O Indra and Varuna, by which you bestow strength on your friends?

original: ayamu vāṃ purutamo rayīyañchaśvattamamavase johavīti
analyzed: ayam u vām purutamaḥ rayīyan śaśvattamam avase johavīti
translated: This one, the most abundant, the most constant, calls you for help.

original: sajoṣāvindrāvaruṇā marudbhirdivā pṛthivyā śṛṇutaṃ havamme
analyzed: sajoṣau indrāvaruṇāḥ marudbhiḥ divā pṛthivyā śṛṇutam havam me
translated: O Indra and Varuna, in accord with the Maruts, listen to my call from heaven and earth.

original: asme tadindrāvaruṇā vasu ṣyādasme rayirmarutaḥ sarvavīraḥ
analyzed: asme tat indrāvaruṇāḥ vasu syāt asme rayiḥ marutaḥ sarva vīraḥ
translated: May that wealth be ours, O Indra and Varuna, may wealth with all heroes be ours, O Maruts.

original: asmān varūtrīḥ śaraṇairavantvasmān hotrā bhāratī dakṣiṇābhiḥ
analyzed: asmān varūtrīḥ śaraṇaiḥ avantu asmān hotrā bhāratī dakṣiṇābhiḥ
translated: May the protectresses with their shelters protect us, may the invocation with its gifts protect us.

original: bṛhaspate juṣasva no havyāni viśvadevya
analyzed: bṛhaspate juṣasva naḥ havyāni viśvadevya
translated: O Brihaspati, accept our offerings, O you of all the deities,

original: rāsva ratnāni dāśuṣe
analyzed: rāsva ratnāni dāśuṣe
translated: Bestow treasures upon the giver.

original: śucimarkairbṛhaspatimadhvareṣu namasyata
analyzed: śucim arkaiḥ bṛhaspatim adhvareṣu namasyata
translated: Worship Brihaspati with pure praises at the sacrifices,

original: anāmyoja ācake
analyzed: anāmi ojaḥ ācake
translated: The unwearied one who is to be invoked.

original: vṛṣabhaṃ carṣaṇīnāṃ viśvarūpamadābhyam
analyzed: vṛṣabham carṣaṇīnām viśva rūpam adābhyam
translated: The bull of men, of all forms, invincible,

original: bṛhaspatiṃvareṇyam
analyzed: bṛhaspatim vareṇyam
translated: Brihaspati, the desirable one.

original: iyaṃ te pūṣannāghṛṇe suṣṭutirdeva navyasī
analyzed: iyam te pūṣan āghṛṇe suṣṭutiḥ deva navyasī
translated: This, O Pusan, is thy praise, O blameless one, O god, the new one,

original: asmābhistubhyaṃ śasyate
analyzed: asmābhiḥ tubhyam śasyate
translated: Is extolled for thee by us.

original: tāṃ juṣasva giraṃ mama vājayantīmavā dhiyam
analyzed: tām juṣasva giram mama vājayantīm avāḥ dhiyam
translated: Accept this speech of mine, which brings strength, and the thought,

original: vadhūyuriva yoṣaṇām
analyzed: vadhūyuḥ iva yoṣaṇām
translated: Like a young woman who delights in her husband.

original: yo viśvābhi vipaśyati bhuvanā saṃ ca paśyati
analyzed: yaḥ viśvā abhi vipaśyati bhuvanā sam ca paśyati
translated: He who sees all the worlds and who sees them together,

original: sa naḥ pūṣāvitā bhuvat
analyzed: sa naḥ pūṣā avitā bhuvat
translated: May that Pusan be our protector.

original: tat saviturvareṇyaṃ bhargo devasya dhīmahi
analyzed: tat savituḥ vareṇyam bhargaḥ devasya dhīmahi
translated: We meditate on the excellent light of that god Savita,

original: dhiyo yo naḥ pracodayāt🔽devasya saviturvayaṃ vājayantaḥ purandhyā
analyzed: dhiyaḥ yaḥ naḥ pracodayāt  devasya savituḥ vayam vājayantaḥ purandhyā
translated: Who may impel our thoughts.🔽We, desiring strength, with devotion,

original: bhagasya rātimīmahe🔽devaṃ naraḥ savitāraṃ viprā yajñaiḥ suvṛktibhiḥ
analyzed: bhagasya rātimīmahe  devam naraḥ savitāram viprāḥ yajñaiḥ suvṛktibhiḥ
translated: We implore the gift of Bhaga.🔽The men, the seers, with sacrifices and good hymns

original: namasyanti dhiyeṣitāḥ
analyzed: namasyanti dhiyā iṣitāḥ
translated: Worship the god Savita, impelled by thought.

original: somo jigāti gātuvid devānāmeti niṣkṛtam
analyzed: somaḥ jigāti gātu vid devānām eti niṣkṛtam
translated: Soma goes, finding the way, to the place of the gods,

original: ṛtasya yonimāsadam
analyzed: ṛtasya yonim āsadam
translated: To the seat of truth.

original: somo asmabhyaṃ dvipade catuṣpade ca paśave
analyzed: somaḥ asmabhyam dvipade catuṣpade ca paśave
translated: Soma, for our two-footed and four-footed cattle,

original: anamīvā iṣas karat
analyzed: anamīvāḥ iṣas karat
translated: make us free from disease and sickness.

original: asmākamāyurvardhayannabhimātīḥ sahamānaḥ
analyzed: asmākam āyuḥ vardhayan abhimātīḥ sahamānaḥ
translated: Increasing our life, overcoming hostilities,

original: somaḥ sadhasthamāsadat
analyzed: somaḥ sadhastham āsadat
translated: Soma has sat down in his place.

original: ā no mitrāvaruṇā ghṛtairgavyūtimukṣatam
analyzed: ā naḥ mitrāvaruṇā ghṛtaiḥ gavyūtim ukṣatam
translated: O Mitra and Varuna, anoint the path of the cows with ghee for us,

original: madhvā rajāṃsi sukratū
analyzed: madhvā rajāṃsi su kratū
translated: O you of good vows, with honey the regions.

original: uruśaṃsā namovṛdhā mahnā dakṣasya rājathaḥ
analyzed: uru śaṃsā namaḥ vṛdhā mahnā dakṣasya rājathaḥ
translated: O you of wide fame, you who increase honor, you rule by the greatness of Daksha,

original: drāghiṣṭhābhiḥ śucivratā
analyzed: drāghiṣṭhābhiḥ śuci vratā
translated: with the most far-reaching pure vows.

original: gṛṇānā jamadagninā yonāv ṛtasya sīdatam
analyzed: gṛṇānā jamadagninā yonau ṛtasya sīdatam
translated: Praised by Jamadagni, sit in the womb of truth.
